219136.description:
For hundreds of millions of citizens of the Sino-Soviet Union, Iosef Stalin is the Supreme Leader, whose wisdom will guide them to victory. For the enemies of the SSU, the name means death. Many of the SSU’s early heavy tanks were named after Kliment Voroshilov, the Defense Commissar. When it was time for a new and improved series, who better to name it after than the Supreme Leader himself?
The “Aleksandr” is the latest version of the IS-5, mounting two impressive Tesla Guns that fire on the same target. The result is devastating again any type of target but particularly against armor. The vehicle is presented here in its Babylon pattern camouflage, as observed around Mesopotamia circa 1947.
219136.name: Dust Tactics: IS-5D Heavy Tesla Tank – "Aleksandr Vasilevsky"

219138.description:
For hundreds of millions of citizens of the Sino-Soviet Union, Iosef Stalin is the Supreme Leader, whose wisdom will guide them to victory. For the enemies of the SSU, the name means death. Many of the SSU’s early heavy tanks were named after Kliment Voroshilov, the Defence Commissar. When it was time for a new and improved series, who better to name it after than the Supreme Leader himself?

The Iosef Stalin super-heavy tank is armed with an efficient combination of weapons, each of which has been proven on other tanks. Its main weapon is a 183mm (7.2”) D-47T gun. Although not designed to destroy vehicles, the mass of this weapon’s round can knock out any tank, no matter how heavy. Its powerful explosive shell is overkill against infantry, but is death to bunkers.

The secondary weapon is an ATO-45B flamethrower mounted alongside the main gun. It is ideal for destroying infantry in buildings and strongpoints. That’s if there are still some in range when the Iosef Stalin gets there. Usually there’s only wreckage left, or the enemy has fled.
219138.name: Dust Tactics: IS-5C Heavy Assault Tank – "Iosef Stalin"

219139.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Death Drifter Crossover
219139.description:
Legend claims that there was once a man whi willed himself back from in-existence, event the Phoenix's time manipulation couldn't stop him. With no memory of his time, the Drifter wonders the stonescape for the Hooded Knight, as he recognizes it's sword to be the key to understand when he is.

Contains:
1 Drifter Miniature
Drifter Small Booklet
Story Events (est 1-2)
Hyper Light Philosophy
Secret Fighting Art
3 Gear Cards

Drifter is classified as a "Wanderer", which is a new campaign-related system introduced in the Advanced KDM rulebook.

219140.description: Since 1943 the ISU format, a heavy self-propelled gun mounted on a tank chassis, has become a staple of the SSU armored forces. Easy and cheap to build, efficient and deadly, these vehicles are now found everywhere on the planet where the SSU fights. The “Sergei” is the latest version and mounts a 203mm D-30S very heavy gun, capable of knocking out any enemy armored target. The vehicle is presented here in its Babylon pattern camouflage, as observed around Mesopotamia circa 1947.
219140.name: Dust Tactics: ISU-203 Heavy Assault Gun – "Sergei Shtemenko"

219141.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Lantern Year 3 Condy & Cola Crossover
219141.description:
It's been 3 long Lantern Years, but Candy & Cola continue to survive in the nightmare horror world of Kingdom Death!

Wielding her broken heel as a weapong, Candy & Cola have just escaped from the Traveler's arena of death.

The Traveler is a huge entity moving on hundreds of pairs of horse-like legs. Those that hear its deep horn-bellow are drawn to the constatly moving titan, where they are forced to fight to the death for the amusement of its dark passengers.

Contains:
1 Miniatures
1 Small Booklet
Story Events (est 1-2)
Unique Base Insert
Candypopism Philosophy
Secret Fightning Art
3 Gear Cards

Lantern Year 3 Candy & Cola is classified as a "Wanderer" which is a new campaign-related system introduced in the Advanced KDM rulebook.

219142.name: Sea Wolf (Commodore)
219142.description:
User Summary
Port of Sea Wolf
Supports two player where the arcade it it ported from only support one player.

Require paddles to play


Sea Wolf is time-limited, with the player having an opportunity to win bonus time by reaching an operator-set score. The player's score is shown on the bottom half of the screen as well as the high score, one of the first known instances of a high score in a video game. Targets include destroyers, a fast-moving PT boat, and mines floating across the screen that serve as obstructions.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_Wolf_%28video_game%29 Sea Wolf (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

In 1982 Commodore International produced ports of Sea Wolf for the Commodore VIC-20 and then-new Commodore 64 computers, released in cartridge form

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_Wolf_%28video_game%29%23Ports Sea Wolf (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

219143.name: MedioEvo Universale: Additional Player Expansion
219143.description: Each additional player expansion for MedioEvo Universalis includes 96 miniatures, 1 player board, 1 player screen and 25 additional metal coins.

219146.name: Oink! (1987)
219146.description:
User Summary
Based on the British comic magazine.

Find missing pages for the Uncle Pigg, the chief editor by completing various mini-games

219147.name: 4 Most Toppers
219147.description:
User Summary
Collection of four top games on one tape. Two on each side.

219148.name: Yeti
219148.description:
User Summary
You've found the Yeti - now it's time to hunt it down! But it is in a forbidden area - you try to survive weather, traps, and enemies in order to reach the Yeti and hunt it down

219149.name: Flunky
219149.description:
From cover
Wanna job?
There's a weird one going in that famous house at the end of London's Mall. Yes, this is your chance to be a really creepy, crawly flunky in Buck House!
But you'll need a few qualifications to make the frade as menial mansercant. Any good at bomb disposal, fighting rats, avouding homicidal guards and chatting up the Royals? Quick reactions and strong nerves will earn you your pay. But win or lose, remember - life is never dull for a flunky!

A Don Priestley game.


Flunky (sometimes known as Mad Flunky) is a computer game programmed by Don Priestley and released in 1987 for the ZX Spectrum, Commodore 64 and Amstrad CPC home computers. It was published by Piranha Games. It is notable for Priestley's large, colourful graphics which, on the Spectrum, avoid attribute clash problems

The player takes control of a flunky in the service of the British Royal Family. The flunky is given orders by various members of the family which he must carry out. When he is successful in completing a task, he can obtain an autograph from the satisfied individual. Once he has successfully completed tasks for several persons he can go on to perform the final task for The Queen herself.

The player controls the flunky as he moves around Buckingham Palace, carrying out orders that members of the Royal Family will give him. The flunky can only be given one task to do at a time. The solutions needed to complete the tasks range from the correct use of items in the correct places to tasks requiring skillful playing more reminiscent of action games.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flunky_%28video_game%29 Flunky (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

219150.name: 4 Most Big Hits
219150.description:
User Summary
A compilation of four hits for Commodore and ZX Spectrum

219152.name: Humm-Dinger
219152.description:
User Summary
Box title: Humm-Dinger
Ingame title: Hummdinger

Fly with your jet-pack and shoot waves of aliens and avoid running out of fuel (you loose fuel by flying, by being shot by the aliens, touching them or letting the icon they drop touch the ground).

219153.name: 4 Most Megaheroes
219153.description:
User Summary
Four games with heroes for Commodore 64. The Rogue Trooper (1986) in this compilation is the Space Trooper version

219154.name: The Goat King
219154.description:
From publisher blurb:

When an entire village’s goats disappear overnight, there can be but one explanation. When a siren, deep-throated bleating sounds from the hills, the goats answer the cry of their king. A Goat King is a mysterious creature that traipses through the world, calling its kin from their bondage in human settlements. Goats and men alike can hear their calls for miles, and goats will go to any length to free themselves and flee into the woods to join their King.

A beast the size of a draft horse, verging on some two thousand pounds, combining aspects of goat and dragon. It has a long, reptilian, bisected tail and an odd wattle like a dragon’s wings, with multicolored horns and a flickering serpent’s tongue. Otherwise, its body is much like a goat’s - absent the front legs.

Capable of living on near any sustenance due to its roiling stomach fluids, the Goat King can also exhale those fluids in a searing cloud of toxic gas to kill its foes.

Goats summoned to their king undergo a slow, insidious transformation. Over the course of a few days with the creature, they slowly gain a malign intelligence - rising to the pseudo-awareness of the King itself. Reports from distant lands even say that those creatures which spend enough time - months or years - with the king slowly transform into foul Goat-Men, building a society which is a cruel mockery of a human one. Slaying the goat king immediately reverses the transformation and frees the goats, which usually return to their homes.

219155.name: Implosion
219155.description:
User Summary
A planet is on coalision course with earth! Your task is to fly to the hurling planet, enter it and make it implode, but the planet's inhabitants are protecting their home

219156.name: 4 Most Air Power
219156.description:
User Summary
Collection of four games about some sort of flying: some are space, some are military

219157.name: S*M*A*S*H*E*D
219157.description:
User Summary
A game that makes a parody on the TV-series M*A*S*H (Mobile Army Surgical Hospital), where you act as the newly-qualified surgeon, Pigseye Peers (Benjamin Frankin "Hawkeye" Pierce in the TV-series) resently joined the S*M*A*S*H*E*D (Strangest Mobile Army Surgical Hospital East of Detroit) unit at in the Korean War.

Your still is lost, and you have to find it - somewhere in Korea!

219158.name: 4 Most Adventures
219158.description:
User Summary
Adventure time!
Four adventure games on one cassette

219159.description:
Race to the middle of the board by moving your tiles like chess pieces. With timely moves, you can place your opponent in a state of DURESS!

Duress is a two-player strategic board game. It is intended for adults and children ages 8 and up.

Each player has 16 tiles with different letters (A through P). These same tiles are arranged as Goal Pieces in the middle of the board. The Goal Pieces are arranged symmetrically, equidistant from the two players. Once a layout is selected, the Goal Pieces are arranged in a random order. The two players may also decide to take turns selecting the placement of the individual tiles, which adds strategy to the game.

There are also Movement Pieces corresponding to chess pieces. In a classic game of Duress, there are 16 Movement Pieces: 8 pawns, 2 rooks, 2 knights, 2 bishops, 1 queen, and 1 king.

Once the Goal Pieces are arranged, the two players take turns. In a single turn, the player:

a) Selects a Movement Piece at random.

b) Selects one of the tiles to move.

c) Moves the selected tile to a new location based on the Movement Piece. Other tiles can block the movements of the pieces, creating opportunities for strategic play.

Players score points by landing their pieces on the corresponding Goal Pieces before the opponent can get there. So, the two A tiles are racing to reach the A in the Goal Pieces. The same goes for each letter.

A player wins the game by scoring a majority of the points.

There are many opportunities to change the structure of the game:

a) Each game randomizes the order of the Goal Pieces, creating a different strategic challenge for the players.

b) Players can take turns selecting the order of the Goal Pieces, creating additional strategy. When one player goes first in the selection, and the other goes first in moving pieces, the potential for a first player's bias can be mitigated.

c) The players may create alternative layouts for the board.

d) As an alternative, players may select and hold 3 pieces. This allows for planning moves in advance. With each turn, the player will select one of the three movement pieces, move a tile, return this piece to the bag, and randomly select a new one.

With many potential variations, no two games of Duress are exactly alike.
219159.name: Duress

219160.name: Punks: The Game – Nutpuncher!
219160.description:
A twelve card, two player, print and play game derived from the first issue of Punks THE COMIC by Joshua Fialkov and Kody Chamberlain.

Players assume the role of either Dog or Skull and take the corresponding 6 cards into their hand.

These include:
2 x Attack Cards
2 x Defense Cards
1 x Nut Puncher
1 x Bummer

Players put down one card each on the count of 3. Winner of each individual turn gets a point. Nut Puncher v Nut Puncher = 1 point each.

Defense > Attack
Attack > Nut Puncher
Nut Puncher > Defense
Bummer = Void Hand

If you both play the same category of card the hand is void.

Winner with most points at end of hand wins the round.
Winner of the most rounds gets a "punch in the nuts" or firm handshake.

219162.name: Expedition Cards
219162.description:
From the back of the box:

Expedition is an "app & cards" roleplaying game for adventurers of all levels. One to six players, ages 10+ can play through epic adventures in under an hour.

User summary:

The physical cards are available as a printed, boxed product or as a free PDF download for print-and-play use (double-sided cardstock printing suggested). The cards are required for play.

219163.name: Expedition App
219163.description:
From the back of the box:

Expedition is an "app & cards" roleplaying game for adventurers of all levels. One to six players, ages 10+ can play through epic adventures in under an hour.

User summary:

The free app can be obtained via the standard app stores by searching for "Expedition Card Game". To learn how to play, select the "Tutorial" option from the app. The app is required for play.

219164.name: A Short Term Contract
219164.description:
From the introduction:

A Short Term Contract is a stand-alone adventure designed for a single session of play. While it is designed to be played as a single adventure scenario more adventures involving the Non-Player Character Mr. Meeks will follow. Several story tags are introduced in the adventure for use in following adventures or for your use in your own campaigns.

An adventure for First level characters.

219165.name: Blood & Mistletoe
219165.description:
From the introduction:

A druid is dead. Her corpse was found strangled in the streets of Fisherman’s Way, just outside of the Drowned Man Tavern.

Investigators are saying there are no witnesses. No clues to follow. They are writing it off as a lost cause and are saying sometimes these things just happen.

User summary:

A winter-themed adventure for 5th - 10th level characters.

219166.name: Igor's Challenge
219166.description:
A 3-4 hour, non-lethal, funhouse dungeon suitable for any campaign or one-shot

From the introduction:

Igor Larionov is an eccentric Gnome inventor renowned around the world. He has sent out invitations to adventuring groups to come and compete for his latest, greatest invention. The competition will take place a few days hence in Penthill and consist of a race through his specially created challenge-dungeon. Your group has received one such invitation.

User summary:

Suitable for characters of any level.

219167.name: Visions of the Vault: One Page Dungeons: Crypt of the Pale Vein
219167.description:
From the introduction:

The chapel, once populated by the priests and priestesses of Eldath has now been desecrated by cult of necromancers who sought its secrets to prolonged life.

User summary:

Suitable for characters of any level.

219168.name: La Sagesse de Vallandar
219168.description:
Une courte aventure pour quatre à six personnages joueurs de niveau 1 à 3

From the introduction:

Il s'agit d'un scénario simple pour joueurs débutants se déroulant dans un cadre souterrrain. Les PJs se rencontrent dans le petit village du Pont aux Haches: Bretuald, le curé de la paroisse, va entrainer les compagnons dans une expédition.

User summary:

A fan-made, abridged, French-language translation, and system conversion of "King Under the Forest", a concise adventure originally appearing in Chapter 9 of Dragon Warriors and subsequently revised and reprinted as "The King Under the Forest" in Chapter 2 of Sleeping Gods.

219169.name: Le Territoire des Ombres
219169.description:
Une courte aventure pour quatre personnages joueurs de niveau 2 à 3

From the introduction:

Il s'agit d'une courte aventure qui convient à une expédition composée en majorité d'aventuriers peu expérimentés. Les personnages sont appelés au manoir du village par Messire Béorn, l'intendant du seigneur des lieux. Il leur assigne pour mission de se rendre dans une étrange vallée envahie par les brumes. Un revenant hante ces contrées, où fut jadis ensevelie la dépouille d'un roi. Les aventuriers doivent retrouver certains objets et les remettre à Béorn.

User summary:

A fan-made, abridged, French-language translation, and system conversion of "A Shadow on the Mist", a concise adventure originally appearing in Chapter 6 of The Way of Wizardry and subsequently revised and reprinted in Chapter 3 of Sleeping Gods.

219170.name: La Citadelle de Kervala
219170.description:
Une courte aventure pour quatre à six personnages joueurs de niveau 1 à 3

From the introduction:

Cette aventure suit l'expédition sur le Territoire des Ombres. Les aventuriers voguent vers le nord en compagnie du baron Aldred. Au cours de la traversée, le bateau essuie une tempéte et doit mouiller à l'abri d'une baie pour réparer les avaries. Une citadelle en ruines est visible de la côte. Les aventuriers doivent l'explorer pour s'assurer qu'aucun danger ne menace. Cette aventure se situe dans le prolongement de l'expédition menée sur le territoire des ombres.

User summary:

A fan-made, abridged, French-language translation, and system conversion of "Hunter's Moon", a concise adventure originally appearing in Chapter 6 of The Way of Wizardry and subsequently revised and reprinted in Chapter 4 of Sleeping Gods.

219171.name: Le Dieu Borgne
219171.description:
Une courte aventure pour quatre personnages joueurs de niveau à 4 à 5

From the introduction:

La nuit est tombée sur les domaines du Baron Aldred. Emmitouflés dans de chaudes fourrures, vous montez la garde sur les remparts du château. L'hiver a drapé la contrée d'un linceul de givre et, dans l'air glacé de la nuit, le paysage se découpe avec une étonnante précision. Le ciel hivernal s'est paré de milliers d'étoiles comme autant de diamants. Il est dit que par de telles nuits, les magiciens attentifs peuvent percevoir la musique des sphères... Pétrifiés de froid, vous lancez des regards envieux vers la grande salle, où les feux crépitent joyeusement dans l'âtre, teintant de couleurs chaudes le papier huilé des fenêtres. Votre tour de garde va bientôt prendre fin et vous attendez impatiemment la relève pour aller vous réchauffer devant la cheminée.

User summary:

A fan-made, abridged, French-language translation, and system conversion of "The One-Eyed God", a concise adventure originally appearing in Chapter 5 of Out of the Shadows and subsequently revised and reprinted in Chapter 5 of Sleeping Gods.

219172.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 238 - 2016)
rpgissuearticle: All Things Magic: Cap of Memory
Back Room at the Games Pit
Denizens of Tellene: Sir Jaran Anel and Delara Tareva
In the Court of the Khan
Rustlers of the Night: The Kryzaar
219172.description:
"Planet of the Chimps"
Cover by George Vrbanic

219173.name: La Mort en Hiver
219173.description:
Une aventure pour 4 joueurs de niveau 2

From the introduction:

La contrée au Nord de l’Albonie est une vaste étendue rocailleuse, sillonnée de profondes vallées et semée de lacs de montagne. Ses habitants sont des Mercaniens venus des îles plus au nord, ou bien ayant traversé le Mergeld.

219174.name: Cauchemar Nocturne
219174.description:
Une courte aventure pour personnages joueurs de niveau 3 à 5

From the introduction:

Les PJs sont contactés (s'ils sont étroitement liés,ou entendent parler, s'ils ne sont associés à aucun temple)pour résoudre le probléme de la disparition des prêtres. De plus, les survivants aimeraient savoir s'il est possible de mettre fin aux cauchemars qui frappent le temple et si les disparitions y sont liées.

219175.name: Le Coeur de Glace
219175.description:
Une courte aventure pour quatre à six personnages joueurs de niveau 3 à 5

From the introduction:

Les cimes des Monts Flocons (les Monts Pagan pour les habitants résidant à plus d'une journée de voyage) proches ont de tout temps été la demeure de Gwaenhael Mac Thurel, un vieux et puissant druide des glaces.

219176.name: Le Tyran des Alaces
219176.description:
Une aventure pour 4 à 6 joueurs de niveau 5 à 7

From the introduction:

La contrée au Nord de l’Albonie est une vaste étendue rocailleuse, sillonnée de profondes vallées et semée de lacs de montagne. Ses habitants sont des Mercaniens venus des îles plus au nord, ou bien ayant traversé le Mergeld.

219177.description:
The Inverted Mountain Campaign expansion combines the Frog Dog, Oblivion Mosquito, Pariah, Black Knight, Red Witches, Nightmare Ram, and Gryphon expansions into one campaign! Complete with unique story events, innovations, gear, hunt event cards, settlement event and all the bells and whistles. Guide the People of the Mountain. Struggle with them to survive. Climb the treacherous Inverted Mountain. Battle the Man that sites alone, atop it all!

Includes:
1 x Rulebook (30-50+ pages)
1 x Mountain Man Miniature (50mm)
3 x Trapdoor Men/Thrall Miniatures (30mm)
4 x Mountain Dungeon Armor Narrative sculpts
2 x New Hybrid Armor Set Narrative sculpts
2 x Visionary Survivor Narrative sculpts
1 x Apotheosis Male
1 x Apotheosis Female
100+ x Game Cards
12 x Settlement Event cards
1 x Inverted Mountain Settlement record pad
1 x Inverted Mountain Character record pad
and more!
219177.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Inverted Mountain Campaign Expansion

219178.name: Les Fantômes d'Aniel
219178.description:
Une aventure pour 4 joueurs de niveau 5 à 7

From the introduction:

Aniel est un hameau forestier du peuple elfe qui se trouve dans les profondeurs du Bois de l'araignée, sur les terres du royaume d'Albonie . Comme beaucoup de communauté elfe celui-ci évite au maximum les contacts avec l'extérieur, et plus particuliérement avec les humains. Cependant, depuis une semaine environ, tout contact avec aniel a complétement cessé.

219179.name: Une Nécropole en Péril
219179.description:
Une courte aventure pour quatre à six personnages joueurs de niveau 6 à 9

From the introduction:

En dépit de leur majesté et de leur beauté, les montagnes peuvent se révéler périlleuses et mortelles. Même les peuples habitués à la rigueur de ce type de terrain succombent parfois à ses dangers.

219180.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 239 - 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
Denizens of Tellen: Kozi and Laka
Indy Game Scene: Apocalypse Prevention Inc.
Rustlers of the Night: Slavering Gorger
219180.description:
"Don't Roll A One"
Cover by Luke Ahearn

219181.description:
The Silver City expansion dramatically changes up the mid-late game, introducing itself around Lantern Year 12 or 13. Survivors of the settlement can choose to make trips into the Silver City, for a very different game experience. This expansion will rewrite a chunk of the game timeline, ending with a climactic battle with the Lion God.

You will encounter bone-eating madmen, wearing silverlight jellyfish skin, old half-working guardians, silverlight jellyfish, leaping octopi, the Lost Knight, and more!
219181.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – The Silver City Expansion

219182.description: Love Letter: Erweiterung contains ten new characters for use with the Love Letter base game to allow up to eight players in a game.
219182.name: Love Letter: Erweiterung

219183.name: Timmy räumt auf
219183.description:
Oh, no! The apartment is a mess, with things scattered everywhere — time to clean up! Luckily, Timmy has some children over who can bring everything to the right place.

In Timmy räumt auf, the players take turns rolling dice to move Timmy around the apartment and find items that fit into the color-coded rooms. Each room should have three objects in it, and whoever finds the last missing item in a room earns a point. When the house is tidy, the player with the most points wins.

219184.name: Ceux qui Font des Faibles Leur Proie!
219184.description:
Pour un groupe de quatre aventuriers de niveau 4 à 5

From the introduction:

Cette aventure peut débuter dans les jours qui suivent la chute du météore, à environ 80 kilométres du point d'impact. Une petite colonie a vu sa population enfler avec quantité de réfugiés qui ont échappé à la mort et ont fuit la destruction. Beaucoup avaient pour but de se rendre dans ce village aprés que le leur ait été détruit, mais plus encore n'avaient aucun endroit où se rendre.

219185.name: Sabrina Stachelschwein
219185.description:
Bang, pow! Someone didn't think ahead clearly when the animals' balloon party was planned and Sabrina the porcupine was invited.

In Sabrina Stachelschwein, each player has a number of balloon cards on the table in front of them, with the balloons having different values and all of the balloons being placed in a circle. Sabrina wants to say "hello" to all of her friends, so she keeps running around the circle, with her movement determined by a die roll. Wherever she stops, the balloon pops, with that card being placed on a discard pile. Sabrina can circle in either direction, and players can add new balloons to the table as well.

Once one player runs out of balloons, the game ends, and whoever owns the most valuable balloons wins.

219186.name: Le Bois de Sang
219186.description:
From the introduction:

Depuis le premier jour où ils ont vu le Lac-océan, les réfugiés ont surnommé leur nouvelle patrie Bord-du-Lac. La grande étendue d'eau est indispensable pour vivre dans la région, pas seulement parce qu'elle fournit nourriture et moyens de subsistances pour la plupart de ses habitants humains, mais pour une foule d'autres raisons aussi bonnes. Les eaux relativement chaudes du lac rendent le climat local moins rigoureux qu'il ne le serait autrement. Le lac fournit aussi un accés fiable mais pas très rapide aux cultures extérieures et aux marchandises - pas assez éloignée pour commercer, mais suffisamment pour éviter d'etre ennuyé. Les habitants sont également de bons artisans, poétes, et philosophes.

219187.name: La Légion Perdue
219187.description:
Une courte aventure pour six personnages joueurs de niveau 7

From the introduction:

Au septentrion de l'Empire de Sélentine se dressent les Monts du Dragon. Ces montagnes interdites sont réputées mortelles et renferment les ruines de la demeure du tyran Dramojh's, un ancien seigneur Asmulien corrompu.

219188.name: La Nuit de l'Homme de Paille
219188.description:
Une épreuve pour 5 joueurs de niveau 1

From the introduction:

Le peuple supersticieux du hameau de Chute-sous-clocher et de la campagne alentour célébre un jour férié étrange appelé: Le jour de l'homme de paille. Toute cette journée, chaque villageois transporte ici et là un personnage petit, grossier et humanoide fait de paille, en chuchotant les péchés qu'il ou elle a commis durant l'année écoulée.

219189.name: La Pierre d'Asséchement
219189.description:
From the introduction:

L'aventure intitulée La pierre d'asséchement commence alors que les personnages se trouvent dans les Principautés de la croisade. Une zone aride et désertique où ils auront à combattre un gobelours et sa bande de pillards qui asséchent tous les points d'eau de la région grâce à une pierre magique capable d'absorber d'énormes quantitées de liquide.

User summary:

For low-level characters.

219190.name: Katz & Schmaus
219190.description:
Cats love treats, but these kittens are somewhat selective and prefer to eat only certain colors of treats.

In Katz & Schmaus, players need to try to feed the cats the right treats, but they see these treats only at the beginning of their turn, after which they're hidden. Someone attempts to assign a treat to the proper cat by shaking the game boxes. If someone thinks that a cat is getting the wrong treat, though, they can grab the cat figure from the center of the table to call out the shaker and have them open the box. If the doubter was right, they receive the treat as a reward, but otherwise the shaker collects the treat.

In the end, whoever collects the most delicious treats wins.

219191.name: La Tombe Perdue d'Amarak
219191.description:
From the introduction:

De nombreux lanceurs de sorts puissants ont vécu et sont morts durant la période de l'ancienne Néthéril. Un jeu morbide qui avait gagné en popularité dans les derniéres années de cette nation consistait en une lutte informelle entre les magiciens du royaume pour savoir lequel serait à même de construire le caveau le plus dangereux et inviolable pour leur éventuelle inhumation. Nombres de ces sorciers utilisérent des esclaves pour tester leur tombe, et amélioraient souvent la situation de ceux qui survivaient. Un de ces mages les plus conservateurs était un maitre élémentaliste de l'air: Amarak le Vaporeux.

User summary:

For low-level characters.

219192.name: Les Pierres Noires de Kovag-Re
219192.description:
Aventure pour quatre personnages de niveau 1 à 3

From the introduction:

'Pére, parle moi encore du Culte des Pierres de Sang'. Le jeune garçon regardait son parent plus agé les yeux débordants d'avidité et d'une pointe de peur. De l'autre coté de la table, le vieil homme posa sa coupe de vin et jeta un regard vers son fils. Il ne dit rien durant un moment puis se mit soudain à parler d'une voix grave chargée de menace, les yeux scintillants de la même maniére que ceux des meilleurs conteurs.

219193.name: Ghost Catchers
219193.description:
The midnight hour has arrived, and the ghosts are now pressing their noses against the window — but they're scared of their own shadows, so who can find the right shadow to drive them to flight?

Each turn in Ghost Catchers (a.k.a. Gespenster am Fenster), one of the ghosts arrives at the window, and players compete to find the proper shadow for this ghost to scare it away. Whoever thinks they have the right shape, places the transparent card on the ghost and if they're correct, the ghost flees and the player scores. The shadows are all similar, however, and you can try to scare each ghost only once, so look carefully!

The game can played with children from age 4-1/2 and up, with the number of ghosts in play being adjusted to make the game more difficult for older players.

219194.name: 21 Starport Places Second Edition
219194.description:
From publisher blurb:

Location! Location! Location!

Do your characters need a place to have some fun? Do they need a place where they can eat? Do they need a place to rest their heads? We've got a place for all those things and more!

21 Starport Places provides 21 new and varied locations designed to be used with our Clement Sector setting but could be useful in any science fiction. Places as varied as The Lucky Horseshoe Casino, The Plasma Nightclub, a Second Reformation Church chapel, and a trauma unit.

Visit Big Al's Biscuits! Have your ship customized in The Chrome Shop! Compete against your friends at Holowars!

21 Starport Places provides full descriptions of all 21 places as well as NPCs who might be encountered there. In addition, each location has a detailed floor plan.

Like all our products, the main intention of this book is to provide an extra spark to the Referee's imagination.

219195.name: Gute Nacht Monster
219195.description:
Okay, don't panic now, but monsters are lying underneath your bed. You're quite sure of this because you've seen them first-hand — but wait? How many were there? What color were they? And couldn't some of them actually have been teddy bears?

In Gute Nacht Monster, players roll six dice each round, with the dice showing monsters and teddy bears in three different colors. All players need to remember these dice as quickly as they can because the dice then disappear under the bed and a task card is revealed, with players being asked, for example, how many green monsters are present. All players answer in secret, and whoever is correct moves their figure one step closer to the light switch. Whoever manages to turn on the light wins!

219196.name: Leyline Qualities
219196.description:
From publisher blurb:

This installment of Everyman Minis includes: 1,000 words discussing ley line qualities, new powers and effects representing the strange and often occult ways in which ley lines warp the very land surrounding them.

219197.name: Zeus
219197.description:
From publisher blurb:

King of the Gods

Zeus (PL 16) fell to Earth after Hecate banished the gods from Olympus. Unable to return, Zeus concealed his identity and focused his knowledge and resources to assist Earth's heroes battle the forces of evil.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes what you need is a character everyone will recognize, even if they’ve never met her before.

219198.name: Unnatural Stories
219198.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unnatural Stories is the second official adventure specially written for the table-top/roleplaying game Drudge!

This booklet contains FIVE adventure ideas for Drudge!

In All Out War two combat groups meet on the battle field. The adventure is written for Vietnam war era, World War II or Hundreds' Year War – but it is easily converted to any similar conflict.
The Space Station brings an alien problem to the explorers of our Solar System. This is either an easy action adventure – or a more advanced horror episode with a twist!
The Assassination calls for the death of an evil dictator – but can also be converted to a mafia episode. Your choice!
In Beer Run a trucker makes a bet to smuggle beer between two states. This is another version of the adventure Convoy, included in the core rule book.
The Mysterious Maze transports a small group of people who never met before, to a weird maze. This adventure includes four different versions that can be expanded upon.




Each of these five adventures are written without any NPC data or other values or tables. Mainly, this is because most of these adventures should be converted by a Game Master (or in some cases the players) based upon what models and terrain you have access to. Most of these adventures does not use NPC – but can be expanded to include NPC if GM or the players feel the need for this.

219199.name: Bumper Bots
219199.description:
This crokinole-style game has players using an elastic band to shoot wooden discs into the centre of the game board, or into an opponent's area of the game board, to earn points.

From the box:
"Get rid of all of your discs by slinging them straight or ricocheting them on your opponent's side of the board. Do you have the aim or will you be eliminated from the game?!"

219200.name: Skylight Freerange 2: Gachduine
219200.description:
After a powerful biotechnology was legalized in 2048 in Canada, the Cult of the Symbiote forced their way in as regulators in the Maritimes. Despite their presentation as protectors and healers, the Cult has ruined many lives with their ambitions. As tensions escalate and boiling points are reached, lines will blur, gray areas will clash and the shadow group Gachduine will make choices that have a very real impact for Nova Scotia...

Source: The Publisher Website.

219201.name: Bushido: Koji & Koji's pack
219201.description:
Koji has been waiting as patiently as he could for his time to protect all he holds dear. Since he turned away a lone ninja Koji has finally been allowed that chance by the temple elders. Individually Koji and his macaques would fall quickly but united they stand. The shared love and loss of Kita has cemented the bond between boy and monkeys to something akin to brotherhood, each willing to fall in place of the next.
Blister contains four miniatures, four 30mm bases and two full colour profile cards.

219202.name: Bushido: Hotaru
219202.description:
Hotaru thanks the Kami’s for guiding her to the Temple of Ro-Kan and Master Ekusa. She has learned to contain her powers but still fears unleashing her full potential. Hotaru’s desire to control her innate abilities provides little comfort for opponents left ablaze by her fiery attacks. The Temple have found a welcome addition to their order in Hotaru.

Blister contains one miniature, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

219203.name: Bushido: Master Po
219203.description:
Master Po’s return has caused quite a stir in the halls of the temples of Ro-Kan. His jovial presence has lifted morale of every monk from the initiates, to his fellow masters. Po’s manipulation of Ki belies his rotund appearance allowing him to be deadly in close combat, many have been caught cold as the big man lands hammering blows.
Blister contains one miniature, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

219204.name: Bushido: Minor Kami of Fire and Water
219204.description:
The extent of the unbalance facing the world is highlighted by the emergence of these minor Kamis. While they are a mere shadow in comparison to their godlike brethren they nevertheless have brought their not insignificant powers to bear in the name of the Temple of Ro-Kan. They allow the monks to do what they do best.
Blister contains two miniatures, two 30mm bases and two full colour profile cards.

219205.name: APEX: An Otherverse America Sourcebook
219205.description:
From publisher blurb:

While the Otherverse America core rulebook details life within the Choicer and Lifer pseudo-nations, this sourcebook details life within neutral-territory America, and focuses heavily on the 22nd Century's premier military: APEX.

APEX is America's most elite metahuman strike force, which operates independently of the Choicer pseudo-nation, and is based in the Washington D.C. Metroplex. APEX was founded during the 2020s, so the United States military would have access to a post-human army equal to anything fielded by other nations, terror groups and independent operators like RAINBOW Liberty. APEX is a check on the ever growing numbers of metahuman vigilantes, non-governmental organizations, terror cells and private security teams.

APEX troops are among the best trained and best equipped in the Americas, drilled extensively in urban tactics, counter-terrorism, and anti-Powered warfare. In addition to exemplary training, APEX troops are enhanced with military grade genemods, combat focused object philosophy indoctrination and the best cyber-enhancement protocol money can buy. A single veteran APEX super soldier is designed to be a match for a full enemy light platoon, despite the huge costs involved in training and molding a soldier to that level.

Included in this massive sourcebook are a host of new player races. In the Otherverse America setting civilian genetic engineering is as common as tattooing, and each citizen of 22nd Century America is a species of one, custom designed to survive the rigors of a war-torn, segregated future.

New human races have emerged.

The world's megacorps and America's military elite began using in-vitro gene-cutting to custom build workers and combat troops as early as the 2030s. The same ‘genetic revolution' that gave the world the AIDS cure, the first generation of engineered Powereds and laid the cornerstone of the Covenant pseudo-nation also gave birth to a new breed of slavery. A series of Supreme Court decisions during the 2050s freed many of the ‘engineered' races, and forced an already overstressed America to come to terms with the myriad new sentient species now living among them.

219206.name: Apex Strike File: Low Level Rescuers
219206.description:
From publisher blurb:

APEX Strikefile takes its inspiration from the sealed booster packs of roleplaying miniatures. Each APEX Strikefile includes complete statistics, tactics and roleplaying hooks for a small, thematic group of adversaries. At least one character per strike file is designed for use as pre-gen starting character.

This Strikefile includes statistics for a group of four low to midlevel Lifer soldiers. They can be used together as a rescue-cell, be pre-gen characters or supporting cast for a Lifer-centric campaign, or be used independently as individual threats. The Game Master can also infinitely re-use these characters as standard Lifer grunts.

219207.name: Bushido: Kintaru
219207.description:
As trouble and unrest sweeps across the Jwar Isles the unlikeliest of heroes are emerging to support the Temple of Ro-Kan. Kintaru is one such man, a peasant more at home fishing the rivers and lakes of the mountains than fighting. Nether the less he has given the strength of his arms and his keen eye to protect that which he holds dear.
Blister contains one miniature, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

219208.name: Poison
boardgameversion: Game Crafter print on demand version
219208.description:
Description from the publisher:

Poison is a trick taking card game for 2 – 6 players which will last around 20 minutes. Set in a high class cocktail party players each lay Drinks cards of differing suits trying to win tricks by playing the highest card in the current suit. Winning tricks wins you points as does completing your open and hidden agendas which are different for every player. Unlike other trick taking games the trump suit in Poison is a bad thing that negatively affects you if you play it. It is literally a poisoned chalice. The player with the highest score after 9 hands wins the game.

219209.name: Heredium Operation Eurystheus
219209.description:
A deadly danger from the time before the moonfall on the trail, the characters travel in this campaign Africa, Asia, North and South America as well as Europe. Shady figures, dangerous animals, and the naoh-mutated nature stand in their way and try to sabotage the success of the mission.

"Operation Eurystheus" is a campaign of six contiguous double adventures that lead the players around the world. This volume contains detailed descriptions of the locations, including maps, NPCs and creatures, to ensure that this campaign offers an incomparable game experience in the world of Heredium.

219210.name: Mnemonic Player's Guide
219210.description:
From the introduction:

This booklet is the player's introduction to Mnemonic, a freely distributed roleplaying system. Whether you plan to referee or play Mnemonic you should read these pages first, since they explain the fundamental concepts behind the game. Afterwards, if you wish to run a game, go ahead and read the Referee's Guide as well.

219211.name: Mnemonic Referee's Guide
219211.description:
From the introduction:

This booklet contains the information you’ll need to run a Mnemonic game. While most of what you need to know is in the Player’s Guide, the Referee’s Guide has detailed instructions on how to resolve action attempts and determine a wounded character’s Status. It also includes a number of optional rules and techniques for playing the game. Since the information here expands on topics covered in the Player’s Guide you should already have read that booklet.

219212.name: Spy Tactics
219212.description:
From DriveThruCards.com

Spy Tactics is a secret agent themed MicroGame for 4-9 players who will form 2-3 teams of agents. Agencies are Chimera, Tachyon, and Vex. Each agent receives an Alignment card, a point tracker card and 8 code cards. (The same 8 code cards are given to each agent.) After examining their code cards, each agent will choose one to discard. The other 7 form a player's hand, though only 6 of these will come into play.

Agents activate their cards simultaneously. Some have repercussions or rewards if other agents activate the same card simultaneously. In addition to scoring points for your agent team, you may attempt to eliminate opposing agents, though there is also a chance of eliminating team mates. In the end, remaining agents on a team will add their victory points. The highest scoring agency wins.

219213.name: Pukes and Staggers
219213.description: This is a basic roll-and-move game -- similar to Snakes and Ladders -- where the goal is simply to be the first to reach the finish space. The game board consists of a series of spaces, each requiring the player to perform some drinking-related task. "Staggers" allow the player to skip spaces ahead (like the Ladders) and "Pukes" cause the player to lose ground (like the Snakes). Due to the increasing level of intoxication of the players during the game, there is no guarantee that all (or any) players will make it to the final space.

219214.name: Operation: Overfur
219214.description:
Operation: Overfur is a family friendly card game where players take turns playing cards that match the species or class of the card on the top of the discard stack.

However the game has various special cards that can be played to trip up your friends and family.

Persevere through the special cards and be the first player to place the last character card in your hand on the pile to win the game.

219215.name: Werewords
219215.description:
In Werewords, players guess a secret word by asking "yes" or "no" questions. Figure out the magic word before time is up, and you win! However, one of the players is secretly a werewolf who is not only working against you, but also knows the word. If you don't guess the word in time, you can still win by identifying the werewolf!

To help you out, one player is the Seer, who knows the word but must not to be too obvious when helping you figure it out; if the word is guessed, the werewolf can pull out a win by identifying the Seer!

A free iOS/Android app provides thousands of words in hundreds of categories at various difficulty levels, so everyone can play.

219216.name: Endymia
219216.description:
From the Wiki:

Endymia è il nome del mondo, o del pianeta, di questa ambientazione: esso è il quinto di un sistema solare di 12 pianeti, ma esistono due soli, quello principale ed uno molto più piccolo che gli ruota attorno in un orbita molto stretta. Questo piccolo sole viene chiamato, dalla maggior parte delle popolazioni di Endymia, Cosmon che è il nome di un antica divinità astrale il cui culto è andato perduto. La circonferenza di Endymia misura circa 22300 chilometri ed il suo asse è inclinato rispetto al piano orbitale così da dar vita alle quattro stagioni; inoltre il pianeta possiede due lune: una di color azzurro che gli antichi credevano fosse la patria degli dei, e l'altra più piccola e lontana di colore bianco.

219217.name: Arena: The Contest
219217.description:
In a world unified by the Empire, it is forbidden to raise armies and make war. All major conflicts get solved in the ARENA, where the best fighters represent entire Nations. Such fighters, with good reason, are called HEROES.

In this turn-based tactical combat boardgame, players recruit teams of three or four from a wide pool of Heroes, all of them experts in a Combat Role, like Tactician, Healer and Bruiser. There are countless combos, counterpicks and strategies to explore in the attempt to build a powerful and synergistic team.

Each Hero is granted a Move and an Attack action per turn. Its governing rules are intuitive, meaning even beginners will find ARENA easy to learn; however, the game will forever remain challenging, as it is impossible to reproduce two equal matches, all attacks are unique, and there are optional 'advanced' features to implement in order to refresh and deepen the experience, such as Artifacts, Scrolls and Heroic Actions.

In Competitive mode (PvP), both teams fight each other until one eliminates all opposition and wins the battle. Matches begin by strategically positioning highly-detailed miniatures in an infinitely customizable battlefield featuring optional elements that change the dynamics of combat, such as walls, debris, altars and fire. You're required to plan ahead, consider your enemies' moves and work in harmony with your team in order to find the best possible action when your turn comes. There's also a funny variant to PvP called "Capture the Orb", characterized by infinite respawns and the goal of capturing and bringing the opponent's Orb to one's own base.

In Cooperative mode (PvE), the Player(s) build a team of 4 Heroes to travel the fantastic world of Tanares in order to solve a mystery, facing Missions with different problems, hazards, and goals. Campaign Cards present players with challenging events, requiring tough decisions that shape the course - and outcome - of an adventure that find its climaxes in the difficult Dragon Boss Fights. All enemies in this mode are automated, but a player may assume control, to create a "one vs all" situation.

The Campaign is meant to be conducted through the course of several sessions, in which Heroes gain experience according to the number - and quality - of accomplished Mission objectives. Experience Points can be spent to Level UP and acquire minor permanent boosts, or to purchase Items that grant major - but provisory - boosts to any Hero.

Players are free to tweak and adjust their experience according to their personal preferences, making Arena a highly diverse and replayable game. Players can make tournament tables and play simultaneous Matches on different boards; add or subtract different advanced rules and strategical features at will; try the game on custom boards or design their own missions. Players that enjoy immersion and storytelling can minimize action and maximize adventure in PvE-Campaign Mode, while players adverse to that can even play the Quests individually, in any sequence, with minimum reading required

219218.name: Arcan Myth Scheda del Personaggio
219218.description:
User summary:

A two-page PDF character sheet, intended for print-and-play use.

219219.name: Birds and Squirrels: black bird edition
219219.description:
Description from the publisher:

A Kickstarted creation. The second by Scolopendra Games Creator Joseph Pendergast.

Rules of play:
Each person gets a player strip and the cards are placed face down on the table. If you do not have enough strips for all the players just remember to stop at 6 cards. Take turns flipping cards onto your player strips in turn.
Squirrel cards clear your line and you get no points.
Hawk cards clear all lines and no points are collected.
White raven cards are wild and the suggested use is to double the score of a line but, it is up to you.
Once you have successfully filled a line with cards you may choose to keep your score by counting the number of birds up and adding them to what you already have acquired or if any blank cards are present you may try to gain more points by waiting to cover them a turn at a time until you desire to stay with what you have. After a line is successfully cleared draw a new card and play resumes. If a hawk or squirrel clears your line you do not pick up a new card.
Place all used birds in a face-up discard pile. You may not draw from this discard pile. When you run out of cards shuffle the discard and continue play.
Once the agreed upon score is reached by any player either that player wins after all other players finish their turns or all other players have a chance to overcome the winner before the deck runs out.
This rule card may be used as an optional 4 bird card.
For a quick single player game, try to make it to 30 points in one round through the deck.
The number of points you choose to go to decides how long gameplay will be I generally play to 30 but some people will play to 1000.

219220.name: The Great Weird War
219220.description:
A Sourcebook for Weird World War One Supernatural Warfare

From the introduction:

Specialist troops including intelligence, scouts, sappers and snipers are sent into no man’s land, fortifications and ghost towns to investigate mysterious phenomenon.

219222.name: High Noon Revolver
219222.description:
User Summary

High Noon Revolver is a 2D Action Shooter; blast your way across 3 layers of platforming.

219223.name: FormulaNext
219223.description:
FormulaNext is a technical racing game set in a futuristic world. Take control of your racing ship and challenge best players on 100 unique tracks! Become the fastest and climb rankings!

Source: The Developer Website.

219224.name: Techwars Online 2
219224.description:
User Summary

A world of crazy fun and discovery of new genre all await you: isometric MMO mecha-action with direct control. Only the strongest player will be able to win in this war of titanic robots. Use all the features of world’s ultra-realistic technology Techwars.

219225.name: Days of War
219225.description:
Days of War is a classic fast-paced WW2 shooter with 32 player infantry combat in a high fidelity environment

Source: The Developer Website.

219226.name: Akihabara: Feel the Rhythm
219226.description:
Akihabara is a unique combination of intense rhythm and fast-paced puzzles set in the Electric Town of Tokyo!

Source: The Developer Website.

219227.name: Gone with the Demon
219227.description:
Gone with the Demon is a first-person melee combat game with RPG elements. This game focuses on delivering unique and challenging experience.

Source: The Developer Website.

219228.name: Mainlining
219228.description:
After MI7 has been hacked, your primary goal is to bring a cyber-criminal network to justice. Played entirely from within the environment of your computer's desktop.

Source: The Developer Website.

219229.description:
The Senior Staff Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in the "Yesterday's Enterprise" episode Organized Play Event. It is considered a Resource, and costs a variable number of Squadron Points.

When using this resource, every ship in your fleet can field an additional Elite Talent for every Crew assigned to it. Each extra talent is assigned to a specific Crew and is discarded if it's associated Crew is discarded. The total cost of the resource is 1 Squadron Point per extra Elite Talent that you field via the resource.
219229.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Senior Staff Resource
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

219230.name: VGA Tanks
219230.description:
Publisher Description

A two player Tank battle arcade game with dozens of options! Choose Tank Shells that Steer, Bounce, or Home. Advanced Shell types feature Semi-Active Homing, Short-Range Homing, and more. Fight a friend or the computer on one of 30 different playing fields- in cities, on the moon, or in a 'classic' tank arena. Almost every game feature is player controlled through an Options Menu. Requires VGA graphics capability. Two person play requires a joystick or mouse. Supports dual joysticks. Non-stop action for kids of all ages!

From Digital Documentation

There are six different VGA Tanks Terrain Types.

Classic Tanks: The default, a salute to the inspiration for VGA Tanks.
Metropolis Tanks: A mixed environment of city and countryside.
Lunar Tanks: Desolate lunar landscapes with an occassional colony.

Registered version Terrain Types:

Desert Tanks: Sparse areas divided by mountains and dunes.
Urban Tanks: A highly detailed low-scale urban street-fighting environment.
Wilderness Tanks: Low-scale battlefields covered with trees, rivers, and swamps.

219232.name: Ilôs
219232.description:
The new world of Ilôs has just been discovered. Endless forsaken islands, amazing wealth, and many temples overflowing with gold are waiting to be explored. You embody one of the great naval powers. Through your cards, you will explore new islands, bring more ships along, gather wealth and raise its price, build fortifications to slow down your opponents, and establish trading posts to improve your production. Your goal is to become the richest explorer of Ilôs.

Ilôs is a card game of hand management for 2 to 5 players. Simple, accessible yet with a great strategic deepness, Ilôs is a strategy and resources production game for the whole family.

219233.name: Cataclysm
videogameversion: Commodore C64 and VIC-20 tape release
219233.description:
From cassette inlay
by Patrick Edmind

Cataclysm - Pure shoot-em-up arcade action for the unexpanded VIC 20 and the CBM 64!

The lunar city of Erriam is under fearsome bombardment from the saucers of the Jovian empire. You are the commander of the lone laser outpost, and your mission is - hold out as long as you can, or there can only be one outcome - CATACLYSM!

Instructions are contained within the program

The enclosed cassette contains the unxpanded VIC version on one side, and the Commodore 64 version on the other. You will find two copies of the program on each side, so that you have a backup copy. Just choose the side with the version for your machine and load as normal. There is a short header program which gives you the instructions. Read through these, and at the end of the instructions the main program will load and run itself automatically.

Cataclysm must be played using a joystick.

219234.name: Poker-Go
219234.description:
Poker-Go is based on the rules of normal go.

At the beginning of the game both decks are shuffled and put on the table face downward. During the game the players can choose at each turn between making a go move or drawing a card.

219235.name: Word Feud
219235.description:
From VicSoft Commodore 64 Winter 83/84 Catalouge
Hidden in a jumble of letters on the screen are two identical words, Find them with your joysticks. With many variations of difficulty and abity, Word Fued is educational fun for solitary play, player versus 64 or - most exciting of all - for two players!

219236.name: Renaissance
219236.description:
User Summary
Play Othello against the computer

219237.name: Troopa Truck
219237.description:
From cassette inlay
Earth's peaceful scientific patrol is marooned deep in space on a hostile planet, only one person can save it. You must guide your hightly manouverable Multi Terrain Amphibious Armouered patrol wagon across the roughest terrain of the planet Zon. Control it's movements as it leaps and jumps across craters and over the obstacles. Disintigrate the boulders in front with your somewhat primitive PM22 ballistic laser.
Beware of the Helichargas above, shoot them down if you can, but their movements are unpredictable and their missiles are deadly. Be extremely careful as the falling missiles can create craters in the ground ahead, you will have to jump over them If you survuve that ordeal you will have to fight off the attacks of the Lasa Slamma Tanks and dodge the Narzon Heatseekers as they approach you from the front and rear respectively. You probably won't believe us at first, but we assure you that every opstacle is passable.

219238.name: Goblin Towers
219238.description:
From cassette inlay
Somewhere in the middle of the huge forrest is an ancient castle. Local people tell of strange creatures that guard vast treasures hidden within the castle, though since noone who has dares do venture inside has ever returned it's difficult to know how much is fact and how much is speculation.

Not too far away from the castle is a small cottage which you may as well use as your base. Though now uninhabited remains in good repair, cared for by the villagers who regard it as a sort of shrine. With luck you may find there some items that will help you in your quest.

219239.name: Labyrinth: Overlord
219239.description:
What can you expect from this expansion?

Almighty Lord Vortexeios who comes when the Golem is destroyed!
Heroes have to defeat Lord Vortexeios if they want to escape from the Labyrinth!
Lord Vortexeios has much Life and on top of that he moves quickly around the board!
Lord Vortexeios spreads havoc and mayhem by destroying the Labyrinth or changing its layout!
Keys and magic items help in combat with this powerful creature!




Story:
The Golem has guarded the Labyrinth for ages…
But he was not always as we know him now.

Before his creation, the desert was inhabited by Sand Elementals.
The sole purpose of their existence was turning the whole world into the Great Desert.

It was because the sands gave power that could threaten even the Ancients themselves.
When the Elementals grew in power, their ruler, Lord Vortexeios,
Mustered a huge army and attacked the races created by the Ancients.
Many lives were lost, buried under the sands and thrown into an endless sleep.

It seemed nothing could stop Vortexeios.
But then the Ancients intervened.

They used the most powerful artifacts known to them.
They crushed the army of the Elementals so that only few escaped.
Finally, they defeated Lord Vortexeios and locked him
inside a sentient construct - the Golem.

This creation has been bereaving Lord Vortexeios of power
for centuries so that he can never free himself to plague the world.

However, what will happen if the Golem is destroyed?
Will Vortexeios, Lord of Sand Elementals return?

219240.name: Road Toad
219240.description:
From VicSoft Commodore 64 Winter 83/84 Catalouge
Not Just Any Frogger Game!

Get the Toad over the road avoiding the traffic and over the river by jumping onto the logs and lilies. With bonus females, deadly snakes, crocodiles, and treacherous turn coat lilies!

219241.description:
Avast, me hearties! Get ready to plunder all the booty you can carry in this whale of an expansion for Buck: Legacy!
Features a new and improved Pirate class card!
The pack features 13 cards, adding new items, treasures, dungeons and areas to explore!
219241.name: Buck: Legacy – Loose Cannon

219242.name: Lionheart
219242.description:
The player character is Valdyn, an outlaw who is also known as Lionheart because of his fierceness and courage, after the holy relic of the Cat People. He was arrested from the Bloodied Claw and taken to the palace's dungeons. However he is summoned by the King and is assigned a quest: the Lionheart had been stolen and if the King is not able to show it in the Showing Festival he will be forced to absdicate the throne, replaced by his arch-chancellor Nargle. Furthermore, Valdyn's beloved Ilene had been turned to stone by the thieves. Based on his nickname, the priests declare that Valdyn is destined to reclaim the jewel.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionheart_%28video_game%29 Lionheart (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

219243.description: Heavy firepower and very strong interception capability. Mercenary heavy machine gun squad is a good supporting in your army. Skillful girls team available for hire, all of them from a different country of the Neutral Nations Organization
219243.name: Dust Tactics: Mercenary Heavy Machine Gun Squad – "Sisters of Mayhem"

219244.description:
Description from the publisher:

Out of the Frying Pan and Into the Oven! Things are heating up in the latest expansion in Buck: Legacy!
Features the new race- Nagapon!
The pack features 13 new cards, adding new items, treasures, dungeons and areas to explore!
219244.name: Buck: Legacy – Playing with Fire

219245.description:
Out of the Fridge and into the Freezer! Cool off in in this frosty expansion for Buck: Legacy!
Features the new race- Gryphon!
The pack features 13 new cards, adding new items, treasures, dungeons and areas to explore!
219245.name: Buck: Legacy – Cold Snap

219246.description: For years now women have played a very important role in the war effort of every bloc, as men have been sent to the front. Some of them have even been sent close, in repair workshops or ammo dumps. They are now a common sight in fields where none would be seen just a few years ago. Justine and her team are top mechanics for hire, all from a different country of the Neutral Nations Organization.
219246.name: Dust Tactics: Maintenance Contractors – "Justine & Co"

219247.description:
The Screaming God Expansion extends your campaign by +5 Lantern Years, pushing back the Gold Smoke Knight. It allows the players to chase down a new powerful armor set, and if they are lucky, challenge the Lantern Parasite Queen!

Content Pitch:
2 x Screaming God miniature (100mm)
4 x Screaming God Narrative Armor sculpts
1 x Lantern Parasite Queen (50mm)
1 x Illuminated Lady miniature
1 x Illuminated Man miniature
120 x Game Cards
1 x Settlement Location
2 x Settlement Events
16 Page Rulebook
40 x Gear Cards
...and more!
219247.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Screaming God Expansion

219248.description:
Can you manage to craft it in time to face to Gold Smoke Knight at the end of your campaign?

Made from the bones of only the greatest monsters, the Death Armor is worthy of making it your not-so-secret goal. Even better than just surviving!

Put a Bone Eater in one of these and watch things get nuts!

Requires pretty much all of your settlement bones to craft.

Contains:
2 x Death Armor Narrative sculpts
1 x Settlement Location
1 x 6 Page Rulebook
25 x Gear Cards
...and more!
219248.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Death Armor Expansion

219249.name: Slightly Magic
219249.description:
From cassette inlay
'SLIGHTLY' in a new CARTOON adventure! - Discover SPELLS to turn into a BIRD or a FISH! Explore the Wizard's castle, Giant's farden, swim the secret LAGOON and fly over mysterious lands. Meet Pet Dragons, Tricky Pixies, Mammoth Octopus, Deaf Guards, Rock Monsters and more!...
INCREDIBLY MAGIC!

219250.description:
Description from the publisher:

This crossover projects brings 4 iconic Pathfinder characters into the nightmare horror world of Kingdom Death!

Includes a revamped, more in-depth hero mode, and alternate Pathfinders of Death campaign, where you can take on the role of those heroes as your starting survivors.

Each hero has a unique, "classic class" inspired Age Story Event (for leveling up). Similar to the Philosophy System, there is a chance that you can share their unique knowledge with your settlement. But be warned, intelligent monsters are just as capable of learning as survivors are. Higher level versions of the Butcher, King's Man, and Watcher threaten to crush these heroes before they have a chance to blossom.

Contains:

1 x Rulebook (12-20+ pages)
1 x Merisiel, Pathfinder of Death miniature
1 x Valeros, Pathfinder of Death miniature
1 x Kyra, Pathfinder of Death miniature
1 x Seoni, Pathfinder of Death miniature
1 x Pathfinder of Death Light - Campaign for KDM 1.5
30+ x Game Cards
2 x Settlement Events cards
12 x Gear Cards
...and more!
219250.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Pathfinders of Death Crossover Promo Expansion

219251.description:
If the settlement has a savior, there is a chance they will be having a terrible Nightmare! In order to save them, the survivors will have to dream her dream of a super-charged battle! Keep in mind, this is "promo content", so it's going to be a little silly, but a lot of fun!

Includes campaign integration, story events, and Lantern Power Scouter!

Contains:
Perfect Dung Bettle Knight miniature
Super Survivor Erza miniature
Super Survivor Lucy miniature
Super Survivor Zachary miniature
Super Survivor Allister miniature
Rulebook for a Super Nemesis showdown
60 x Game Cards
1 x Settlement Event card
3 x Story Events
219251.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Super Survivors Promo Expansion

219252.name: Bushido: Kawa No Rojin
219252.description:
Description from the publisher:

Kawa no Rojin stampedes his way across the battlefield trampling any that get in his way. Considered to be a lucky animal by the Monks of the Ro-Kan, his presence drives them on to courageous acts of valour.

219253.name: Escape from the Black Hole
219253.description:
Game in The Black Hole Annual 1981, a Disney Corporation film.

A simple race game. The track has 100 spaces. Most spaces are fine. However, if you land on a white space, you find that the gravity force has cut your engine power. You must stay on that space every turn until you throw a 6 which boosts your engine power and allows you to carry on with your journey. If you land on a black space, this represents extra power by the Black Hole and you must return to the Start space and start again on your next turn. The rules say "Care should be taken to avoid the white and black hazard squares". Well, that would be great but seeing you have to move with just a die roll, it is imp0ossible to "take care".

The winner is the first to reach the Clear space at the end of the track.

219254.name: Bushido: Minor Kami of Earth and Air
219254.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Kami can no longer sit by and watch the Balance be thrown further from its natural alignment. Whilst the Temple benefit greatly from the advantages these Kami grant their forces, the stirring of the elements is a further sign of how much work is to be done.

219256.name: Red Zone (1992)
219256.description:
From box
Red turns to green as Psygnosis go for pole position with RED ZONE: Their hell-for-leather bike race simulator. Straddle a mighty macchine, kickstart her into screamin action and take control of one of the fastest vehicles on two wheels. Burn rubber as you fight for first place and strive for the thrill of taking the checquered flag ahead of the pack...
Jousting for positions, you know that hte first few seconds of a race could mean the difference between victory and defeat. Sliding through the gears, with throttle wide open, the leader is in your sights...
SUIT UP FOR THE RIDE OF YOUR LIFE!

219257.description:
Description from the publisher:

Contains:

1 x Messenger of Courage miniature
1 x Messenger of the First Story miniature
1 x Messenger of Humanity miniature
1 x Messenger of the Spiral Path miniature

Also includes newly-developed rules for the False Messengers.
219257.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – False Messengers Promo

219258.name: Bushido: Fisherman of Rokan
219258.description: Long have the Temple of Rokan and the peasants lived in symbiotic harmony. In times of great turmoil the two continue the alliance. The Fishermen who make their lives from the great Sune-Kudansu, fishing from her many tributaries now add their talents to fight. Whether slipping through terrain without trace or calling upon of their cormorant allies they stand opposed to all enemies of the Temple.

219259.description:
Description from the publisher:

MedWar adds all the major naval and air units to the countermix for The Italian Campaign game set. Naval and air operations precede land operations during each game turn. Published in S&T 160.
Game contains:
(2) map sheets
(1) counter sheet
Rules and various game charts
219259.name: MedWar: Air & Naval Operations for the Italian Campaign

219260.name: Silicon Warrior
219260.description:
From Commodore box
The scenario is The 3-D Power Grid. You're one of the four Silicon Warriors. Your mission is to prigram five of the chips in a row - vertically, horizontally or diagonally vefore any of your opponents can do the same. They wukk try to beat you to hte task and steal the program or destroy you with laser fire, or your might even be swallowed up by a back hole 'glitch' in the program.
You teleport from chip to chip, programming it in your colour.
The battle intensifies through seven levels of play.
May the Force be with you!

219261.name: Super Games
219261.description:
User Summary
A cartridge with three games on:
International Football/International Soccer (original cover used both names)
Colossus Chess 2.0
and Silicon Syborgs.

The cartridge was sold solitary, but was also to be found in the Video Supergame 64 bundle in Germany

219262.description:
Protect your cards and dice from the horrors of Elder Sign—as well as the imperfections of your tabletop—by playing atop the Museum Gamemat!

With its map of the Miskatonic Museum and its occult exhibits, the 26” by 26” Museum Gamemat brings you a step closer to the investigations you’re attempting in your game. You’ll find line illustrations of some of the Museum’s stranger and more terrifying objects, as well as an art nouveau border that encourages you to action with heroic art of two investigators and two monsters.
219262.name: Elder Sign: Museum Gamemat

219264.description: The Ranger Attack Squad carries a deadly range of weapons. With these they can destroy anything in their path: tanks, walkers, bunkers, etc. Nothing can stop them. They are rightly feared as one of the deadliest unit on the battlefield. A Ranger Attack Squad includes three soldiers armed with a Shotgun and two armed with a portable Flamethrower. They are presented here in their Cerberus Camo pattern, as used in Great-Britain and Northern Europe, circa Winter 1947.
219264.name: Dust Tactics: Ranger Attack Squad – "Death Dealers"

219265.name: Port Royal: Das Abenteuer beginnt...
219265.description:
Raise the anchors and set sail as Port Royal: Das Abenteuer beginnt... introduces a campaign mode to Port Royal.

At the beginning of the game, someone reads the prologue of the scenario to be played, then before the start of each turn, players reveal order cards from an event deck that might require the collection of certain crew members or trade with certain ships; players might receive a bonus for certain actions during the turn. Order cards have a time limit, however, after which new cards are played from the event deck, and the end of a scenario depends on which orders have been executed.

Port Royal: Das Abenteuer beginnt... can be played either competitively or cooperatively.

219266.description: The Ranger Attack Squad carries a deadly range of weapons. With these they can destroy anything in their path: tanks, walkers, bunkers, etc. Nothing can stop them. They are rightly feared as one of the deadliest unit on the battlefield. A Ranger Attack Squad includes three soldiers armed with a Shotgun and two armed with a portable Flamethrower. They are presented here in their Cerberus Camo pattern, as used in Great-Britain and Northern Europe, circa Winter 1947.
219266.name: Dust Tactics: Ranger Attack Squad – "Hell boys"

219267.description: The Marines have arrived in the Middle-East! And First Sergeant James Murphy of the United States Marine Corps is going to lead his armored force into whatever situation arises, and come out on top as usual. This amazing pilot is a ferocious foe for anyone who stands in the way of the might of the Allied army.
219267.name: Dust Tactics: First Sergeant James Murphy – "Crazy Jimmy"

219268.description: The Marines have arrived in the Middle-East! And Master Sergeant Frank Stone of the United States Marine Corps is going to lead his men into whatever situation arises, and come out on top as usual. This rugged veteran is a ferocious foe for anyone who stands in the way of the might of the Allied arm
219268.name: Dust Tactics: Master Sergeant Frank Stone – "Quiet Jack"

219269.description: Gunnery Sergeant Q 'Mack' MacDonald has been with the United States Marine Corps for more than ten years now. Twice its boxing champion, 'Mack' has unsurpassed martial skills that he puts to good use against all enemies of the Allies, mostly Japanese in the Pacific.
219269.name: Dust Tactics: Gunnery Sergeant Q 'Mack' MacDonald – "Machette Mack"

219270.name: Kapela
219270.description:
From publisher blurb:

An act of “deviancy” plunges the adventurers into a search and a fight over a mysterious woman. What is it about her that incites lust, corruption, and warfare? And can the PCs survive it?

Kapela is a short, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

219271.name: The Fester Lion's Den (5E)
219271.description:
From publisher blurb:

Over the past 50 years, a fester lion has been preying on hunters and adventurers traveling through this stretch of the forest. It has been hoarding it’s favored food: zombies that it creates in a secluded cave.

The following Casual Confrontation, The Fester Lion’s Den is for 4-5, 5th level characters, and uses the 5th edition Dungeons and Dragons Ruleset. It also introduces the fester lion, a magical beast that preys on mindless undead that it creates!

219272.name: The Fester Lion's Den (Pathfinder)
219272.description:
From publisher blurb:

Over the past 50 years, a fester lion has been preying on hunters and adventurers traveling through this stretch of the forest. It has been hoarding it’s favored food: zombies that it creates in a secluded cave.

The following Casual Confrontation, The Fester Lion’s Den is for 4-5, 5th level characters, and uses the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Ruleset. It also introduces the fester lion, a magical beast that preys on mindless undead that it creates!

219273.name: Sacrifice
219273.description:
From publisher blurb:

How can you add more drama and pathos to your story of selfless heroism?

Story Design Volume 16 - A sacrifice story finds the protagonist pursuing some noble cause or higher purpose. In order to accomplish their objective, they will need to give up something of great personal value. This might be other goals, a close relationship, or even their own life. They may survive, but it is the willingness to be selfless on behalf of others that allows them to succeed.

Examples of the sacrifice plot include The Dark Knight, High Noon, The Iron Giant, The Last Unicorn, and Norma Rae.

Story Design: The Sacrifice covers all of the elements you need to prepare in order to tell a story of selfless heroism. It's based on concepts explored in Story Structure for Writers and Roleplayers, also published by Dancing Light Press. It's a big book that goes into greater detail on how to get the most out of the three-act structure, as well as developing a three-phase series (campaign, if you prefer) with a clear beginning, middle, and end. If you want to use your favorite roleplaying game system to tell stories with more depth than kill monster, get treasure, repeat (not that there's anything wrong with that), it is worth looking into.

219274.name: Over the River
219274.description:
From publisher blurb:

The starting point of one’s career sometimes starts meekly, at other times not so much. This adventure sends a brand new (or 2nd level weaker character) on a simple fetch mission. A romance on the brink is in peril when the PC accepts the mission. A looming celebration has the player torn between a future on the road to adventure and the future with someone special. Is your player ready to take a trip to pick up some alchemical supplies?

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a 5th level solo adventurer and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

219275.name: Pirates of the Dominions
219275.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome back to the Dominions! In this sourcebook you’ll find plenty of info on one of the biggest tropes of Sword and Sorcery: pirates!
