Among these pages you’ll find stories ancient and new of sea and sail, freedom and betrayal, gold and curses, and booze, lots of booze, by Hordan’s bloody kiss!

In addition, you’ll find new rules to handle ships, crews and sea battles. If you like the idea of having your own crew of piratical scum and making yourself a name as the terror of the seas, this book is ideal for you!

219276.name: Dungeon Draft
219276.description:
Over the course of four rounds in Dungeon Draft, 2-5 players draft heroes and weapons — using gold to pay for them — then use them to defeat monsters, acquire additional gold, and complete quests in an effort to earn the most experience points (XP).

Set-up:
At the beginning of the game each player is dealt 5 Quest cards. Then, each player selects 3 of their Quests to keep and returns the remainder facedown to the bottom of the Quest Deck. Each round players draft a 7 card hand. Cards are passed either clockwise or counter clockwise depending on the round. Players then take turns playing as many cards as they can from their hand, provided they have the resources to do so.

Randomly determine which player will play first during the Play Phase. The starting player will alternate in a clockwise fashion during each of the four rounds.

Playing Cards:
To play Heroes and Weapons, players must spend Gold equal to the Gold Cost in the upper left corner of the card. Spent Gold is returned to the common pool of available Gold.

Heroes and Weapons remain in front of you when played. Some Heroes and Weapons have special text abilities that take effect when played.

All Heroes and Weapons will only have effects that last for the remainder of the round, with the exception of providing Attack, Gold, and XP (i.e. ignore everything but the numbers and symbols on the left side of the card during future rounds).

Class Icons:
Each Hero and Weapon has a class. Classes are indicated by card color and icon. Class is very important! Many powers on Heroes and Weapons can only be used if you control enough cards of the appropriate class.

Monsters
To defeat Monsters, players must have Attack equal to or greater than the Monster Attack Cost in the upper left corner of the card. Attack is not “spent” like Gold, so a player can defeat any number of Monsters whose Attack Cost is lower than or equal to the combined Attack of all cards you control.

Some Monsters have a text box with special effects on the card. After you defeat one of these Monsters, follow the instructions and then put the Monster into the Draft Deck Discard Pile.

Some Monsters have XP or Gold values on the card. After you defeat one of these Monsters, take the corresponding XP and/or Gold from the
corresponding pool and then put the Monster into the Draft Deck Discard Pile.

Quests
To play Quests, players must have Heroes and Weapons of the appropriate class. Quests have no cost other than this requirement. Unlike Heroes and Weapons, Quest Cards may have abilities that can be used over multiple rounds.

End of Turn
Once a player has finished playing any cards they wish to play (and has the resources to play), they must:
• Discard all unplayed Draft Cards to the Draft Deck Discard Pile (do not discard Quest Cards OR played Heroes and Weapons).
• Gain 5 Gold plus additional Gold equal to the total Gold Production on all cards in front of you.
• Play passes to the next player.

End of Round
Once all players have completed the Play Phase, the next round will begin. In each round, the starting player will rotate clockwise (i.e. the
player who played second in the previous round will start the next round). TIP: At the end of each round, it is helpful to stack all of your played Heroes and Weapons so that only their icons are visible. This clears room for the next round’s cards and helps to avoid confusion since only the icon powers remain in effect for future rounds.

After four rounds have been completed, players tally up XP to determine the winner. The player with the most XP at the end of the game is the winner! Huzzah!

219277.name: Zelda D20 Homebrew
219277.description:
User summary:

This campaign setting is presented as a series of three major (and various minor) entries in an online wiki. The setting is an attempt to translate the setting of the media franchise and video game "Zelda" onto the tabletop for accessible roleplay gaming. The three primary sections include:


Races
Equipment
Plot Hooks

219278.description:
Dread Draw™ is a strategy card game of press your luck competitive fortune telling.

Contents:
100 Cards
1 Rulebook

Setting Up a Game:
At the beginning of the game each player is dealt 10 cards face down. These cards form each player’s Life Deck. Players can never look at the cards in their Life Deck unless the game or a card effect allows them to.

Playing the Game:
The game is played in a series of rounds. During each round, players take turns in trying to summon cards. A round ends when only one player remains, making that player the winner of that round. A new round then begins.

At the end of the round, each eliminated player will take damage, which is represented by discarding cards from their Life Deck. If you are eliminated and have no cards in your Life Deck, then you are defeated and are out of the game. The last player remaining in the game wins!

The Turn:
The player who was randomly chosen to go first takes the first turn of the opening round. On your turn, you must try to summon a card. Initially, you’ll try to summon a card from the Draw Deck, but as the game progresses you might be able to summon cards from your reserves as you accumulate them. To summon a card from the top of the Draw Deck, reveal that card. If its strength is greater than the strength of the last card you summoned, then you’ve successfully summoned that card. Place it to the right of the last card you summoned. This is known as Escalating.

If you summoned the card successfully, you may use any Summon ability that it may have; though using it is entirely optional. If the card’s strength is not greater than the last card you summoned, then discard the card you drew from the Draw Deck, and you are eliminated from the round. Discard any other cards you summoned this round.

After a player summons a card, or fails to summon a card, play passes to the player with the lowest total strength among their summoned cards. If there is a tie, and the current player is one of the tied players, then the current player takes the next turn. Otherwise, play passes to the next player to their left that is tied for lowest. If the Draw Deck runs out of cards, shuffle the cards in the discard pile to make a new Draw Deck.

Ending the Round:
A round ends when only one player remains in the round. The winning player adds up the damage values of their summoned cards. Each ‘Red dot’ on a summoned card represents a single damage point. Each opponent takes that much damage, starting with the player to the winner’s left, and going around the table. Once each player has taken their damage from their Life Deck, the winner discards their summoned cards and becomes the starting player for the next round.

The Life Deck:
Whenever you take damage, draw that many cards from your Life Deck and choose one of them to go to your reserves. Discard the other cards.
If you’re out of cards while drawing, you are still in the game — you don’t get defeated until you take damage while having no cards in your Life Deck.

If an ability allows you to gain life, put that many cards from the Draw Deck on top of your Life Deck without looking at them.

The Reserves:
Whenever you place a card in your reserves, put it next to your Life Deck so you don’t confuse it with the cards you summon during the round. If the card has a Reserve ability, you may play it now. Whenever you must summon a card, you may choose to summon one from your reserves instead of revealing a card from the Draw Deck. You can choose any card with strength greater than the last card you summoned this round and put it to the right of that card. If it has a Summon ability, you may play it — play then passes per the normal rules.

Abilities:
Most abilities on cards have a keyword that tells you when to play that ability. Playing summon, reserve, and aftermath abilities are always optional.
Summon: Play this when you successfully summon the card.
Reserve: Play this when the card is placed into your reserves, regardless of where it came from.
Aftermath: Play this when you are eliminated from a round or at the end of the round that you won.

Cards have special abilities that do not fall under any other ability category are considered to be “always on,” even while they are in your reserves. These abilities are not optional.

Telling the Fortune:
Once the game is over, if the winner had any cards left in their Life Deck, they use those cards to divine the future. That player shuffles those cards and lays them out, face-up, one at a time. The first card represents the present, the second represents the immediate future, and the rest divine the far future. It’s up to the players to interpret what those cards mean.
219278.name: Dread Draw

219279.name: Aquaventure
219279.description:
User Summary

You are a diver armed with a harpoon gun. You must retrieve the sunken treasure and return to the surface, without running into one of the denizens of the deep, before you run out of air. If you are successful, try again for deeper and more valuable treasure!

219280.name: Mario D20
219280.description:
User summary:

This fan-made setting is an attempt to translate the setting of the media franchise and video games concerning "Mario" onto the tabletop for accessible roleplay gaming. The implementation utilizes the d20 system but makes various (primarily minor) changes to the rules of the system to retain the flavor of the Mario games.

219281.name: The Legends of Hyrule Role Playing Game
219281.description:
User summary:

This fan-made, unauthorized game is an attempt to translate the the media franchise and video game "Zelda" onto the tabletop for accessible roleplay gaming. The mechanics are derived from the video game and thus use several unusual approaches. The main rules obviously are intended for experienced tabletop gamers and are presented without introductory statements or play examples.

Note that nearly all development and play testing was conducted using online forum play. The rules occasionally focus on supporting this style of play.

219282.name: A Brief Description of Commenly Encountered Hyrulian Creatures
219282.description:
User summary:

Entries in this bestiary are derived from a variety of video games and other media in the "Zelda" franchise. They are presented with a standardized "stat block" and limited flavor text for use in the tabletop adaptation game.

219283.name: The Legends of Hyrule Character Sheet
219283.description:
User summary:

This atypical character sheet is provided to support characters in the game. Two print-and-play versions are provided (one full color, one black-and-white), as well as an electronic version.

As the game rules closely approximate the video game mechanics, one of the primary functions of the character sheet involve various types of status tracking (e.g., "hearts", armor, rings, etc.).

The electronic version is provided as a standalone executable program. It does not include a save or a print function, and is intended only for use during forum play sessions.

219284.name: Morte Sulla Via
219284.description:
From the introduction:

Quest'avventura, intitolata Morte dulla Via, è la seconda del ciclo della Seconda Edizione ma, come vedrete, non ha alcun legame con la prima. Tuttavia nulla vieta di inserire questa avventura come riempitivo all'interno di una campagna pre-esistente oppure farla come parte integrante di essa.
...
Il bosco del braldo è una macchia molto fitta formata da alberi di tutti i tipi. La sua impenetrabilità l'ha reso, secoli addietro, il rifugio ideale per coloro che fuggivano la legge. Ancora prima fu dimora di una maga, ma questo non lo sa nessuno.

User summary:

Distributed as a ZIP archive containing the PDF scenario and five JPG map files.

219285.description:
Decription from the publisher:

Before World War II America anticipated a war with Japan and created Plan Orange.

Hell in the Pacific allows owners of the classic Victory in the Pacific to test out a war between Japan and America in 1931 or 1935. It is a conflict unlike the actual Pacific war, dominated by fleets of battleships, with aircraft playing an important, but largely supporting role. France and Britain can be drawn into the war if the Japanese are overly aggressive. Also included are rules for Japanese fuel shortages and optional rules for players of the Avalon Hill classic.
219285.name: Hell in the Pacific: Plan Orange 1931 and 1935

219287.description: Women in Space is an expansion pack for Women in Science, adding 8 female astronauts (a new type of scientist), 4 Discovery cards (protects a lab against Prestige cards) and 4 Prestige cards. These 16 cards are added to the regular Women in Science deck.
219287.name: Women in Space

219288.name: Mitt sagospel
219288.description:
The game can be played in a couple of different ways. 1) Draw tiles with illustrations from wellknown tales and songs from the bag and combine to your very own story or song, told in the same order as the tiles you draw. Best story wins. 2) Memory version: find the cards belonging to each tale or song, sort them in the correct order and tell it/sing it.

Ett spel för alla som gillar sagor och att fantisera! Dra bildkorten med illustrationer från välkända sagor och visböcker ur sagopåsen och fantisera sen ihop en ny saga. Sagan ska berättas i den ordning som bilderna plockas fram. Spännande, tokigt eller roligt, spelaren med bästa minnet och fantasi vinner. Innehåller 3 olika spelvarianter.

219289.name: Mitt dinosaurieäventyr
219289.description:
In the first phase each player chooses a hero and gathers the equipment (memory play) necessary to get through the swamp (second phase). While running through the swamp the heroes must pass seven dinosaurs (dice rolling and card drafting). If you get scared, you loose some of your equipment. The first hero to cross the swamp scores victory points, and all players who crosses the swamp scores points equal to the equipment left. The player with highest score wins.

Välkommen till ett riktigt äventyr – om du vågar. Tillsammans ska ni springa genom träskmarkerna så fort ni kan. Dinosaurierna är efter er, hungrigare än någonsin. Med sju stycken läskiga dinosaurier, en spelplan, kortlek, tärning, så kan fyra deltagare ge sig iväg och börja äventyret. Lycka till!

219290.name: imprint-X
219290.description:
A button-based puzzle game containing 100 levels to unlock and 700 buttons to press! You are one of the hacker clones, saving intellects by hacking into infected brains and defeating the mysterious Wardens.

Source: The Game Website.

219291.name: The Wardrobe
219291.description:
Inspired by the great ‘90s classics such as 'Monkey Island', 'Day of the Tentacle', 'Tony Tough' and 'Sam & Max: Hit the Road', "The Wardrobe" has a strong sense of humour, but isn't shy about dealing with mature and non-politically correct themes.

Source: The Game Website.

219292.name: 20something
219292.description:
User Summary

20something is an interactive fiction game, a candid and honest look at dating.

219293.name: Assorted Humanoids
219293.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world's most famous fantasy role-playing game has a huge monster book, but many creatures we loved in prior editions were overlooked. The 5e Fiendopedia brings some of these back and updates them for the 5th edition rules.

This PDF includes 9 creatures: Adherer, Foxfolk, Grippli, Nagaji, Sasquatch, Skum, Spriggan, Triton, Xill.

Each creature gets a full-color illustration, 5th edition statistics & abilities, and background/ecology information.

219294.name: Intrigue Archetypes
219294.description:
From publisher blurb:

Secrets and Skulduggery

Intrigue Archetypes is the perfect addition to any Pathfinder game set against a backdrop of courtly intrigue, clever manipulation, and urban decay, crime, and corruption. This 40-page class supplement features 10 incredible new archetypes replete with panache and flair, from the scheming priest and mastermind psychic to the trickshot sniper vigilante, wild card swashbuckler, spell hacker wizard, and cityscape hierophant druid. Each has an incredible array of unique and flavorful abilities that will make urban adventuring come to life like never before. You'll also find over two dozen new intrigue and urban-focused feats and alternate class features like arcanist exploits, magus arcana, and vigilante talents, plus the metallomancy of the clever coinmage prestige class. Capping it all off, we bring you The Grey Shadow, a vengeful vigilante ready to use as an ally or adversary for your urban PCs while showing off some of the fantastic new options in this book. Your characters may delve the deepest dungeons and traverse the widest wilderness, but the siren song of the city calls, and when it's time to answer your characters will be ready! Add Intrigue Archetypes to your Pathfinder campaign today and Make Your Game Legendary!

219295.name: The Sind: The Dungeon Mage
219295.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Dungeon Is Yours!

Introducing the Sind! A medium BAB, d8, 6 level arcane caster, who draws their power from dungeons and other old ruins! Their (literally) academic approach to adventuring gives them a slew of unique "class credit" abilities that make this "dungeon mage" useful to any party! They can modify dungeons on the fly, morphing terrain and messing with things like traps, haunts, and locked doors! At higher levels they even get a "personal dungeon" that they can step into, train in, and creativly use to muck with their enemies!

Add to that the "living dungeon" plot-hook. A solid bit of lore that details how living dungeons grow!

The sind gets an archetype, "the dungeonmancer", which sacrafices their personal dungeon for better spellcasting and discoveries from the alchemist and wizard!

This book also includes the "hutling" player race- a race of lving huts that have extra-dimensional space for their party to relax in!

Take control of your dungeon today!

219296.name: The Art of War: Mass Combat Options
219296.description:
From publisher blurb:

Master the Art of Warfare!

The mass combat rules presented in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Ultimate Campaign allow players to take their conflicts to a new order of magnitude, allowing them to command entire armies. While useful on their own, these rules present several new elements that are ripe for expansion. As every general knows, many different aspects of a battle can decide its outcome, from tactics and commanders to the layout of the battlefield and the equipment issued to the troops.

This book provides a variety of additional options to build upon the rules presented in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Ultimate Campaign. Make the battlefield truly treacherous by placing it in a lightning storm or wild magic zone. Outmaneuver your foes with new army tactics like a cavalry brace or siege bombardment. Lead your army in style with new commander boons like mad dog and mastermind, and outfit your troops with the best in new resources, such as boats, potions, and repair supplies.

219297.name: Il Prescelto
219297.description:
From the introduction:

Il Prescelto è la prima avventura per Arcan Myth 2 edizione, creata e redatta interamente dopo la pubblicazione della II edizione. Nasce da un'idea di Davide Paloschi intitolata Il Furto, ma il nome è stato cambiato per non dare ai giocatori input sbagliati e non metterli troppo in guardia.
...
Il villaggio segue la religione uffciale del regno o regione di cui fa parte (in questo caso Dyn), ma questa è stata deviata da credenze popolari di origine molto antica.

User summary:

Distributed as a ZIP archive containing the PDF scenario and two PNG map files.

219298.name: Il Cartomante
219298.description:
From the introduction:

Il Cartomante è un'avventura per il torneo dell'allora circuito nazionale (oggi Campionato GdR) che organizzai grazie agli altri autori di Arcan Myth e al prode Ohmnibus presso la convention VerCON di Vero.
...
I Personaggi si trovano in missione all'esterno dalla città e più precisamente dietro il colle del castello, presso le rovine di Rawkill. Lì è presente una piattaforma di pietra, utilizzata in questo frangente come piattaforma d'evocazione e la squadra sta andando a fermare il sacerdote che la sta compiendo.

User summary:

Distributed as a ZIP archive containing the PDF scenario and numerous supplemental materials in a variety of file formats, including pre-generated characters, player handouts, illustrations, and maps.

219299.name: Il Tempio Dimenticato
219299.description:
Avventura in solitario

From the introduction:

Questa è un'avventura in solitario per il gioco di ruolo Arcan Myth, scaricabile gratuitamente da Internet.

L'immagine di copertina è di Mario Garofalo, mentre le illustrazioni interne sono di Mattia Maddaloni.

Questo modulo è pensato per essere sia un approccio al GdR di stampo classico da parte di neofiti, sia per coloro che non hanno ancora un gruppo di gioco ma vogliono comunque provare Arcan Myth, sebbene per questa avventura le regole siano state molto semplificate.

Il Cartomante è un'avventura per il torneo dell'allora circuito nazionale (oggi Campionato GdR) che organizzai grazie agli altri autori di Arcan Myth e al prode Ohmnibus presso la convention VerCON di Vero.
...
I Personaggi si trovano in missione all'esterno dalla città e più precisamente dietro il colle del castello, presso le rovine di Rawkill. Lì è presente una piattaforma di pietra, utilizzata in questo frangente come piattaforma d'evocazione e la squadra sta andando a fermare il sacerdote che la sta compiendo.

User summary:

Distributed as a ZIP archive containing the PDF scenario a one-page PDF tracking sheet.

219300.name: Heredium Menschen Göttern gleich
219300.description:
"Menschen Göttern gleich" is the first adventure band for the Heredium roleplay game. Designed for four to six players and starting characters, it is also easy to customise for experienced players.
Ikari, a new drug that floods the streets of Hirohito City, has not only a high degree of dependency but can also transform people into wild animals that can no longer distinguish between good and evil. Liang, the leader of one of the most powerful families in Hirohito City, has made it his mission to extend his life and the new drug has a vital part in his endeavour, but which one? In "Menschen Göttern gleich" the characters are entangled in a vortex of intrigue, hatred, and violence, which not only makes them wander through the dangerous streets of the dome town but also leads to a murderous hunt through the burning steppe of Asia. Under the dawning sun of a world marked by the moonfall and mutations, the fate of the characters will be decided, and perhaps the power structure in Hirohito City, the heart of Temora, will change.

219301.name: Heredium Gamemasters Screen
219301.description: The Heredium Gamemasters Screen is an indispensable aid for any ambitious Gamemaster who would like to have all the important tables at a glance. More than a dozen tables - including weapons, skills and situation factors - adorn the back of an impressive illustration, which will captivate all players. Also included is "Tarek's Refugium", an 18-page scenario that describes a self-sufficient ex-Bundeswehr base in the Teutares, which is not only lovingly elaborated, but also contains numerous adventure approaches to guarantee hours of fun.

219303.name: Vem vet mest?
219303.description: A board game version of a quiz show on Swedish television. A player can either choose to answer a question themselves (after hearing its category) or choose to give it to someone else (and then score points if they can't answer it).

219305.name: The Krilling Field
219305.description:
Description from the publisher:

In the Krilling Field, up to four players compete against each other to become heir to the Blubbulous Throne and ruler of the ocean. It's a card game played on a randomized map, where the object is to discover defensive outposts and fortify them against the onslaught of the Deep Krillord.

Protecting your home is a wonderful thing to do with friends, but King Blubbulous only has one throne to give to a heroic whale, so you might as well sabotage your fellow whales along the way. There are over 60 abilities and organisms to aid you in your quest, from swordfish assassins to deep-ocean ectoplasm. Or, if being a hero isn't your style, aid the Krillord in usurping the Blubbulous throne and bring terror to the Krilling Field in his evil name.

The Krilling Field takes between thirty minutes and one hour to play, and every game has completely rearranged terrain, with players altering the shape, size, and order of the playing field at will. While it is possible (but unlikely) to exhaust the multitude of unique locations in a single game, it takes most players between five and ten playthroughs to discover every card.

The Krilling Field includes:

Five Player Whales
Twelve Blubbulous Pearls
Eight Non-Player Ocean Denizens
Fifty-six Munition Cards
Thirty-six Ocean Cards
Thirty Deeps Cards
One Ocean Indicator Card
One Rule Book

219306.name: Hissy Fit: the Thinking Drinking Game
219306.description:
Description from the publisher:

It's Hissy Fit'', a new kind of party game for adults featuring creativity, vice, and reckless behavior! Oh, and also drinking and gambling.

We present, for your entertainment, a new sort of party game for adults. Fair warning, though, it contains drinking, racing, expenditure of petty cash, and all manner of chicanery. Have you ever wondered if you were the fastest thigh-poker around? Are you confident that you could portray the most convincing withered crone? Do you excel at eloquence while inebriated? Want to win money from your friends? Do you enjoy judging the wit and skills of your peers? If you answered affirmatively to any of these, Hissy Fit is the game for you!

Oh, and it also pays for itself the first time that you win, provided you play for real money. Now that's value!

A game of Hissy Fit consists of players dividing into teams and competing against each other in bizarre and humorous challenges. These can be anything from “First person to reach the Great Outdoors” to “Best Impromptu Facial Hair” to the dreaded “Slurgeon General”, where a player will be forced to navigate a tricky tongue twister. After judgement is passed, losing players pay a dollar in tribute, and the winner flips their coin to determine how the drinks are administered. If they’re lucky, all the losers will drink, but if fortune turns against them, they drink instead. After much competition, the besotted winner gets a huge pile of cash, and the losers go home happy.

What's with the name? Well, in Hissy Fit, outbursts of laughter are both constant and contagious. Naturally,we decided to reward and punish it simultaneously. When the Hissy Fit token is invoked, all laughter is forbidden and only good-humored hissing is permitted. This effect persists only until someone screws up, but it is truly a sight to behold. As it happens, trying not to laugh is in fact more hilarious than just laughing, and the copious hissing adds tremendously to the fun.

It's a game that pits subjectivity against objectivity in winners. Want to win a "Best" challenge? You'll have to convince the judge of your superiority. Want to win a "First" challenge? Well, the only things standing in your way are your own limitations. It's truly the best of both worlds!

219307.name: Corona Blossom - Vol. 3: Journey to the Stars
219307.description:
User Summary

In the midst of a furious battle, the launch countdown begins. Time is running out for Keiji and his friends. Will the quest to help R-ne return home be successful? Find out in the thrilling and heartwarming conclusion to the Corona Blossom trilogy!

219308.name: Outrageous Grounds: The Maze
219308.description:
Outrageous Grounds: The Maze is an original virtual reality action adventure. You will explore the depths of The Maze, battle your way through enemies, unravel mysteries, solve puzzles and to experience something new in VR gaming.

Source: The Game Website.

219309.name: Echo Lake
219309.description:
Enter the moonlit world of Echo Lake: a single-player puzzle-adventure game available on Steam Early Access from 27th January 2017.

Source: The Game Website.

219310.name: Minos Strategos
219310.description:
User Summary

You are the legendary Minos Strategos (general of the ancient city of Minos)! Command the defenders of the temple by harnessing the power of specific battle formations to push back the Minotaur hordes.

219311.description: set of 4 folded game mats, part of the Giants of the Sky Kickstarter
boardgameaccessory: Wings of Glory: WW1 Giants of the Sky – British Handley Page O/400
Wings of Glory: WW1 Giants of the Sky – German Zeppelin Staaken R.VI
Wings of Glory: WW1 Rules and Accessories Pack
219311.name: Wings of Glory: WW1 Giants of the Sky – Game Mats

219312.name: MINDJOB
219312.description:
Description from the publisher:

MINDJOB is an adult party game that mixes psychology with profanity to f-ck with your mind. It works by presenting conflicting visual and verbal cues, which together disrupt automated processes in the brain used for language and color identification (the stroop effect). At the same time, the inclusion of profanity triggers the brain’s primal system which is prone to react on instinct. When the eyes, brain and mouth don’t agree, things get tricky.

While the underlying neuroscience is complicated, the game is anything but academic. It’s a true party game that comes complete with optional NSFW and drinking rules that add to the challenge and increase the level of social interaction.

Gameplay

All players start with the same number of cards and are not allowed to look at their hand. Players take turns flipping over their top card and placing it face up in the middle of the table. Depending on the card flipped over, the player that flipped the card must either read the word on the card, identify the color of the card, or shout out a swear word. If they say the correct response, the card stays on the table and the next player takes their turn. If they hesitate or get it incorrect, any other player can slap the card to call out their mistake. The player that slapped the card can take the top two cards from the center of the table and give them to any player of their choice. The player that made the mistake must pick up the rest and put them back into their hand. The first player to get rid of all their cards wins.

219313.description:
A kickstarter-exclusive expansion to The World of SMOG: Rise of Moloch, consisting of two new Gentlemen - Lord Holmes and John Watson - and two additional Agents - Irene Adler and Colonel Moran - each with their own card and effect.

As a bonus, there are six Gentlemen Dashboards for these Agents, allowing you to field a whole team of the legends of Baker Street!
219313.name: The World of SMOG: Rise of Moloch – The Baker Street Set

219314.name: ABC: Animals
boardgamefamily: Goldmerk Games Travel Games for Smart Kids
219314.description:
On turn players choose a letter and try to write down on the block mammal - bird - fish - bug - reptile/amphibian on for each box.
Round is over if first player has filled all 5 boxes in row or players agreed to end the round.
Each word not written by others scores 2 points, each other word scores 1 point.
After 8th round add up the points and the player with the most points is the winner.

219315.name: Ninja All-Stars: Arashikage
219315.description:
Arashikage is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

The silent and masked Arashikage has walked Kagejima for seven years on a quest for vengeance. Ever since he witnessed one of his peers apparently murder his Tora master, he has longed to hunt down the killer. For the right price, Arashikage will use his mastery of Fire and Water to help your team in the Moonlight Tournament, but only so long as he feels it brings him closer to his goal of revenge.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Fire and Water Wielding, Revenge-Seeking Ronin

219316.name: Ninja All-Stars: Yoboku
219316.description:
Yobuko is a Clan Ijin-themed Hero for Ninja All-Stars. Heroes bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. Each Hero is themed to a single clan and make must-have additions for players who pick up the clan box.

Tall, strong, and fierce, Yobuko is also young and inexperienced compared to his Ijin counterparts. This blend of natural ability coupled with an, as yet, unrivaled capacity to fight might be the most frightening aspect about him. His power is already so incredible that he is already the rival of many of his masters, and he is also constantly testing his mettle against full-blooded oni twice his size to the amazement of all of his clansmen.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Ferocious and Powerful Ijin Clan Hero

219317.name: Ninja All-Stars: Musashi
219317.description:
Musashi is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

For years, Musashi has wandered Kagejima, studying, debating, and fighting with masters from every school he could find. After some years, he found that he no longer sought to master the sword; he sought, instead, to master himself. Since the tool no longer mattered, he abandoned his weapon for a pair of mighty oars. Now he travels on, searching for himself, and refining the art of the wooden blades.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Wooden Blade-Wielding, World Traveler Ronin

219318.name: Ninja All-Stars: Komuso
219318.description:
Komuso is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

Marked by the great wicker baskets that cover their heads, and heralded by the haunting sounds of their shakuhachi flutes, Komuso monks bring a calm aura and share wise words wherever they go. Where the basest of men fight for money, Komuso accept only food or supplies. Unburdened by material possessions, they often demand favors, prayers, or offerings at certain shrines from those who seek their assistance.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities

Fully Assembled Model

Serene, Solitary Mercenary Monk

219319.name: Ninja All-Stars: Karura
219319.description:
Description from the publisher:

Karura is a Clan Tanchyo-themed Hero for Ninja All-Stars. Heroes bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. Each Hero is themed to a single clan and make must-have additions for players who pick up the clan box.

Karura is unusual among even his rare, adventurous clansmen, for he feels a greater kinship with the Tanchyo’s cousins—the eagles—than with any human he has met. Although seemingly distant, Karura possess a great inquisitive nature that has led him to tinker endlessly and invent many wonderful things. His latest invention—a contraption of snares, wires, pulleys, and hooks—allows him to fly between trees, cliffs, and rooftops with all the grace and speed of his beloved avian cousins.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Fierce Flying Human Ninja Master

219320.name: Ninja All-Stars: Uzumaki
219320.description:
Description from the publisher:

Uzumaki is a Clan Kitsune-themed Hero for Ninja All-Stars. Heroes bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. Each Hero is themed to a single clan and make must-have additions for players who pick up the clan box.

Uzumaki is unlike his otherwise reclusive Kitsune kin. Where others recoil at the sight of travelers, Uzumaki is often the first to greet them and offer them warding runes and medicines in exchange for stories of the world beyond his clans’ hallowed forests. Social, skilled, and savvy, he is ill-suited for the more solemn life his clan’s spirit-haunted trees offer. For these reasons, he has been sent to the Moonlight Tournament as their first ever envoy in over a century.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Sly, Spirited Kitsune Clan Hero

219321.name: Ninja All-Stars: Yokozuna
219321.description:
Yokozuna is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

Yokozuna takes great pleasure in his work at the employ of Shojo, a woman notorious for treating work like a party. Cheerful, kind, and incredibly strong, he has risen to a position of leadership amongst Shojo’s dock workers. The Moonlight Tournament, however, is a nice break from the tasks that typically occupy his days on the dock. Those jovial by nature, he is no fool. He is always on the lookout, ready to be in the right place at the right time to stop trouble in Kagejima.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Brawny Earth and Water Wielding Dock Worker Ronin

219322.name: Ninja All-Stars: Kappa
219322.description:
Kappa is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

The Kappa are wild, dangerous kami who inhabit Kagejima’s lakes, rivers, and swamps. Wily and withdrawn by nature, they can be found overturning boats and drowning unwary children. Despite this, several clans have successfully coaxed these exceptionally strong and stealthy creatures into performing services…often with the sacrifice of food, livestock, or even the village elder’s firstborn child.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Water, Earth, and Void Affinities
Fully Assembled Model
Wild and Wily Kami Ronin

219323.name: Ninja All-Stars: Onibaba
219323.description:
Onibaba is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

As a mortal, Onibaba would lure stragglers from battles into her traps, finish them off, and sell their possessions. One night, however, she pulled a finely crafted mask from a dark and terrible samurai, and slipped it on over her face. In that instant, the dark power from within the mask touched the festering rot in her soul and consumer her. Soon the mortal hag was gone, replaced by an ageless, devouring horror that has stalked Kagejima’s places of slaughter ever since.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Stealthy, Ruthless Scavenger Ronin

219324.name: Ninja All-Stars: Moon Princess
219324.description:
Moon Princess is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

Schooled since birth in the ancient, esoteric arcana of her family, the Moon Princess sometimes tires of merely watching the Moonlight Tournament. She often desires to use her own strange and terrible power against the warriors competing to do her honor. Yet, competing in the tournament exposes her to threats, assassination attempts, and even death. In truth, though, these dangers are part of what makes these outings so appealing to her.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Majestic and Magical Moon Princess

219325.name: Ninja All-Stars: Hanzo
219325.description:
Hanzo is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin popular choices for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

Hanzo features prominently in the Ninja All-Stars 2016 organized play league, Saga of Hanzo. In Saga of Hanzo, players earn exclusive alternate-profile Hanzo cards, ensuring Hanzo’s place as one of the most versatile and popular ronin in Ninja All-Stars!

Hanzo has been called many things over his long and storied life: master, teacher, monster, and traitor. Still the Moon Princess has refused to denounce her “wayward hunting hawk”. Some say this is for previous unknown services, others because he still serves the Moon Court.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Useable by Any Team
Fully Assembled Model
Featured in Saga of Hanzo League

219326.description: The Onitama: Sensei's Path expansion consists of sixteen new movement cards that can be shuffled together with those of the Onitama base game in order to have more variety during play.
219326.name: Onitama: Sensei's Path
boardgamepodcastepisode: #45: Six-Player Six Pack; Las Vegas on tap; Barcelona; Mystic Vale; Betrayal at the Brewery on the Hill

219327.name: Ninja All-Stars: Shojo
219327.description:
Shojo is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

The captain of the magnificent trading vessel, Tako-Tako, is as famous for her wild ways as for her wondrous wares. Shojo loves a party, and she brings one (or more) with her wherever she makes berth. A fearless navigator, she is equally masterful with the sword, which she hastily employs with typhoon fury—so long as the sake lasts, that is.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Spirited, Swashbuckling, Sake-Slamming Mercenary Hero

219328.name: Ninja All-Stars: Mizaru
219328.description:
Mizaru is a Clan Yamazaru-themed Hero for Ninja All-Stars. Heroes bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. Each Hero is themed to a single clan and make must-have additions for players who pick up the clan box.

At age 14, Mizaru lost his sight due to a witch’s curse. His story might have ended there except that he refused to become bitter. He, instead, focused his anger into overcoming the setbacks his injury initially posed. Honing his senses until he could navigate trails by the sway and sound of his scabbard, identify others by scent, and track any movement by the slightest noise,Mizaru eventually became captain of the Yamazaru’s famed scouts.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Blind Kunai-Weilding Ninja Master

219329.name: Battle of Shanghai
219329.description:
"Battle of Shanghai" reproduces two Shanghai incidents of different nature in completely different game systems.

The "First Shanghai Incident" is a zonal wargame that represents the military scalade that ensued the January Incident, in 1932. One player plays with the japanese army and the other plays the Kuomintang Armed Forces. The game is played in only two turns, one for february and one for march. Each turn both players alternate in taking actions by expending logistic points until they exhaust their points or both players passes consecutively.
The map depicts the countryside north of Shanghai, in a zonal map. The goal of the Japanese is to score enought victory points by occupying some key areas by the end of each turn or else eliminate all KMT troops from around Shanghai. The KMT wins elseway. The counters represent regiments or brigades, with few support counters.

In "Shanghai / Nanjing Operation", is a more classical wargame, that simulates the 1938 thrust to Nanjing. The map represents the region between Shanghai and Nanjing, and it's an hexagon's map. The units are at divisional level for the japanese and at army level for the Kuomingtang.

219330.name: Ninja All-Stars: Dark Kitsune
219330.description:
Dark Kitsune is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

Some Kitsune are ill-suited for life beneath their clan’s hallowed home of shadowed trees. Instead, they dream of the wider world full of unknown wonders. Masterful, mischievous, and even a bit malicious, Dark Kitsune either venture beyond their homeland or are shun. Employing their clan’s skills in herbalism and magic, such Dark Kitsune rarely have trouble making a living off of warriors willing to pay their sometimes outrageous fees.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Spirit and Void Affinities
Fully Assembled Model
Masterful and Mischievous Dark Fox Ronin

219331.name: Ninja All-Stars: Ondori Clan Kaiken
219331.description:
Ondori Clan Kaiken is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars.Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

Hidden in the forests and groves of northern Kagejima, the Ondori clan are mysterious and almost legend to most of the island. They only occasionally trade with, or even contact, their nearest neighbors. Those who do interact with them describe the Ondori as proud, fiery, and surprisingly well-informed. In the last century, more and more of these enigmatic shinobi have appeared and bargained their services to other clans for the Moonlight Tournament. With flashing claws and a sharp beak, they challenge all who stand in their way with their unique fighting style that baffles opponents and allies alike.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Fierce, Feathered Avian
Mercenary Ronin

219332.name: Ninja All-Stars: Inu Clan Kaiken
219332.description:
Inu Clan Kaiken is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

While seldom seen, the Inu are far more widespread than the other minor clans and far more congenial. Inu are very protective of their lands and their neighbors that treat them well, always coming quickly to their aid and fighting fiercely in their defense. Though small and compact, Inu clan warriors are whirlwinds of frenetic energy, and many opponents have retreated from these warriors’ sheer enthusiasm.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Furry, Faithful Canine Mercenary Ronin

219333.name: Ninja All-Stars: Tengu
219333.description:
Tengu is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.
Of the many magical creatures and peoples that inhabit Kagejima, the Tengu are among the most enigmatic. For centuries, these strange creatures would barter or trade their magical and martial skills to the competing clans or war bands. Sometimes they did so for gold or shiny baubles, and sometimes for whispers of love from a beautiful woman, the first wail of a newborn, or thirty stems of saffron. Since the start of the Moonlight Tournament, more tengu have offered their services more often, and increasingly for stranger payments. Though many find this curious, or even ominous, few are unwilling to at least try and meet the price.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Mystical and Magical Mercenary Ronin

219335.name: Ninja All-Stars: Sun Empire Wandering Samurai
219335.description:
The Sun Empire Wandering Samurai is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

Ever watchful for weakness, the Sun Empire’s agents can turn up anywhere, and discovering them and sending them politely on their way has become a game among many clans. The Sun Empire Wandering Samurai is but one of the many skilled warriors that has surfaced in Kagejima, offering services to interested parties. Such is the cut-throat nature of Kagejima’s politics—especially the prestige attached to the Moonlight Tournament—that they often find those willing to employ them.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Peerless and Precise Mercenary Ronin

219336.name: Ninja All-Stars: Jorogumo
219336.description:
Jorogumo is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

A horror, a cautionary tale, and a powerful opponent, the spider women called Jorogumo are useful, if questionable, allies. They descend from a witch of Kagejima that rescued the unwary or unfortunate from drowning in lakes and rivers. Claiming to rehabilitate them, she actually slowly poisoned and paralyzed them for use in dark and terrible spells. As her magics grew too much, Kagejima itself cursed her with a shape that evoked her horrid nature. This terrible judgment carried to her offspring who came to bear her form and her name. None trust the Joromugo, but a few unscrupulous warriors will employ them for their speed, strength, and enticing song.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Speedy, Spidery Mercenary Ronin

219337.name: Archaeologia: Patate d'Or Promo
219337.description:
Promo for the game Archaeologia, as handed out at Paris est Ludique 2015.

1 New discovery tile with the title Patate d'Or.

219338.name: X-tiles
219338.description: Each player starts with 7 X-shaped tiles. On your turn you add a tile. If your tile has two matching borders, you may play another. It's a race to get rid of your tiles first.

219339.name: Broken Boundaries
219339.description:
From the introduction:

The Farwood jungle has always been a source of mystery and danger. Occasionally those dangers have ventured out of the wilderness and into the frontier Alshon Region, but rarely is the evil as blatant as to deliver ultimatums to the human settlement nearby. Can heroes neutralize the danger?

An Adventure for 1-8 3rd level characters.

Episode 1 of the Grand Lich Saga.

219340.name: Activity Multi Challenge
219340.description:
Description from the publisher:

Activity has been around for more than 25 years, and Activity Multi Challenge is the latest version of the game, with players winning or losing together!

In this communication game, players on the team need to guess six terms before time runs out, and you need to plan well since 24 cards must be finished in order to win the game. Things to be guessed come in fifteen categories, and in addition to mentioning these categories to help others guess the hidden term, you can draw activity coins in order to give additional clues, with ten different types of activities being possible, from rhyming to alliteration to pantomiming to talking backwards and more.

219341.name: Bumpi
219341.description:
Description from the publisher:

The dice in Bumpi are unique in that they do not roll on the table; they bounce! This is because the dice are actually five-sided objects in which four of the sides are attached to the fifth, and to "roll" the die, you push it down onto the table, flattening all the sides, then let it spring up to roll around.

Why are you doing this? Because all players are presented with a task card at the start of each round. Sometimes you want to find an animal, sometimes a color, and often both — and you need to keep rolling until someone finds a solution and wins the card. Whoever collects five cards first wins the game!

219342.name: Shaking in the Sewer
219342.description:
From the introduction:

Something is going wrong beneath the city of Gelbrin. Tremors are causing panic, and the PC's are dispatched to find the source of the comotion in the city's extensive sewer network. Perhaps it's just the usual, rats and carrion crawlers, right?

A short, dangerous adventure for 4-5 chacters of level 1-3.

219343.name: New Gods War: Temple of One
219343.description:
From the introduction:

After Mono's plan to disrupt Nim-Aer 's worked, destroying a good chuck on the Moonshae islands. In a act of desperation sent the souls to barvaria to make sure they weren't destroyed. Now Nim-Aer and Mono are fighting for control of the soul's faith. Primrose heard of a rumor about a temple that holds something important to Mono. She feels shes needs an outside source to help give Nim-Aer's forces an advantage.

Adventure for 10th-14th level characters.

219344.name: The Womford Bat
219344.description:
From the introduction:

This supplement expands on the Womford and Bargewright Inn entries contained in Storm King's Thunder to spin a tale of Zhentarim intrigue and supply Dungeon Masters with secrets, deadly encounters and NPCs. This five-page adventure module contains a single session’s worth of material for adventurers exploring the Savage Frontier.

A three-hour adventure for 6th level characters.

219345.name: Caro Cane
219345.description:
Description from the publisher:

Caro Cane is a reworked design from Alex Randolph in which young players are presented with cards that show a watercolor illustration of a dog along with two other items — tree, ship, hat, car, cat, moon, ball, girl or boy — and players try to place cards with matching characteristics in the right location as quickly as possible in order to empty their hands.

219347.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 496 - Feb 2017)
rpgissuearticle: A Few Paragraphs From the Editor
The Isn't the Zine You're Looking For

219348.name: Trivial Pursuit: Star Wars – The Black Series Edition
219348.description:
Description from the publisher:

This Star Wars the Black Series edition of the Trivial Pursuit game gives players a chance to imagine that they are Jedi Masters of trivia! In this edition, players can recall favorite movie moments from the entire Star Wars saga including Star Wars: The Force Awakens. The game includes 1,800 questions in 6 Star Wars themed categories: The Cantina, The Force, Heroes, Villains and Scoundrels, The Saga, A Galaxy Far, Far Away, and Hyperspace. Players choose their allegiance and move around the board with a Jedi, Rebel Alliance, First Order, or Galactic Empire sculpted mover. The first player to collect all 6 wedges and answer the final question correctly wins.

219349.name: Sheep Sheep
219349.description:
In Sheep Sheep, players are trying to collect the most sheep of a particular color.

Each turn, a player has 1 minute and 30 seconds to exchange sheep from their own line of 4 with one from the 3x3 common area. Once time's up, they collect all the sheep in a row and/or column that have the same color in the common area and tuck them under their own personal goal sheep. They are then replaced with ones from the draw deck.

At the end of the game, players tally up their score. Every sheep they've collected is worth 1 point but those that match their goal card are worth 2. Whoever has the most points wins.

219350.name: No Way Out
219350.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).




https://www.facebook.com/nowayoutgame

You are alone. Except for the zombies! But there are guns and some ammo. You can fight, but there is No Way Out of this city infested with hideous creatures that will chase you to the end!

219352.name: Ultraz
219352.description:
In Ultraz, you're a team captain. Build your team of 15 Ultraz and defeat your opponent.

On your side, you'll have 6 active cards. The front 3 cards serve as offense while the back 3 serve as defense. With these cards, you'll attempt to pass, black and shoot.

First person to 3 points wins the game.

219353.name: Coffee Game
219353.description:
Coffee Game is a paper and pencil game where there will be all winners and one loser. The loser have to pay a coffee or whatever you want. ;-) A random player, called the writer, write an hidden number from 1 to 999. The player on his left start the game calling a number from 1 to 999 trying to not guess the written number. The writer tell if the number is higher or lower to the written number. The next player have to call a number in the remain range trying to not guess the written number. The writer tell if the called number is higher or lower to the written number. The range will always be lower. If the turn come back to the writer he have to call a -2 or +2 from the last called number. Who guess the number lost the game.
Example of play. 4 player A, B, C and D. A is the writer. A write 334 hidden. B have to call a number from 1 to 999. B call 562. Higher. C have to call a number from 1 to 562. C call 275. Lower. D have to call a number from 275 to 562. D call 499. Higher. A, the writer, have to call a -2 number from the last call (499). A call 497. Higher. B have to call a number from 275 to 497. B call 330. Lower. C have to call a number from 330 to 497. C call 399. Higher. D have to call a number from 330 to 399. D call 331. Lower. A, the writer, have to call a +2 number from last called 331. A call 333. Lower. B have to call a number from 333 to 399. B call 340. Higher. C have to call a number from 333 to 340. C call 334. Guessed. C lost the game and have to pay a coffee.

219354.description:
Microworld has modular rules that you combine to create several different scenarios. This promo supplies two new additional rule tiles that you can add to the base game to increase the variability of the game even more.

The first additional rule (B1) applies during the setup: it gives a personal secret goal tile to the players, but only the first player who reach the goal will score the points. Moreover, you will find a bonus Goal Tile in the promo.

The second additional rule (D1) applies during the game. It establishes that when players place in outside cells they will score one more point.
219354.name: Microworld: BoardGameGeek Promo 1

219355.description:
Microworld has modular rules that you combine to create several different scenarios. This promo supplies two new additional rule tiles that you can add to the base game to increase the variability of the game even more.

The first additional rule (C1) applies during the setup. Players will have a common special ability during the game. Moreover, you will find a bonus Mutation Tile in the promo.

The second additional rule (H1) applies at the end of the game. If players are able to control a tissue alone, they will score two more points.
219355.name: Microworld: BoardGameGeek Promo 2

219356.name: Dreamchaser: A Game of Destiny
219356.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




From the introduction:

A game that empowers players to immerse themselves into their own desires, their own fantasies. A game that doesn't tell you what you are playing, you tell it what you want to play. Dreamchaser adapts to you.

219357.name: Wearing the Cape: The Roleplaying Game
219357.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cape (plural capes): literally, a sleeveless garment hanging from the neck over the back and shoulders; figuratively, a superhuman who has chosen to act as a superhero. Synonyms: hero, mask, super, superhero. Connotations: ‘cape’ is used as both a familiar and derogatory term for superheroes, who often casually refer to themselves as capes but generally consider it a demeaning term when applied to them by the press.

Barlow’s Guide to Superhumans

What if the world changed?

Ten years ago, everything did. The world we knew ended with The Event and the appearance of hundreds, thousands of superhuman individuals—ordinary men and women empowered in the blink of an eye, between one breath and the next, transformed or given extraordinary gifts. With this gamebook, you can take on the roll of a superhuman—a breakthrough—who has chosen to “wear the cape” and become a superhero. Or at least come as close to one as you can in a world with legal institutions that are adverse to the idea of super-powered vigilantes!

Wearing the Cape

In 2011, Marion G. Harmon indie-published Wearing the Cape, a superhero novel. WtC was enthusiastically received by fans looking for good superhero fiction, and it and its six sequels have consistently been ranked in the top of their genre category. The books have introduced Astra, Artemis, and other "capes" to a growing legion of fans. Many of these fans are also avid superhero RPG gamers, who expressed a keen interest in seeing the world of the books given its own sourcebook or gamebook. And so...

Wearing the Cape: The Roleplaying Game

Built on the FATE CORE system by Evil Hat Productions, Wearing the Cape: The Roleplaying Game uses an open system of Aspects, Ratings, and Stunts to describe any conceivable character and superhuman power, as well as organizations, cities, regions, and any kind of environment the heroes may encounter. 220 pages of gamebook, with 30 dense pages of Post-Event World background to provide endless ideas for locations and threats, Wearing the Cape: The Roleplaying Game is a gateway for anyone who wishes to adventure in the world of the novels, or who wishes to make a world of their own!

219358.name: Jadetech: Black Jade
219358.description:
Publisher blurb:
Jadetech: Black Jade is the fifth in a six-part supplement series for the Jadepunk: Tales From Kausao City roleplaying game.

In this digital supplement, you will find everything you need to outfit your Jianghu hero with Jadetech devices that utilize black jade. You will also learn the history of black jade, how it is refined, and how it is used in daily life throughout the world. Filled with plot hooks for your games, this is more than just an equipment supplement - it's an add-on for the setting of Jadepunk.

Jade is at the core of the Jadepunk setting. If you are a fan of Jadepunk, you are not going to want to miss the Jadetech series.

219359.name: Solaris
219359.description:
Description from the publisher:

Space stations equipped with high-performance solar panels called Solaris circle red giants and send the generated energy directly to Earth using new laser and wormhole technology. In the science-fiction space game Solaris, players try to solar mine the suns of other galaxies.

Solaris is a strategy game with many tactical choices won by the player who manages the tight resources the best.

219360.name: Kidnap Machine
219360.description:
User summary
Kidnap Machine is a print-and-play solitaire boardgame. There is a variant Version called Obscura (see below).

You woke up in a dark room, and you feel the presence of something horrible. You must get out of the room using your wisdom and luck.

To play the game, you need a die, two pawns, a pencil, and a printed square-grid play sheet.

You may move two squares in a turn, but must end your turn after you try to enter a new square, in which case you roll a die. You cannot move if the result is less than the movement difficulty designated on the original square. Otherwise, you move to the new square and roll a die to determine the movement difficulty for that square.

Then the monster moves. Basically it moves along the predetermined route, but while you are within the area of its sight, it approaches you.

You win the game if you reach the goal square without being captured by the monster.

The PnP files are on the designer's website (see Weblinks). This includes a second Version on the game called 'Obscura'.

Obscura
Suddenly, the lights went out.
The darkness came one step closer.

"Obscura" is an improved version that allows you to play "Kidnap Machine" without using a pencil by using working tiles.
Enjoy a difficult escape from the labyrinth now clothed in deeper darkness.

Publisher's summary
Kidnap Machineは、Print and Playの一人用ボードゲームです。
あなたは暗闇の空間で目を覚ましました。あなたを捕らえようとする、何か恐ろしいものの気配をすぐそこに感じます。
運と知恵を頼りに、この恐ろしい状況を脱しましょう。

プレイシート以外に用意するものは、サイコロと駒と鉛筆です。
あなたは、決められたスタート地点から出口まで、隣り合うマスへ駒を移動させていきます。
未知のマスに移動するときはサイコロを振り、今いるマスの脱出難易度を超えれば移動に成功します。
その際、移動先のマスの脱出難易度もサイコロで決定します。
すでに難易度がわかっているマス同士の間の移動であれば、１ターンに２回、自由に行なえます。
あなたの移動が済む度に、ボード上で化物が動きます。
彼らは基本的に決められたルートに沿って移動しますが、あなたを視界に捉えると追跡をはじめます。
彼らに捕まってしまったらゲームオーバーです！

Obscura
すぐそこで、明かりが消えた。
暗闇が、また一歩近づいた。

"Obscura"は、タイルを工作することで"Kidnap Machine"を鉛筆を使わずに遊べるようにした改良版です。
より深い暗闇に閉ざされた迷宮での、困難な脱出劇をお楽しみください。

219362.description: The Marines have arrived in the Middle-East! Nothing as efficient as a good artillery barrage to keep the enemy on its toes... Thanks to these observers, regimental and division artillery pieces can deliver the most powerful punch to crush the enemies of the Allies.
219362.name: Dust Tactics: USMC Observer Squad – "Artillery Scouts"

219363.description:
When the Imperial Japanese Navy advanced through the Pacific, it conquered a vast number of remote islands. Ordered to defend them were a few resolute soldiers who didn’t have much equipment, but had a lot of free time on their hands. So they did as any soldier in the world does when there’s nothing else to do: they dug in.

When the reconquest of the Pacific started, the United States Marine Corps had to deal with fortified positions right away. Some small islands had more bunkers and pillboxes than they had coconut trees! It was quickly pretty obvious that the Corps would need to adapt to get the job done.

The Marines were not prepared for this, as not everyone could carry a flame-thrower, therefore they needed something more practical. The Corps found its solution with the creation of the Demolition Squads. These men would be given basic instructions on how to handle explosives: throw a satchel full of them in roughly the right direction, and run the other way as fast as possible.

It was soon evident that if you were sent into one of these squads, you were soon to meet your maker - whatever you conceived Him to be. With such a high rate of casualties, they called themselves ‘The Saints’. Nevertheless, these Marines are immensely respected in the Corps, and often benefit from slightly more relaxed standards of discipline.
219363.name: Dust Tactics: USMC Demolition Squads – "The Saints"

219364.name: Desperados of Dice Town: Tuco Promo Character
219364.description:
This promo character replaces a 'Brain' character from any of the gangs.

When escaped, his powers are:
1 action symbol: Draw and keep the last Wild West card discarded.
2 action symbols: Draw the last 2 Wild West cards discarded and keep one.
3 action symbols: Draw the last 3 Wild West cards discarded and keep one.

This promo was available with issue 72 of Plato Magazine.

219365.description: The Marines have arrived! Deployed in front of any USMC force, the Recon Squads provide intelligence and are able to communicate efficiently with fire support units should they encounter any threat. These are sneaky, and deadly, Marines!
219365.name: Dust Tactics: USMC Recon Squads – "Force Recon"

219366.description: Armed with a variety of powerful short range weapons, these Marines are among the most feared in the Pacific. Their Flamethrowers can blow up anything from the heaviest walker to the bulkiest bunker.
219366.name: Dust Tactics: USMC Assault Squad – "Hell Blazers"

219367.name: Challenge Austria
219367.description:
Description from the publisher:

Austria in all its facets is at the center of Challenge Austria. From landscape to music, history to sport, one should not only have their red-white-red knowledge up to date, but also be ready to shine in their negotiation skills since questions are not only answered, but also bought and exchanged. During the game, players have a number of question cards in their possession and can answer only those about Austria as a whole and those about the region of the country in which their game figure is currently located. Thus, you might want to trade cards with others, offer them cash, move to new locations, or pay to return cards that are too difficult to answer. Too pay too much, though, for in the end the first player to collect a previously agreed upon sum of money wins the game.

219368.description: There aren't many soldiers on the planet brave enough to face five men armed with Browning Automatic Rifles, or they have a serious death wish. The staple of the Marine Corps is this squad, which can be found in numbers wherever the USMC fights.
219368.name: Dust Tactics: USMC Rifle Squad – "Mavericks"

219369.description: The Marines have arrived in the Middle-East! And they bring with them some deadly new weapons, just out of Detroit's arsenals. The recoilless rifles give these soldiers an incredible firepower against anything on the battlefield. And you can be sure Marines will make the most of it! They are presented here in their Babylon camo, as used by USMC forces in the Middle-East, circa 1947.
219369.name: Dust Tactics: USMC Anti-tank Squad – "Hot Shots"

219370.name: Tokyo Xanadu
219370.description:
It is an action role-playing game, like the Xanadu series, along with elements from the Persona series of Japanese role-playing games. It has a party-based real-time battle system with dungeon exploration.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo_Xanadu Tokyo Xanadu]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

219371.name: Utawarerumono
219371.description:
At times, the player will come to a "decision point" where he or she is given the chance to choose from a single or multiple options. Unlike many other visual novels, these choices do not affect the final outcome of the story.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Utawarerumono Utawarerumono]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

219372.name: Utawarerumono: Mask of Deception
219372.description:
User Summary

Utawarerumono: Mask of Deception is the sequel to Utawarerumono.

219373.name: Utawarerumono: Mask of Truth
219373.description:
User Summary

Utawarerumono: Mask of Truth is the sequel to Utawarerumono: Mask of Deception.

219374.name: Chicken out!
219374.description:
Chickens and foxes are at play in Chicken out!, with players taking turns revealing cards from their decks, adding (or subtracting) values to a generally escalating sum, and hoping not to exceed 21 because then the active player has to take all the revealed cards. Players can choose to chicken out and not risk failure, but sometimes you'll need to take a chance to win.

Four kinds of foxes lie in wait among the cards, and they can mix up the revealed sum, counting as the last number played, escalating the sum to 20, or resetting the sum to zero to start the tension rising all over again. Play out all your cards to win!

219375.name: Circo Delfino
219375.description: In Circo Delfino, players want to find the right combinations of colored dolphins as quickly as possible — sometimes even combining primary-colored dolphins to make secondary-colored ones! — in order to collect more cards than anyone else.

219376.name: Das Spiel mit dem Essen
219376.description: In Das Spiel mit dem Essen, players move their pieces around the plate on the game board that's divided into different food groups and attempt to answer food-related questions in order to win chips — and no, not potato chips, but point chips!

219379.name: Homeward Bound: simple rules for player-owned base
219379.description:
There comes a time in the lives of Player Characters when they start wondering about the point of adventuring and accumulating wealth and experience. Of course, some mercenary types do so for the sake of doing so, entering the vicious circle of killing monsters only so they can kill more powerful monsters and eventually die a horrible deathin a forgotten tomb, their bodies eventually looted by some other adventurers. Yet other players want their alter egos to actually achieve something in their lives, have a place to return to between adventures, something to protect and care about. A home.

Inside you will find:

a customizable description of such a home for players: The Sleeping Manor
over 15 possible upgrades to the house that provide in-game benefits
a number of locations surrounding the Manor
list of 40 random events that occur when PCs are away, adventuring
ideas for an over-arching plot involving the Manor, the PCs and their evil neighbor
a hand-drawn map of the area

Update 1.1: Now with a printer-friendly, black and white version! Let's save the environment together:)

Still not convinced?

What is special about “Homeward Bound?” In short – there is nothing available like it. It is truly unique. In my experience players often want some kind of a base, HQ, or castle to operate from, but their GMs either don’t have time to do anything but “Ok, this inn is your base now” or, quite contrary, buy or develop a set of rules so complex that without an Excel spreadsheet it is impossible to control all these rooms, income sources, soldiers, servants and so on. What is more, in DnD 5 players often complain they have no way to spend the money they earn/loot/steal – magic items are usually found and lifestyles are too vague to care about.

“Homeward Bound” is lightweight (only 24 pages long) and it is purposefully short, but it provides a whole lot of options, for both game mechanics and the campaign’s narrative. It gives the game a whole new angle, a home they can care for. It starts with descriptions of the house, in two versions for the GM/players to choose. If they want more – there is a set of upgrades they can purchase. These are not purely cosmetic additions, but provide tangible game effects, like extra hps or speed. If they want more – the camera pulls out and several neighbours are presented to visit or fight with. And finally, if they are hooked up, there is the Big Bad Guy – a framework for a campaign, that can be run on its own, or as an extension to the main story.

Although nominally for DnD5, it can be easily adapted to any game system. It’s short, but full of ideas and options. It’s unique. It’s streamlined and easy to adapt to any campaign. It’s easy on the eye. It’s here.

Source: Publisher Blurb

219380.name: Star Wars Hero: The Jedi Academy Campaign
219380.description:
User summary:

This setting adapts the Star Wars media franchise "look and feel" to the Hero System game rules. Most of the content focuses on implementation of build mechanics and point pool costs - the assumption being players will be very familiar with the setting itself. The setting is provided as HTML with, essentially, embeds a series of downloadable documents in either OpenDocument or PDF format.

219381.name: Dark World: The Demonic Renaissance
219381.description:
From the introduction:

Established in 2001, the Dark World RPG is an original creation free-form fantasy role playing game run in a by-post story format. We are a fully moderated group with an active GM team, who are constantly at work helping players and creating game content. Players can participate in the expansive game world with room for sub plots and player driven threads. We strive for a fun gaming experience that is dynamic, engaging, and continuously evolving. Our fantasy realm can suit an array of writing tastes, such as drama, horror, adventure, comedy, romance and more.

219382.name: FEAR RPG (8th Ed.)
219382.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Some roleplaying games are so simplistic that any realism is lost.

Other roleplaying games are so complex that they become unplayable.

FEAR RPG was born out of frustration with these types of roleplaying games, and has been designed from scratch to be realistic yet flexible. The rules can be adapted to any fantasy world you care to use. Hopefully there’s enough depth to satisfy experienced roleplayers, and enough explanation to get novices started too. Sadly, I’m not an artist so there are no pretty pictures to break up the text and tables.

219383.name: Alice in Wonderland: A Curious Collection of Puzzles
219383.description:
A trivia game where players earn points by answering themed questions on their turn.

On their turn a player picks a card from one of four difficulty piles. Scoring points for the difficulty of the card if they answer correctly. Play continues until a player accumulates an agreed upon number of points.

Each player has an "Eat Me" and "Drink Me" card which they may play to alter the score of a given card in accordance to the instructions on the "Eat Me"/"Drink Me" card.

219384.name: The Pegana Mythos
219384.description:
From publisher blurb:

Maidens weaving a spell of clouds

Over a ruined city of the spice
