Sunken beneath the venom sea,

Blood-painted cultists

Chanting beneath the storm moon,

Sacrificing innocents to Mung

In the name of immortality …

The world of a thousand wonders which inspired H. P. Lovecraft’s Dreamlands, and the Cthulhu Mythos Comes to vivid life once more In this Swords and Sorcery supplement For any Fantasy Role-Playing Game.

From the peerless works of Lord Dunsany, from my surreptitious campaign notes they come at last: the secret Gods, Monsters, and Heroes who inspired the very foundation of the World of Castle Oldskull.

How was the world created? Who created it? Who were the first gods? Where did Odin and Zeus and Ra and all of the other sacred children come from? What is the meaning of mortal life? What is the lost mystery of the progeny of Yog-Sothoth? Who are the invading minions of Azathoth and Nyarlathotep and Great Cthulhu, and how will the irrevocable Apocalypse end the world?

Learn all of that and more herein, in my years-long expansion of the phantasmagorian dream tome which inspired Borges, Del Toro, Gaiman, Gygax, Howard, Lovecraft, Moorcock, Smith, Tolkien, Vance and many more: Lord’s Dunsany’s fabled world of wonder, re-sculpted by me as the firmament for your epic Swords and Sorcery campaign: the PEGANA MYTHOS.

This is a massive compendium of monsters, gods, magic items, treasures, lands, mega-dungeon locations, and glimpses of the World of Oldskull. Herein you will find 55 detailed entries detailing the gods, heroes, antiheroes, prophets, and the most ancient monsters and undead who populate the World of Oldskull. You will also find cryptic notes pertaining to hundreds of lands and locales, forbidden artifacts, new magic items, lost cities and underworlds, and the priesthoods of Pegana. How does the Pegana Mythos tie into the Cthulhu Mythos? What is the true past of the world? What terrible secrets and fabulous treasures await the most reckless heroes who dare to plunder the strongholds of Saigoth, or to swim in the poisonous vampire-infested seas above the Doggerland?

Come learn and know!

219385.name: Mallory's Wales
219385.description:
From publisher blurb:

A map of the world of Arthur Pendragon according to Mallory, useable with any roleplaying system.

219386.name: Shuigong: The Emperor's Watery Secret
219386.description:
From publisher blurb:

A quiet terror grips the Forbidden City – something moves beneath the Emperor's streets, devouring those who use the city's wondrous waterworks. Where once the city was home to wonder, now fear wanders the streets, lurking in every quiet drain and burbling fountain. The soldiers sent to end the threat have not returned. The Chancellor has come to realize the folly of using force to solve his problems, and now seeks a more competent, well-rounded solution to the nightmare lurking in the sewers. The reward for restoring tranquility to the empire's capital borders on the obscene – gold and accolades are the least of the rewards offered for the adventurers capable of bringing the monster's head forth. Can you slay the Beast Beneath the Streets in its own lair?

219387.name: Edgewater's Folly
219387.description:
From publisher blurb:

Underground Adventure!

The city of Edgewater is under attack, though few realize it. Most just assume the rats and other vermin in the sewers have started spreading a new form of plague. They’re partially right — rats are spreading a virulent new disease throughout the city. But for those willing to plumb their filthy depths, the city’s sewer system holds many secrets. More is at play than just some filthy rats and a new strain of disease. Edgewater’s Folly is a 7th level Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventure of heroic proportions!

219388.name: Directive Infinity X
219388.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Infinity Directive!

The Directive’s highly trained agents police inhuman threats straight out of myth and nightmare! When an underground prison and research laboratory evacuates and goes on lockdown, only Directive Agents possess the necessary expertise to bring the situation under control. Can the PCs fight past cybernetic slaves, robotic constructs, and psychopathic monsters to take back control of Facility X?

Directive Infinity X is a stand-alone modern-fantasy dungeon adventure for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game filled with deadly traps, new monsters, intriguing villains, and more! It is recommended for 7th level PCs, who should expect to be 9th level or blasted radioactive dust by the time they complete this epic adventure!

219389.name: Sewer Bestiary
219389.description:
From publisher blurb:

There is no avoiding the fact that big populations create a lot of waste. All big cities need some system to remove this waste, otherwise in short order they would be overwhelmed by filth and plagued by disease. In smaller cities this system may be as simple as a series of gutters which carries the contents of voided bladders, chamber pots, and garderobes through the open air into a local river or cesspit. More technically advanced cities often have systems of tunnels, or sewers, beneath the city. Sewers are designed to control waste water, refuse, and possibly even prevent flooding during high rains. Though they play a vital role in sanitation, sewers are often ill-maintained (out of sight, out of mind) and rarely patrolled. In fact, in most cities the only folks who are interested in the underground sewer networks tend to be smugglers and thieves, not guards or citizens.

In older cities, such sewers may not be the only structures or passages below the surface. Natural caverns, secret tunnels or vaults, local mines, garbage pits, and the remains of old cities may be intermingled with basements, cisterns, water wells, and rifts from unstable geology. In addition to the garbage and waste the city removes or stores below ground, unsavory characters use the dark pits to hide bodies, failed experiments, and contraband too risky to be caught with. The bigger the city, the more shame its residents try to sweep far, far under the rug. But nothing stays buried forever. When trash, rot, disease, magic, and forgotten ruins mix, treacherous things are bound to grow. And in time, those dangers have to be dealt with…

219390.name: Fire Rooster
219390.description:
From publisher blurb:

In honor of the lunar Chinese New Year, Skirmisher Publishing is proud to announce the release of “Fire Rooster: A Monster for 5th Edition”!

Fire Roosters are elemental animals made of living metal that have glowing red metallic feathers, are studded with numerous small gems, and have low flames wreathing their bodies. Beyond the elemental planes that are their native homes, such creatures are most likely to be found in places like volcanoes and temple complexes of deities with which they are affiliated, where they typically serve as guardians or beloved pets. In cultures that observe the Lunar New Year and adhere to the Asian Zodiac, spellcasters often summon Fire Roosters to take part in annual celebrations, where they are displayed, doted on, fed treats, and directed to continuously set off pyrotechnics for the duration of their visits.

219391.name: Mage Armor Version II
219391.description:
From publisher blurb:

A second look at the Mage Armor spell. Like previous issues of Spell Innovations, this supplement presents alternate version of an iconic spell, but rather than developing several differing spells, this issue presents a system of customizing the Mage Armor spell by breaking it up into a multi-level platform and offering options to grant varying effects as spell options. This issue also introduces a new feat, a new arcane sub-school, and a new wizard archetype built around the reimagined Mage Armor spell series.

219392.name: Madness & Other Colours
219392.description:
From publisher blurb:

A long time ago, in an evil empire far, far away, the Emperor Sool demanded that those who offend him should be punished in a most vicious way. So were created the Sool Statuettes, and their maker was none other than Loric Nygh, a suave and cunning magician who had developed ghastly engines of sorcery for just such a purpose.

Baldomeer the Vain, a famed collector of antiquities, has supposedly come into possession of a Sool Statuette. His great rival, Serjedny the Immaculate, does not believe that the Sool Statuettes exist any longer, and that what Baldomeer has is a fake. He intends to expose him as a fraudster, but to do so, he needs the help of some capable people. People like the adventurers... Madness & Other Colours takes the characters into the dangerous world of an insane sorcerer and those who still worship him. They will face all manner of horror as they attempt to to get to the bottom of the mystery of the Sool Statuettes and their mysterious creator.

A Mythras scenario for 4-6 competent and strong-willed characters.

219393.name: Shake, Rattle & Roll
219393.description:
The game is a handheld dome containing 15 dice (5 red, 5 yellow, 5 blue) and whose base contains a 4x4 grid of slots for the dice to settle into.

The object is to shake and rattle the dome so that 4 dice of the same color form a straight line or a square. You score the sum of the numbers on the dice in that line or square. A diagonal counts double, and a center square counts triple.

219394.name: Cosmic Warriors
219394.description:
From the introduction:

Cosmic Warriors is a roleplaying game setting and rules system that allows you to play out anime-inspired adventures with a group of friends.

User summary:

The rules are a derived version of The Black Hack; the book includes rules and setting, and is a standalone product.

219395.name: Havenshield: The Complete Players Handbook
219395.description:
From the introduction:

Is This A New Edition? No. It’s just a reworking of the rules into a cleaner format, but does include several Optional Rules for things like Alignment, Point Buy Attributes, etc.

User summary:

Includes everything players need to create, equip, and play their characters.

219396.name: Dragoonies
219396.description:
The main characters in Dragoonies have discovered a treasure chest and naturally each of them wants to take as much of the gold as possible for themselves — but to do that, they need to solve tasks more quickly than anyone else.

At the start of play, a circle of sixteen dragon cards is formed in the center of the table; each card is different from each other, whether due to color, horns, or small objects with which they're equipped. On a turn, the active player reveals 2-6 search cards — with more cards making for a tougher challenge — then all the players race to determine the characteristics that are most common on the search cards, e.g., the color blue, a key, or three horns. Multiple solutions might exist, and when you find one, you want to cover an unoccupied dragon card that corresponds to the answer. If you do so correctly, you earn a Drachentaler, and whoever collects the most money in the end wins!

219397.name: Pillars of Eternity II: Deadfire
219397.description:
User Summary

Sequel to Pillars of Eternity.

219398.name: Dark Souls III - The Ringed City
videogamecompilation: Dark Souls III: The Fire Fades Edition
219398.description:
User Summary

Journey to the world’s end to search for the Ringed City and encounter new lands, new bosses, new enemies with new armor, magic and items.

219399.name: 2 for 1 Power Pack: Winter Blast/Summer Sports 2
219399.description:
From Box:

Winter Games!
Biathlon. Snowball Fight. Snowboard Freeride. Half-Pipe. SkipJump. Hockey. Slalom Skiing. Shootout (Slapshot). Sledding.

12 Summer Games!
Target Football. Archery. Bocce Ball. Soccer. Mini Golf. Shuffleboard Arcade. 5 Basketball Games.

219400.name: Maximum Racing: Super Karts
219400.description:
User Summary

Racing across the tarmac only inches above the road Super Karts gives an adrenalin rush like nothing else.

219401.name: Gho...Gho...Ghosty
219401.description: Let's go to the amusement park! Instead of simply gawking at the attractions, however, the players in Gho...Gho...Ghosty get to command their own ghost train, competing against others to travel far and nab the most passengers. Players take turns in the role of Mr. Ghosty, collecting two cards from the ghost train card display. When the ghost train reaches a certain length, the train takes off — and when all 75 wagons are gone, the best ghost train boss will be determined based on the passengers they have.

219402.name: Orange Toss
219402.description:
Description from the publisher:

Orange Toss is a fast-thinking, unpredictable adult party game. How fast can you come up with an answer before the Orange Timer
runs out? Don't get caught with your peel down! The player left holding the Orange Timer when the time runs out collects the card. The player with the fewest cards at the end of 13 rounds wins!

219403.name: Insectini
219403.description: Yikes! All the foliage in the forest has been stirred up by a violent gust of wind, and 36 little critters have lost their shelter. Equipped with the appropriate leaf cards, the players in Insectini need to hide the insects again leaf by leaf as quickly as possible. To do this, they need to spot the tiny details on these critters — a light bulb on a firefly, a grub playing the guitar, a caterpillar munching on a snack — and cover them with a matching leaf in their hand.

219404.name: King John
219404.description:
King John is having a party with lots of guests. Unfortunately he's terrible at remembering the faces of those guests, so he needs your help.

In the game King John, four cards are revealed at the table each round, with each card showing some combination of characters. The active player shows these cards to all, then hides them and rolls dice to determine whether the other players are searching for a particular character or the character who appears most (or least) often on the cards.

219405.name: Memo-Palace
219405.description:
In Memo-Palace, players will first hide the animal tiles in the castle, but they won't just place the tiles and leave it at that. No, they must tell a story about each animal as they place it, with all the players paying attention to the stories.

Once all the animals have been placed, players must then attempt to find matching pairs of animals in the castle, but they also need to combine the two stories for the two tiles that they find, and if they don't remember the stories, then they must return the tiles. Thus, Memo-Palace combines storytelling and memory in a new way to create a fresh challenge and experience for young players each game.

219407.name: Pixbox
219407.description:
In Pixbox, the active player lays out six transparent cards at random. These cards show one or more blue squares on them, with the squares arranged in various patterns. The player then lays out a red task card, and everyone must visualize — without touching the blue cards! — how they could arrange one or more blue cards in an overlapping manner, but with only the transparent areas covering one another, so as to recreate the image shown on the red task card.

As soon as a player thinks they have a solution, they yell out and attempt to demonstrate their idea with the transparent cards. If they're correct, they keep the cards they used, and whoever collects the most points wins.

219408.name: Shop Hop
219408.description: Players in Shop Hop need to visit the eight stores and buy something faster than anyone else, but to move they need to spin the dial to see which of the six colored paths they can move on each turn. Some stores are closed when you first approach them, but if you can enter through the key symbol — or wave a little money at them — then they'll open for business.

219409.name: Tigerilla
219409.description:
In Tigerilla, players can assemble animals in new ways thanks to the velcro on the game tiles.

In game terms, players decide whether they want to assemble animals or search for patterns, then they place the tiles with the desired thing face down. On a turn, a player reveals two of the tiles; if they match (animal or pattern, which is desired), then they turn over a third tile. If that tile matches as well, they earn a point, and whoever earns five points first wins.

219410.name: Wild Shots
219410.description: In the trick-taking game Wild Shots, players want to win tricks in order to "shoot" the other players and damage them as at the end of the fourth round, whoever has the fewest hits becomes the new Sheriff of Silver City.

219411.description: Zebulon: Galactic Control is a space themed strategic board game that allows you to create a new layout every time you play using 40 planets on 20 tiles. Complete missions, lay traps and confront other players in battle. Players race around the map by purchasing fuel en route to completing missions. When you finish a mission pick up rewards and upgrade your ship. Use reward cards to attack your foe or help you win the game.
219411.name: Zebulon: Galactic Control

219412.name: Cows Abhor Hamburgers
219412.description:
Cows Abhor Hamburgers is a third-party, unofficial, unauthorized expansion card set for Cards Against Humanity. The cards are somewhat more offensive than the base game.

There has been a single print run of cards, which occurred 2014 and were available by preorder only. Now available via print & play under a creative commons license.

219413.name: Super Dungeon Arena
219413.description:
Description from the publisher:

Super Dungeon: Arena is an alternative game mode for players to use with their collection of Super Dungeon models. In Arena, two players each take control of a mighty warband consisting of one Hero, one mini-boss, two spawning points, and the spawning points’ associated monsters. These warbands then do battle against one another in a challenge known as a scenario. Each scenario has its own unique rules and victory conditions, which require a warband to use its abilities and strengths in new and clever ways.

Super Dungeon: Arena includes a beautifully illustrated rulebook, an intricately detailed double-sided game board, an Arena Champion model, and numerous cards, tokens and dice for players to battle it out head-to-head. As players construct their own warbands from any combination of Super Dungeon models or from a single warband box, Arena promises to be an exciting experience each time.

Super Dungeon introduced the world to the whimsy and charm of chibi-miniature board games inspired by classic video games, and it continues to be the leader in providing a fun and lighthearted family board game experience. Strongly supported with dozens of expansions which provide new Heroes, monsters, dungeon tiles, and gameplay options, Super Dungeon: Arena is sure to be fun, new edition for longtime fans and new fans of Super Dungeon!

219415.name: Dungeons & BEERS
219415.description:
from the introduction

Dungeons & BEERS is supposed to be fun and not serious. If you want to use this in a serious game feel free to try, but it will most likely suck. The rules are minimal, simple, and free. To play it should only cost you some beer and pretzels. The rules are simple enough to memorize after reading it, which takes less than 5 minutes. But if you must print it, you might as well figure the cost of paper and ink in and watch your cash shrink a little more.

219416.name: Chi
219416.description:
user summary

Designed as a simple and quick roleplaying system. There are no "skills", "abilities", or "attributes". Rather, there is a single "stat" used for everything, via a dice pool.

219417.name: Beasties
219417.description: Object is to line up 3 cards of the same colour, and three cards of the same insect.

219418.description:
Description from the publisher:

Critter Combat is a 2 - 4 player battle and capture card game with cool critters that have even cooler abilities. This game is played with one of 4 included 26 card decks, and a set of 18 habitat cards. Play your cards for abilities to set back your enemy or bolster your positions, use them to capture habitats, or take on your opponent in adorable battle.

Your army of fuzzy critters has been pushed too far! Take your cute, furry, and fuzzy animals to war on a no–holds–barred mission to destroy, decimate, and humiliate your enemies. Take back the trees and land that are rightfully, and not so rightfully, yours!
219418.name: Critter Combat

219420.name: Linage
219420.description:
Introduction

Linage is a finite territory game for two players: Vertical and Horizontal. It's played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square board. Both players must have access to a shared pool of identical stones.


Definitions

A region is a maximal set of orthogonally contiguous empty points.

A line is a set of three orthogonally contiguous empty points on the same row or column.

A region is owned by Vertical if it contains no horizontal lines, and by Horizontal if it contains no vertical lines. A region is free if it's owned by neither player.


Play

Vertical plays first, then turns alternate. On their turn, a player must either pass or place a stone on an empty point which is part of a free region. At all times, every region must include at least one line.

When both players pass in succession, the game ends. A player's score is the number of points in the regions that they own, plus a komi (see below) in the case of Horizontal. The player with the highest score wins.


Komi

The komi is the number of points which is added to Horizontal's score at the end of the game as a compensation for playing second. Before the game starts, the first player chooses the value of komi, and then the second player chooses sides. To avoid ties, it is suggested that komi be of the form n + 0.5, where n is a whole number.

219421.name: Dokusaisha wa Tsurai yo
219421.description:
User summary
独裁者はつらいよ (Dokusaisha wa Tsurai yo) is the card game Dictator wa Tsurai yo (in English 'It's tough being a dictator').

Dictator wa Tsurai yo is a card game with a theme of a dictator in old Soviet Union. This games uses nine sets of four identical cards. Your objective is to score points by completing sets of four cards in your hand.

Each turn, you ask another player to give you a specific card. If that player has any, all of them are given to you, otherwise you draw a card from the deck. If you have a set of four cards in your hand, you display them in front of you and score victory points (similar to Old Maid or Go Fish).

A special effect is activated when a set is made. A set of chancellors has may purge a person (remove one displayed card from the game), a set of generals may kidnap a person (steal one displayed card), and so on.

When a player is betrayed by people, that player takes a horseshit token, which counts as negative points.

The highest scorer wins the game.

Publisher summary
旧ソ連の独裁者を題材にしたカードゲームです。
手札を４枚づつ配り、手番プレイヤーは手札に持っている番号を、任意のプレイヤーに持っているか聞きます。
聞かれたプレイヤーは、それを持っていた場合全て引き渡します。持っていなかった場合、聞いたプレイヤーは山札から一枚ドローします。
これを繰り返し、同じ数字が手元に4枚そろったら公開して得点札になります。
公開したタイミングで、各カードの能力が発動します。
カードの能力で得点札を拉致されたプレイヤーには「馬糞トークン」がなすりつけられます。当然得点はマイナスになります。
より多くの得点を得たプレイヤーの勝利です。

219422.name: Subterranean Cities
219422.description: Subterranean Cities is played in four rounds, during which players will take turns placing one of their three crew members in their ship to add and activate ship part tiles. These parts are used to maneuver the ship and collect more parts. Victory points are earned by building your ship, and refurbishing ship parts into structures. The player with the most Victory Points at the end of the final round is the winner.

219423.description: Digital application for record keeping and dice rolling in Arkham Horror.
219423.name: Arkham Horror: Toolkit

219424.name: Early Pacific Battles
219424.description:
This game kit published by Bruce Moore covers all aspects of 1942 battles in the Pacific. Air to Air, Air to Surface (fixed installations and naval task forces), Naval Surface and Land Combat are all treated as well as multi-player strategic combat embracing all of the above. Scenarios are included for the significant engagements as well as several hypothetical meetings, for example, War Plan Orange III battleship duels and surface action off Malaya had Prince of Wales and Repulse escaped air strikes.

The game kit aspect is the supply of hundreds of small coloured blocks to which unit details must be glued. Torpedo tracks and cloud formations for strategic game weather handling must be cut out.

219425.name: PORTAS
219425.description:
User summary
PORTAS is a two-player card game with a theme of treasure hunting. Players are competing treasure hunters, and at beginning of the game, each player has the same deck of cards, and each card is numbered 1-6. Two treasure cards (valued 11-15) are revealed on the table.

Players take turns placing a card from their hand on either of the treasure cards revealed. When the total value of the cards placed on the treasure equals to the treasure value, the current player takes the treasure and scores points. Then a new treasure comes on the table.

All cards in players' hands are public information except the one they would draw at the beginning of their turn. So you should play cards so that your rival doesn't take a treasure next turn, but sometimes you are forced to play a bad card, and there's some chance the rival would draw the exact card they want.

The game ends when all treasures are taken or both players passes in a row. The highest scorer wins the game.

As long as a child can count to 15, the game is easy enough for the young. The game uses original art and public domain artwork.

Publisher's summary
PORTAS （読み方は「ポータス」。造語。日本語でも英語でも同じです。）

二人のプレイヤーはトレジャーハンターとなり、宝箱に眠る宝を取り合います。
宝箱の底には魔法の鍵があり、宝はその鍵を手に入れないと数分の内に消えてしまうのです。
宝箱の中身の残りの数を考えて、「丁度最後の一個を手に入れる」事を計算しながらより多くの宝を手に入れるのが目的のゲームです。
バケツやバッグ、木箱等の入れ物を使い宝を自分のもとに運び出します。その中で最後の一個である「鍵」を自分が手に入れられるように、計算をしましょう。
相手の手札（バッグなどの入れ物）は全て公開情報です。明かされた情報と、そこから少しだけ絡んでくる運。そして先を読む頭脳で戦うシンプルな「足し算」ゲームです。

219426.name: Labyrinth: Magic of the Ancients
219426.description:
This expansion adds spells to base game. All heros can use eight spells after they get enough Power points from special tile of labyrinth.

For ages people believed that the Magic of the Ancients had left with Them.
The most powerful spells were thought to be forgotten forever…
Things turned out differently, though. The remains of this unthinkable power are still here.
And they still fill the Labyrinth built so many centuries ago!
Heroes who shall discover magical springs and seize their power…
shall also gain dominance over time itself and learn to use it as no one has done before!
However, that’s not all! Thanks to the power lying dormant inside the Labyrinth
the Chosen shall be able to bring fallen heroes to a life of servitude.
There is also “Change of Destiny”, the most potent spell of all, waiting to be released.
It can ruin plans of many heroes fighting for immortality!

219427.name: Labyrinth: Scarabs
219427.description:
When magic items started to disappear from the Labyrinth
And the mages came to steal its ancient power…
The holy swarm struck for the first time.

The Scarabs of the Labyrinth have awoken to guard secrets of their home.
They are extremely small, deadly quick and dangerous beyond imagining…
They will take control over anyone who seeks power of the Labyrinth for himself!

”Heroes delving into the ruins of the ancient Labyrinth…
They were looking for the gift of immortality, with Crystals of Fate as keys to this most noble of gifts.
We do not know if they found this gift. What we know for sure is that they found the Golem - a strange construct build by an ancient race.
But it was not the only creature lurking in the depths of the Labyrinth. There were many more…”
Explorer of the Labyrinth from Tiphere’eth

How does it work?

Scarabs lie dormant in corridors hidden in frame pieces...
They come into life after players take three magic items from the game board.
Each player may spend 1 action to move a Scarab swarm.
When a Scarab encounters a character, this character must make a Scarab Check…
If the check is successful, the Scarab dies and is removed from the game for good.
If the check is failed, the Scarab transforms the character into a monster!
Fortunately, any transformed characters can try to return to their own form!

219428.name: Labyrinth: Undead Warriors
219428.description:
The Ancients who built the Labyrinth millennia ago
Used a race of Saurians, whom they created.

Strong, manlike lizards were their favorites.
They fascinated, amused and surprised the Ancients with their cleverness.

Saurians worshipped the Ancients as their gods,
While the Ancients had devised grand plans for their children.
They did what they could to develop and educate them…
But they failed.

Despite their cunning, Saurians remained savage.
They kept fighting unending bloody wars,
Wars of domination among themselves.
When Saurians were close to extinction, the Ancients chose to keep in the memory of time
A recollection, however fleeting, about their children. Nothing else could be done for them.

From that moment, Saurians have been kept alive by the Power of the Ancients.
They guard their magic buildings and majestic portals.
They do what they have always done best - fight any enemies
Who wish to wrest long-buried, holy secrets from the depths of time.

What can you expect from this expansion?

Efficient hunters prowling the Labyrinth with inhuman speed!
Predatory warriors that aid each other and poison their game!
The Ancients’ Chosen able to come back to life from the underworld!
Cunning lizardmen who steal keys and magic items!
Monsters immune to the Golem, traps, magic of the Ancients and events!
IMPORTANT: Any player may move Saurians once per turn by spending 1 action!

219429.name: Monster Rejects: Battle Pack
219429.description: Expansion pack for Monster Rejects. Add more strategy and fun by giving your monsters weapons, curses, potions and more. 50 Cards to accompany Monster Rejects.

219430.name: Math Fluxx
219430.description: Math Fluxx is all about the numbers. Players use positive integers (whole numbers) in their quest to achieve a very mathematical goal — but it's not just putting 4 and 2 together to achieve the 42 goal (for example) as Math Fluxx also features the Plan B Meta Rule. Plan B puts special victory rules into play which give you a second way to win and require even more arithmetical acumen (e.g., "Plus Victory" lets you win if your keepers add up to the current goal). With Math Fluxx, the fun is exponential!

219433.name: Schaper's Cat and Mouse Game
219433.description:
Theme: For the tricky little mouse to get into any one of his three cheese holes without being caught by the fast sly cat
Game Play: Mouse is moved by using magnetic "mouse" wand underneath the game board. Cat is moved by using magnetic "cat" wand across the top of the game board. Start the cat on one of the starting circles, the mouse is placed in the other starting circle. The game starts when the mouse player says "go". Cat scores when he catches (touches) the mouse anywhere on the board. Mouse scores when he eludes the cat and enters any one of the three cheese holes. As mouse and cat score, they advance one square on the scoring board. After each time the cat or mouse score the players switch, mouse becomes cat, cat becomes mouse. First to score 6 times and land on the house on scoring board wins.

219434.name: The Puzzle Place Game
219434.description:
Theme: Be the player to put the final piece of the puzzle together.
Game Play: Pick a puzzle friend and place it on the gear space with the same color as your friend. Spin the spinner and move your friend to the color the spinner lands on. If you land on a space with a puzzle piece place the puzzle piece in the puzzle tray.
Game ends: When the final puzzle piece is placed in the puzzle tray.

219435.name: Bushido: Suchiro
219435.description:
Description from the publisher:

Suchiro, is the embodiment of determination and persistence. With a goal or objective in his mind nothing can stop this quiet and thoughtful monk from reaching it. In battle he fights resolutely, anchoring the forces of the Temple and proving to be an unbreakable bastion for the defenders of Jwar. Many strive to understand the riddles of the Kami of Chikyu’s Rock but this monk of the Temple of Ro-Kan has and in doing so brought the teaching to bear on those that would seek to upset the balance. Suchiro’s wrath may not be quick but like the mountains and earth it is inevitable.

219436.name: Bushido: Sojobo
219436.description:
Description from the publisher:

The martial skills of the Tengu are legendary across the Golden Empire. Although few in number these avian Yokai long lives give them ample time to gain mastery of not only the martial but also to learn the secrets of the kami who call the mountains their home. Hidden away in their mountain top cities and guarded by the devoted hill tribes few have ever seen these mysterious warriors. What has brought Sojobo down from the mountains and to the aid of the Tengus' old allies the Temple is not known. Sojobo’s skills in combat are equalled by very few. Now he has spread his great wings and left his mountain home the spirits and prospects of the people of the Rokan can only be lifted as a result.

219437.name: Ritual
219437.description:
Description from the publisher:

Ritual is a strategic tile-laying game of magical dominance for two to five players. In Ritual you take on the role of a powerful wizard joining with other wizards to perform an intricate ritual of magic. Being a wizard, you must take this opportunity to prove once and for all that YOU are the best wizard by having the most influence over the ritual at its completion.

At its heart Ritual is about three things: tiles, runes and influence. Being a tile-laying game, Ritual’s core mechanic revolves around drawing hexagonal tiles one at a time from a common pool known as the ley line and placing them onto the scroll that serves as the board.

Each tile has three parts know as rune pieces. Throughout the game players try to match up identical rune pieces in groups of three known as runes. Runes players create can be activated to cause powerful effects capable of reshaping the board, but such power comes at a cost: influence. Each player gets a set of colored cubes known as influence cubes. These cubes are not only used to activate runes, but also to determine where you can play on the scroll and to tally your final score. Clever use of tiles, runes and influence is essential to winning a game of Ritual.

Ritual’s simple gameplay, deep strategy and beautiful presentation make it a fun game for beginners and experienced board-gamers alike.

219438.name: Bushido: Tsutsumi
219438.description: This venerable monk is a seasoned defender of the Temple. Though his sight left him at a young age his senses and awareness of his surrounding remain sharp as a fox. Like most monks of his age there is little left in this world that can cause fear in this wandering warrior of the Temple. In battle Tsutsumi carries with him the ancient Guqin, carved from an ancient wood and passed down from monk to monk since the first rays of sunlight rose over the mountains of Ro-Kan. When his lithe fingers strum its strings as he has done for many decades, using the sweet sound and combining it with his deep voice to create powerful prayers, Shomyos. He uses these to inspire his allies, or suppress and distract his enemies. Tsutsumi can also use the Guqin to channel a powerful wave of sound, knocking hapless enemies to the ground.

219439.name: Bushido: Hisao
219439.description:
Description from the publisher:

For centuries the Temple and the people of the Ro-Kan have lived in symbiotic harmony and for centuries the secrets of the Kami and the mountain have passed between these two allies. Misao, like all village elders has for decades made the decisions for his village and acted as apothecary using the secrets passed down from elder to elder. When his special mix of herbs, found on the mountain, are burned in his censers it clears those of aliments, clears the mind or soul. The peasants in his village follow his every word without question and although physically weak his strength lies in the wise words he draws upon to inspire those around him to great feats of combat prowess in the defence of their lands and peers.

219440.name: Bushido: Seiji
219440.description:
Description from the publisher:

Like all monks of the Temple of Ro-Kan, Seiji is following a path and element that he was always destined to. Still in the early years of his training this calm and relaxed monk is already showing signs that he will become a great defender of the Jwar Isles, and an asset in the struggle against the chaos. It is told that Seiji sat under the Grand Father tree for a full cycle in meditation, quietly becoming as one with the forest around him and in a deep communion with the sacred Kami. The secrets he learned now enable Seiji to seek out the help of the natural world around him, it comes to his and the Temple’s aid. Enemies find themselves rooted to the spot, held firm as they are bound and restrained by the very ground itself. Along with this ability Seiji has also achieved a higher level of understanding and attunement with his own body, enabling him to focus his energies and recover from even the most severe of wounds at an astounding rate.

219441.name: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York – "Talking" Electronic Game
219441.description:
Theme: Harry and Marv chase Kevin, with actual situations from the movie.
Game Play: As Harry and Marv get closer, Kevin taunts them by saying 3 different phrases. Draw a card and move characters according to the color spaces and traps on the card. If the burglars catch Kevin they win the round.

219442.name: The Galdr: A D&D Viking Rune Mage
219442.description:
From the Publisher:

Crouched low, eyes flaring, the man begins drawing strange shapes in the air, and fiery runic effigies appear, floating. The man rears back, and screams a single word in a forgotten language. A blast emits from the rune, and after the dust settles, the Galdr is the only one left standing.

Leaving the house of a beloved sister, the Galdr carves a rune on her door. That night, when raiders from the North come to her house to pillage, they are met with howling ethereal wolves, who fiercely protect the dwelling.

A man throws an axe at a vicious draugr, the axe flies true, tumbling and as it does so, the runes etched into it flare up, and emit a blue burst of light, eviscerating the other nearby draugr.

Whether carving runes in mid air to cast spells, or imbuing items and object with great power, the Galdr is the embodiment of the raw power of runic magic. They heed what the runes tell them, and many are powerful seers, though all of them have devastating abilities that can change the course of a battle in an instant. Galdr are often great entertainers, and their stories are legendary, should you be lucky enough to meet one.

219443.name: Tales & Legends
219443.description:
From the Publisher:

Tales & Legends—The Adventure Game is a minimalistic fantasy roleplaying game in a condensed format. The rules are very simple and only requires two six-sided dice, pencils and character sheets or ordinary paper to play the game. Despite it’s condensed format, this book contains all the rules necessary to play, and there’s even a bestiary with more than 80 monsters to challenge the players.

219444.description:
The Necroboomicon Expansion Pack for Two Rooms and a Boom comes in a foil pack with characters designed as "Hard Mode". Designed with a H.P. Lovecraft Cthulhu theme, players wrestle with fear and suspicion.

Necroboomicon was designed to enhance the experience of Two Rooms and a Boom for smaller groups. Color sharing is now permitted in groups with fewer than eleven players!
219444.name: Two Rooms and a Boom: Necroboomicon Expansion Pack

219445.name: Ciphoid 9
219445.description:
From the back of the box:

Ciphoid 9 has been designed to exploit the graphic capabilities of the Commodore 64 to the full. All scenes are in hi-resolution multi-colour graphics and particular attention has been paid to perspective and visual effects to make ciphoid 9 the most realistic 3-dimensional space game yet.
You will see the hi-res screens scrolling to show different sectors of the lunar base. The alien fighters execute complicated flight paths as they try to evade your phaser bolts. You will see the ships phasers and nuclear shells get larger, as they hurtle towards you, just as they would in real life.

From the instructions:

The year is 2045 and earth radar stations have detected numerous fleets of alien ships, bound for earth.
The ships have refused to identify themselves and have destroyed a cargo vessel en route to Uranus. Their intentions are presumed hostile.
One last defensive position stands between the aliens and Earth. This base is situated on the moon, just to the south of the Sea of Tranquility.
The lunar base is under partial computer control but the actual task of destroying the alien ships is your responsibility.

User Summary

In Ciphoid 9, you play the role of a gunner in a phaser turret on the moon, tasked with shooting down alien ships.

The computer controls the facing of the turret and the player controls the cross-hairs of the guns. 10 shots can be fired in rapid succession, before the guns overheat. At this point only single shots can be fired until they cool down.

Occasionally motherships appear which require 10 direct hits on their central section. Destroying these recharges your shields.

219450.name: Encounters in the Deep
219450.description:
Publisher's blurb:

These encounters were written to bring elements of different genres into your game. They were written with the idea that the party would be traveling in a huge subterranean cave structure like the Underdark, but they may of course be re-purposed however is most useful or fun to you! In that case, simply ignore all the parts where they talk about your party going through a large system of caves, and replace those with sections about the lush jungle, frozen north, or giant toilet (or whatever) that your party happens to currently be in. Many of the ideas in these encounters are inspired by or in homage to some of my favorite horror, science fiction, and manga, because they were fun ideas to me. My hope is that they add a bit of that flair without overpowering everything else in the adventure.

219453.name: It's Not Your Turn!
219453.description:
A fast paced card game where players try to score the least points at the end of the game. The game ends once a player is down to two cards. Points are the number of cards in each player's hand plus 'It's Not Your Turn' cards.
Players take turns either playing the correct card from their hand (if they have it) face-up, playing a card face-down in an attempt to either bluff or reverse-bluff, or being honest about not having the right card and taking a 'It's Not Your Turn' card. Players can even use a house rule where they can try to steal another player's turn(s) by playing certain number cards at the right moment.
The game has a lighthearted spoof theme of the stereotypical gamer elitist as shown on the different suit cards and on the game box.

219454.name: Fosc Anansi: Shadow of the Spider Goddess
219454.description:
From the Back Cover

Silent crawlers with a venomous bite. Web spinners, creating sticky, beautiful homes that double as deadly traps. Nature's most artistic killers.

What fools would grow these tiny killing machines into the size of ponies or even larger?

Gnomes! Opportunistic dark gnomes, looking for profit, who stumbled upon an inter-dimensional substance - experimental, yet undoubtedly powerful.

Then something came creeping down the strand that connected the spiders to the inter-dimensional world, a shadow -- the Shadow of the Spider Goddess!

219455.name: The Dungeon Mapping Booklet
219455.description:
Publisher's Blurb

This Dungeon Mapping Booklet can be used with any RPG (Role Play Game) System. The 40+ pages that follow are designed to be removed and used as 11" x 17" maps. Just open to the center of the book, loosen the staples and remove as many pages as you need, one at a time. You ca n also keep the book fully intact and used each 8.5" x 11" page as you wish.

Virtually endless possibilities... Document your adventuring parties, create a personal log, dream and envision future castles and keeps, or design a fantastic underground labyrinth.

219456.name: The Bridges We Burn
219456.description:
The Ninth World is full of wonders and dangers. Just how far will your heroes go to explore them all? How many traps will they disarm, how many ancient tombs unearth? And while doing so, will they ever stop and think about the consequences of their actions? How many bridges will they burn to get treasures, knowledge and glory?

This campaign consists of 5 linked scenarios that can be also played separately. They are designed for Tier 3 characters and offer a variety of challenges: a grand ball and mingling with nobles, investigation, exploration of a strange fortress and finally – battling a powerful monster and its minions to save a city.

The campaign provides 25-30 hours of play, but can be easily expanded and built upon for even more fun! It takes place in the city of Uxphon, which featured in "The Devil's Spine," and serves as an excellent follow-up set of new adventures. But fret not, knowledge of "The Spine" is not required!

Includes never-before seen art to inspire your imagination. And yeah - it is gorgeous.

This is an adventure module for Game Masters and requires the Numenera Corebook from Monte Cook Games.

This is PDF-only publication and comes with two files, optimized for your tablet or screen.
[source: Publisher Blurb]

219457.description: The Marines have arrived! The USMC Command Squad is charged with leading the Marine Forces in combat. Like its Ranger counterpart, it brings a whole lot of new options for your army. It changes drastically how you can control your troops, making sure you'll get the best of every unit!
219457.name: Dust Tactics: USMC Command Squad – "Mustangs"

219458.description: Combat engineers and pioneers always have the most dangerous post in an army: always on the first line at the front. Clearing a path through minefields and barbed wire for the rest of the army to advance is no small feat, and these guys need every advantage they can get. In the most dangerous terrain, the USMC calls on the Heavy Engineers. With their Ground Assault Power Armour they carry weapons no ordinary man could.
219458.name: Dust Tactics: USMC Heavy Engineer Squad – "Steel Marines"

219459.description: The United States Marine Corps (USMC) has arrived! The Allies are in North Africa and the Middle East for good, and no-one is going to kick these Marines out! The fiercest fighting force on the planet is not easily scared or defeated, there's not much these guys haven't seen already in this war. The USMC uses dedicated canine squads for reconnaissance missions, but these dogs don't back out of a fight if need be! The squad is presented here in Babylon camouflage pattern, as used in the Middle-East circa 1947.
219459.name: Dust Tactics: USMC War Dogs Recon Squad

219460.name: 1K ZX Chess
219460.description:
1K ZX Chess is a 1982 chess-playing computer program (while missing three rules) for the unexpanded Sinclair ZX81.

Description
1K ZX Chess uses only 672 bytes of RAM but implements most chess rules (castling, promotion, and en passant capture are missing), and a computer opponent. It was the smallest implementation of chess on any computer until its record was broken in January 2015 by the smallest completely new PC compatible BootChess, although apparently artificial intelligence is lesser than the original.

Developer David Horne discussed 1K ZX Chess and published the full source code in a series of articles in Your Computer in 1982 and 1983.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1K_ZX_Chess 1K ZX Chess]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

219461.name: ZX Chess I
219461.description:
User Summary
Chess game for the early Sinclair platforms. Requiring 16k RAM expansion to play.

219462.name: ZX Chess II
219462.description:
User Summary
An enhanced version of {videogame=219461], only released for ZX81. Apart from the features from the previous game, the improved version had faster move calculating, mentoring (ask the ZX for a suggestive move), and ability to set diffiuculty.

This done by not requiring more than the 16K of RAM expansion needed for the old version as well.

219463.name: Chess (BBC Micro / Electron)
219463.description:
User Summary
A chess game for the BBC Micro and Electron computers by Acorn. The game was made by Acorn's own software house.

The game features an AI Only match where you can watch the computer play against it self, a Player vs Computer, or a Player vs Player setting. Both black and white can be chosen against the computer, which also have 10 different levels (0 = easiest / 9 = hardest)

219464.name: 3D Monster Maze
219464.description:
3D Monster Maze is a computer game developed from an idea by J.K.Greye and programmed by Malcolm Evans in 1981 for the Sinclair ZX81 platform with the 16 KB memory expansion. The game was initially released by J. K. Greye Software in early 1982 and re-released later the same year by Evans' own startup, New Generation Software. Rendered using low-resolution character block "graphics", it was one of the first 3D games for a home computer, and the first game incorporating typical elements of the genre that would later be termed survival horror.

3D Monster Maze puts the player in a maze with one exit and a hostile monster, the Tyrannosaurus rex. There, the player must traverse the maze, from the first-person perspective, and escape through the exit without being eaten.

J.K.Greye Software went on to become a very successful games company publishing 6 Games Tapes for the Sinclair ZX81 - 2 in 3D - 3D Monster Maze & 3D Defender, both designed by J.K.Greye and programmed by Malcolm Evans.

New Generation Software went on to become a well-known software firm with the Sinclair platform and continued to pioneer the 3D gaming technology for ZX81 and the later model Sinclair ZX Spectrum. The press immediately gave the game a title of a "firm favourite" of the ZX81 users. Decades later, it became popular with the retrogaming community, inspiring remakes and fuelling ZX81 emulation projects.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/3D_Monster_Maze 3D Monster Maze]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

219466.name: Planeta Zwierząt
219466.description:
On Planeta Zwierząt ('Animal Planet') you will encounter various species of animals. Try to determine their characteristics and guess on which continent they live. But you have to avoid the hunter. And better not call the wolf out of the woods.

The aim of the players is the assignment of animal cards to the appropriate continents and prioritize them according to the values of their characteristics. The game allows you to explore the characteristics and habitat of 110 species of animals.

219467.name: Black Crystal
219467.description:
From back of the ZX Spectrum game box
The ultimate role-playing adventure for the SPECTRUM/ZX81. You can become a warrior, elf or wizard on a quest to find and use the rings of creation: to destroy the Black Crystal and defeat the Lords of Chaos. Held within six programs lies a land of fabulous treasures and mythical monsters. Journey through the land of Beroth, explore the castle of shadows, decend into the Shaggoths laur, search for diamonds in the sea of sand but beware of sand sharks! Congront the fire demon in his temple, battle against the Lords of Chaos and win your way to the Black Crystal.
By splitting Black Crystal into six programs we can provide more variety and detail than any other adcnture for the Sinclair computers.
Real time monster battles. Superb graphics. Save game feature.

PROGRAM PROFILE
Black Crystal is an original Carnell Siftware adventure in the 'Third Continent' series. It was devised and written by Roy Carnell and Stuart A. Galloway for the Sinclair range of computers.
Both Mr. Carnell and Mr. Galloway come from a strong film background, having worked in feature optical special effects for many years. This give them a good visual sense and an awareness of the importance of continuity and plot.

---

219468.name: Volcanic Dungeon
219468.description:
Volcanic Dungeon is a role-playing video game designed by Roy Carnell and Stuart A. Galloway and released by Carnell Software for the ZX Spectrum, Dragon 32/64 and ZX81 computers in 1983. It is a sequel to 1982's Black Crystal and was itself followed by The Wrath of Magra in 1984. The BASIC source code listing of the game is available online.

Plot
A war between the forces of good and evil has been won by the light, and the dark goddess Lamhar and the Snow Queen were both defeated. But the witch Magra has managed to escape with some of her army into the titular volcanic dungeon, taking with her a captive elfin princess named Edora. The task of a hero known as the Knight of Star Jewel is to hunt down and kill Magra, and to rescue Edora from her glass coffin.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volcanic_Dungeon Volcanic Dungeon]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

219469.name: The Wrath of Magra
219469.description:
The Wrath of Magra is a role-playing video game published by Carnell Software and Mastertronic for the ZX Spectrum in 1985. It is a sequel to 1982's Black Crystal and 1983's Volcanic Dungeon, and was released for then record high price tag.

Plot
In Volcanic Dungeon, the Knight of Star Jewel rescued the kidnapped Princess Edora and killed her evil captor Magra, the most powerful sorceress in the world. However, Magra has been restored back to life by her followers and wants revenge upon the man who defeated her. She cursed Edora and so the knight needs to once again save the princess. He needs to reach Magra's the castle in the Black Mountains and find a way to destroy the witch forever.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wrath_of_Magra The Wrath of Magra]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

219470.name: Elementals
219470.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the next installment of Monster Mash. Here you will find new creatures and/or new takes on old creatures for your Fantasy Hero Campaign.

This installment will cover four new types of Elementals that have been seen in the realm of late. Ice, Light, Lightning and Shadow Elementals.

Elementals are powerful, fear little and will be a test for even the most experienced adventure. These for Elementals were originally presented in the Elemental Grimoire.

219471.name: TITechCorp Equipment Flyer #4
219471.description:
From publisher blurb:

TITechCorp Flyer #4 – Manta Ray Underwater Armor

Are you tired of your agents having inferior weapons?

Tired of your lackeys falling like flies to the superheroes of the world?

Tired of those dim witted Until agents having better equipment than your agents?

Then you have come to the right place here at TITechCorp we are dedicated to creating the best weapons, armor and other equipment money can buy.

So stop by today and pick up the latest blaster or force belt and get a jump on those pesky do-gooders.

And remember your satisfaction is guaranteed or we won’t see you again.

Small list of equipment to add to your Champions campaign includes Hero Designer files.

219472.name: Bloodragers of Porphyra
219472.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blood Calls to Blood… and those who oppose shall pay the price of Rage!

Raised in the military tradition of berserk warfare, born with a legacy of sorcerous bloodline powers and abilities, the bloodrager wreaks devastation on the battlefield with his innate magic, sorcerous spells, and diabolical abilities. All the aspects of the Patchwork Planet of Porphyra manifest themselves in the myriad bloodrager bloodlines and archetypes, and are now made known in Nathan Reinecke’s Bloodragers of Porphyra, new from Purple Duck Games! This class-book explores the hybrid class with 6 amazing archetypes like the rampaging feral bloodrager, and his opposites, the ritualistic student of fury and the placid zen rager. Also within are 6 new, subtly mundane bloodlines like Guardian, Heroic and Plagued; wildblood mutations to swirl the chaos include the eerie Eldritch, restorative Phoenix and unpredictable Wild Magic mutated wildblood bloodrager bloodlines. The bloodrager class is boosted in this fine product with the inclusion of new feats (including the new Blood feat-type!) magic weapons, armor qualities, wondrous items and 5 new spells usable by bloodragers and their sorcerous cousins.

219473.name: The Illuminati Treasure (Fate)
219473.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Christmas party interrupted by a car crash. The driver, shot and dying, begs you to get his journal to safety. A journal with research leading to the lost treasure of the Illuminati. The race is on between Nazis and mobsters, the Freemasons, and the characters to find the treasure before the others do!

Set in 1937, The Illuminati Treasure is a fast-paced pulp adventure using the Fate role playing system. This adventure scenario includes four pre-generated characters so players can jump right in.

219474.name: The Illuminati Treasure (Ubiquity)
219474.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Christmas party interrupted by a car crash. The driver, shot and dying, begs you to get his journal to safety. A journal with research leading to the lost treasure of the Illuminati. The race is on between Nazis and mobsters, the Freemasons, and the characters to find the treasure before the others do!

Set in 1937, The Illuminati Treasure is a fast-paced pulp adventure using the Ubiquity role playing system that powers Hollow Earth Expedition. This adventure scenario includes four pre-generated characters so players can jump right in.

219475.description:
In AXIO, players take turns adding tiles to a shared playing area. Each time you play a tile — with tiles bearing one or two colored symbols — you score points for symbols of the same type that are in rows extending from the recently-placed tile. Tiles can be placed on other tiles in some situations.

When the game ends, players check the scores for each of their symbols, and their final score is equal to the lowest value among them. Whichever player has the highest low score wins!
219475.name: AXIO
boardgamepodcastepisode: 27. Devon Dice Podcast: The Balancing Act: Assassins, Beasts, Children, Designers
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 037 – Top 10 Publishers

219476.name: Brass Empire: Kickstarter Promo Expansion
219476.description:
Brass Empire: Kickstarter Promo Expansion contains 21 Promo Cards from the original Brass Empire Kickstarter. The set expands every corporation's identity with powerful corporate ID cards, a gadget, a new faction reserve card and a unique mining platform for all 5 factions (20 cards). It also includes a Single Player Boss Card: The Pirates of the People which is a unique solitaire variant and challenge for the game.

This item was originally only offered to Kickstarter backers and people ordering directly from the publisher.

219477.name: NeuroSpasta (5E)
219477.description:
From publisher blurb:

The city of Archon.

The most cosmopolitan, technologically advanced metropolis the world has ever seen, where the nations of the world have at last come together to lay aside their differences.

Will it be our last hope for a peaceful future or the chilling harbinger of a totalitarian dystopia?

It falls to the members of the Division of Public Safety to protect Archon and its inhabitants from threats from both without and within.

But which is the greater threat?

In a future of ambiguous ethnicity and rampant cyberization, what use is there for obsolete national borders and political beliefs?

The boundaries separating man and machine are not only blurred, but utterly erased.

The conflict in this new-fledged world is not between nations or between law and order but between millennia-old traditions and an inevitable shift in consciousness, with the very meaning of 'humanity' and even 'identity' placed in the crosshairs.

Will Archon be the beacon of a shining future, or will its enemies bring it crashing to the ground.

219478.name: Ballistic Protection
219478.description:
User Summary

Following a single road, you set up defence towers to kill waves of zombie-like attackers. There are 10 levels.

219479.name: Flora
219479.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Campaign Chunk is an item, place or something else that can fit into any campaign or story with little or no modification although some will be more suited to certain genres than others. They have few stats (if any) and help provide starting grounds for adventures or help fill in the gaps when your players go off exploring and you need something for them to do. Each has several hooks or rumour that can be used. Which of these are true and which are false?

Originally first published on the blog/website of Ennead Games, these Chunks have been compiled into a handy volume. Their details may have been cleaned up and more hooks or rumours added to them, but they basically the same.

This volume covers flora, or plants, with fungi or two thrown in for good measure.

Inside you'll find chunks for...

Apples/Apple Tree
Baobab tree
Giant Redwood
Peanuts
Puffball Mushroom
Rafflesia
Red Tide
Sunflower
Venus Flytrap
Wang Peony

219480.description: The Marines love lightning speed attacks and outflank maneuvers. And heavy firepower as well... There aren't many vehicles on the planet that match these three elements as well as the Bushmaster. Based on the already famous Light Assault Walker chassis, this new machine is widely used by the Corps, and soon by the grand Allied Army.
219480.name: Dust Tactics: M1D Light Assault Walker Anti-tank – "Bushmaster"

219481.description: This variant of the original Mickey, dubbed the ‘Light Mickey’ by the Marines, was created specifically for the United States Marine Corps. Its open-topped turret makes it much more comfortable to operate in some of the environments that these guys fight in. As with Allied troops across the planet, the Marines love this machine. It’s resilient, easy to operate, and packs a lot of punch. Since its entry into service with the USMC, the Light Mickey has been adopted by other branches of the Allied armies fighting in hot climates.
219481.name: Dust Tactics: M3A2 Medium Combat Walker "Mickey (Light)"

219482.name: Secondary Archetypes Vol I - Variant Multiclassing Archetypes
219482.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #105 present 13 new variant multiclassing options as first presented in Paizo's Pathfinder Unchained. Each of these presents a different fighter archetype presented in the form of secondary class abilities replacing feats gained at 3rd level and every 4 levels thereafter. From the Archer to the Weapon Master, this supplement grants you a bit more martial mastery to a character that may sacrifice battlefield finesse for other skills and features.

219483.description: Maybe the most recognizable walker on the planet today, the Mickey chassis has given birth to a huge range of machines build on its rugged chassis. In the Pacific or the Middle-East, the Allies use a tropical version of the same chassis, whose main feature is an open top turret. The deadliest arsenal of the Mickey family stays the same. The Steel Rain mounts an impressive gun, capable of blowing any ground target on the planet to pieces.
219483.name: Dust Tactics: M3F2 Medium Combat Walker Assault Engineer "Steel Rain (Light)"

219484.name: With Malice Aforethought
219484.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trouble with an assassin and the gang that’s trying to kill him begins with the discovery of a dead body in a secluded cabin.

With Malice Aforethought is a one-page, system-agnostic adventure designed for a group of noir characters. Set in 1948, the adventure can be used with other settings and genres with a little work.

219485.description: The new Pounder in “light” open top version is commonly used by the USMC wherever the Corps fight. It is presented here in the Babylon camo pattern as used around Mesopotamia in early 1947, with Marines Corps specific markings.
219485.name: Dust Tactics: M3C2 Medium Combat Walker Anti-Tank – "Pounder (Light)"

219486.name: Last One Standing
219486.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Godless adventure for Novice Characters!

Last One Standing is an adventure for novice characters in which they must navigate the perils posed by three violent, bloodthirsty gangs. There are likely many ways for the group to complete the adventure: perhaps by choosing one gang to support against the other two, or by finding some creative way to prevent the impending fight from impacting Isolon’s innocents. In the end, the settlement’s future rests in the characters’ hands. Do they have what it takes to save the townspeople from terrible violence and bloodshed?

219487.description:
Filling a gap in the Allied armoured arsenal between the M3A2 Mickey (Light) and the M3C Pounder, the M3G2 Barking Dog (Light) is an excellent anti-tank walker and can serve as a close support vehicle. Its six M40 recoilless guns fire in sequence, aimed at the same point thanks to a very advanced targeting system.

The sound of the guns firing a couple of seconds apart resembles a loud dog barking, hence the nickname of ‘Barking Dog’. This dog’s bite is far worse than its bark! Its 106mm rounds will easily destroy enemy fortified positions or blast tanks into smouldering heaps of metal.

The downside is the reload time needed to make this magic happen. All six guns need to be loaded from the outside of the vehicle, one at a time. That’s why you’ll rarely see a Barking Dog alone on the battlefield. It behaves more like a wolf than a dog, either traveling in pack of its own, or with other walkers that complement its role.

The Marines’ Light Barking Dog is similar to the prototype tested by the Army, but has an open-topped turret for better vision and cross-country performance. It is probably the most popular walker in the Marine Corps’ arsenal.
219487.name: Dust Tactics: M3G2 Medium Combat Walker Anti-Tank – "Barking Dog (Light)"

219488.description:
Phaser technology was created by the Allies in response to the lasers developed by the Axis. Powerful VK generators concentrate heat waves into small tungsten cylinders around the actual barrel and then release them, projecting a phased discharge of raw energy. How Allied scientists managed to develop such a complex weapon in such a short amount of time is still puzzling for spy agencies around the world - almost as puzzling as how it actually works. The whole project is still shrouded in mystery.

When the scientists combined several phaser systems into one massive phaser gun with a nominal initiator power of 480 Watts (twice as powerful as any previous system) they needed a huge vehicle to carry it. The resulting M7D Devastator is built around the largest phaser energy generator ever built. Unfortunately, this VK generator occupies the space originally used as a passenger compartment, so it is impossible to transport any troops inside.

There is nothing on the planet that can survive a direct hit from a Devastator. The temperature at the core of the blast is believed to be as hot as the Sun, but since there are no practical ways to measure the heat effectively, no one can be sure. So far no known material has been able to survive a hit from this formidable weapon.
219488.name: Dust Tactics: M7D Heavy Assault Walker – "Devastator"

219489.name: Piñata Loca
219489.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Piñata Loca' we are filling up Piñatas with tasty candies and toys. But sometimes we secretly put useless objects inside the Piñata too. Hit the right Piñata and collect as many tasty candies and toys as possible.
 
Players try to collect sweets and toys (positive points) and give useless objects (negative points) to their opponents, by wisely playing their cards, on columns that represent Piñatas. When a player places the 7th card, then that Piñata and he collects all of its cards.
 
Your intuition, observation, strategy and logic skills will guide you to the most...
“PIÑATA LOCA”!

219490.name: Galaxy Incorporated
219490.description:
Author's blurb:

Build a Ship, Explore the Galaxy, And Make Profit.

Galaxy Incorporated is an epic corporate space fantasy roleplaying game.

Publisher's blurb:

Galaxy Incorporated is an epic space fantasy roleplaying game set in a far-future utopia, and the human race has expanded throughout the galaxy. Mega-Corporations run the galaxy with the help of worldwide Artificial Intelligence systems. These AI systems oversee the needs for every corporate citizen. Local AI systems carefully monitor corporate citizens and link to a world AI to help the bureaucrats balance all resources for everyone. Famine and disease are things of the past. Everything a citizen could ever need or want is provided for.

Player characters are part of a spaceship crew looking for a way to survive in a galaxy run by these interplanetary Mega-Corporations.

219493.name: Pinball Wizard V2.0
219493.description:
User Summary
An enhanced version of Pinball Wizard (1987) by Hans Georg Berg

219495.name: The Watchtower in the Wood
219495.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The Watchtower in the Wood is an introductory adventure for characters of 1st - 3rd level, designed for use with the Choe Pho: A New World of Fantasy Role-Playing Game

In this adventure, the characters venture forth from the safety of the Isle of Hope, seeking to bring order to the Plains of Marrow. The adventure offers options for the characters to begin in various areas on the Isle of Hope, but regardless of the path taken, the party eventually makes their way to the haunted lands of the Plains of Marrow. After crossing the harrowing and chaotic lands (and fighting off some of the dark denizens) of the Plains of Marrow, the characters come across a small wooded area. A small stone fort with a lone watchtower stands in a clearing among the trees. Within this camp, the characters will find adventure, drama, and their first dharmachackra!

The Watchtower in the Wood utilizes the 5e OGL.

219496.name: Fane of the Undying Sleeper (Collector's Edition)
219496.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Compatible Adventure for 3rd-level Characters by Creighton Broadhurst

Widely thought of as a haven for smugglers and other miscreants, rumours swirl as thickly about Coldwater as the persistent sea fogs that sometimes blanket the place for days at a time. Set at the head of a muddy cliff top path, Coldwater is an isolated, dismal place. Its folk are sullen, ugly people and even the village’s ruler hates the place. For all that, Coldwater can be a place of opportunity and adventure.

Protected by the roiling waters of the ocean, the Fane of the Undying Sleeper lies at the top of a set of stone steps only exposed at the lowest ebb of the lowest spring tides. Protected by impregnable stone doors, the fane has lain undisturbed for centuries. Once the lair of a heretical and degenerate demon-worshipping cult the benighted, profane place has never known the tread of human feet. None have yet penetrated the fane, but nevertheless wild and outlandish rumours speak of terrible dangers and glittering treasures to be found beyond the unopenable doors.

With a tide low enough to reveal the fane’s entrance fast approaching, are the PCs brave enough to dare the terrors of the Fane of the Undying Sleeper?

219497.name: Martial Achetypes: A Folio of Options for Fighters
219497.description:
From publisher blurb:

Introducing eight new martial archetype options for your 5th edition fighter:

The noble Cavalier
The redoubtable Defender
The canny Duelist
The bold Gladiator
The powerful Planar Legionary
The courageous Templar
The ruthless Thug
The rough and ready Tracker Scout




Each path offers new features and options for your fighter. While the Champion is a fun and flexible archetype, these archetypes offer distinctive choices to set your character apart. Martial Archetypes double specializes in awesome.

219498.name: The Legend of Old Crank
219498.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Legend Rises

When a pair of merchant vessels go missing, the party is called to ensure the owners cannot collect on their insurance. Will they pull off the job without attracting unexpected attention?

The Legend of Old Crank is a 5th Edition adventure intended for characters of 7th level. They’ll deal with insurance fraud, sunken ships, and forgotten islands. And if that isn’t enough, they may attract the attention of a creature out of myth and legend...

219499.name: Fear's Sharp Little Needles
219499.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Fear's Sharp Little Needles is a grand collection of Call of Cthulhu 7th edition scenarios in a modern setting (easily convertible to 6th edition). They focus on the darker aspects of horror roleplaying and, as such, are recommended for a mature audience.

More inspired by True Detective and Hannibal than Pulp Horror, these adventures involved mythos corruption of the Human psyche and many feature direct contact with entities from outside space and time.

Ideally suited to one evening's play, they have been written with a compact adventure style and Keepers will need a minimum of preparation time before being able to run them. Each scenario will also have tags in the header image so they can make quick decisions on what to run and then deal with dinner, family, or relaxing before their players arrive.

219001.description: The Spetsnaz SSU special forces have infiltrated deep in Mesopotamia. The newly formed chaos of Operation Babylon will be a new hunting ground for these ruthless men... The Spetsnaz Command Squad is a special unit of field officers whose skills are invaluable. They are equipped with automatic rifles, a machine gun and a flamethrower, and their presence on the battlefield can change the entire course of battle, thanks to their invaluable skills. A wise general should take care to protect these experienced officers.
219001.name: Dust tactics: Spetsnaz Comman Squad – "Task Force Command"

219002.description: The Spetsnaz have arrived in the Middle-East! Deployed alongside any SSU force, the Spetsnaz Assault Squads provide intelligence and are able to communicate efficiently with fire support units should they encounter any threat. These are even sneakier and deadlier Spetsnaz than the rest!
219002.name: Dust Tactics: Spetsnaz Assault Squad – "Heavies"

219003.description:
Spetsnaz is an acronym of Spetsialnogo Naznacheniya, or ‘Special Purpose Force’. These are soldiers capable of accomplishing special missions that regular units cannot. The ‘Killers’, the Spetsnaz kill squads, are just that. These men can overcome any situation they are put in, no matter how dangerous or desperate.

When the Spetsnaz Kill Squad is called into action, it’s to make sure that there are no survivors left, no building still standing, and no enemy vehicle in one piece - and to leave no evidence of who did it. They are the most ruthless soldiers in the SSU, with the possible exception of the famed Steel Guards, many of whom are former members of a kill squad anyway.

The Killers use regular Sino-Soviet Union weapons and equipment, mixed with a few extras of their own, but it’s the way they use them that makes the difference. Their preferred weapon is the Avtomat Kalashnikova 45 (AK-45) assault rifle, the future weapon of all SSU infantry. The Killers back these up with Sulphur Jet flame-throwers, DPM machine-guns, and two RPG-1 anti-tank launchers. Every Killer is also armed with a standard-issue Spetsnaz machete, the signature weapon of these troops for close-in and personal killing.

The Spetsnaz Kill Squad primary’s objectives are eliminating enemy infantry and leaders, light and heavy vehicles. They excel at these jobs. As long as it involves spreading mayhem, you can count on these men!
219003.name: Dust Tactics: Spetsnaz Kill Squad – "Killers"

219004.description: The Spetsnaz have infiltrated the Middle-East! Unlike other Spetsnaz units, these men wear a light body armor, to give them a little more protection. They have to get quite close to their targets, usually tanks and walkers, to be in good range of their powerful weapons. They are presented here in their Babylon camo, as used by SSU forces in the Middle-East, circa 1947.
219004.name: Dust Tactics: Spetsnaz Anti-Tank Squad – "Specialists"

219005.description: Today the missions of the Spetsnaz Saboteur Squad have changed a bit, but the basics are the same: making big explosions that will cripple the enemy. Like other Spetsnaz forces, the Saboteurs use the AK-45 as their main weapon, though they don’t use it much - when they open fire it’s because they have been discovered, or it’s too late and they already have planted their charges.
219005.name: Dust Tactics: Spetsnaz Saboteur Squad – "Saboteur"

219006.description: The Spetsnaz have infiltrated the Middle-East! Nothing as efficient as a good artillery barrage to keep the enemy on its toes... Thanks to these observers, regimental and division artillery pieces can deliver the most powerful punch to crush the enemies of the SSU.
219006.name: Dust Tactics: Spetsnaz Observer Squad – "Observers"

219007.name: Football Billionaire
219007.description: A roll and move set collection game where players race to assemble a team of players (and a manager/coach). The game incorporates cards that can be collected and traded.

219008.name: Punch & Judy
219008.description:
From cassette inlay
Punch and Judy is based on the popular traditional seaside show in which you take the role of Mr. Punch. Your task involves constructing the show booth, finding the rest of the cast and finally taking part in the show itself. (A thrill a minute task).

Easy, eh? Not so because the eight parts needed to to build the the booths are scattered around the town and must be found and taken one by one to the beach. However certain pieces are too large to be carried through narrow doorways and the tide is slowly coming in. (Oh no; behind you! Behind you!)

Once the booth has been build, you must scour the town for the other cast members, hit them (that's the way to do it!) and lead them to the beach. Unfortunately Punch's progress may be hindered by the presence of a snap-happy crocodile or a patrolling policeman (ello, ello, ello) If you are bitten by the crocodile the tide will come in further. If you on the other hand are arrested, you will be taken to the police station and any object or person youu have with you will be taken elsewhere. There are ways to avoiding these hazards! Can you find them?

When the booth and cast are assembled at the beach, the show will commence... (That's the way to do it!)...

219009.name: 4 Most Cute
219009.description:
User Summary
Four games with a "cute" theme:
Star Paws
