Danger Mouse Double Trouble
Howard the Duck
Punch & Judy

219010.description:
Another tropical variation based upon the classic KV47 series, the L model, or Anatoly, mounts two very efficient Tesla guns, derived from the Red Lightning support weapon. The Anatoly’s capacitors allow it to fire both Tesla weapons in rapid succession, but this leaves it defenceless until the capacitors recharge. Being a Tesla weapon, it incapacitates its targets, even if it does not destroy them outright.

Using pack tactics, the KV-47L Anatoly can take on much larger walkers. Like its cousin the Aleksei, the Anatoly’s small size makes it perfect for special operations. It can easily be air-dropped, put on a landing craft, or travel through a dense jungle with equal facility.
219010.name: Dust Tactics: KV-47K (TSH) Light Tesla Walker – "Anatoly"

219011.description: Special men with special missions need special equipment. The KV-47K (TSH - Tropicheskiy Shagokhod or ‘Tropical Walker’), codenamed ‘Aleksei’ is the perfect example of this maxim, as it was developed specifically for Spetsnaz units. Thanks to the walker being open-topped, its pilot suffers much less from the heat and has a better view and understanding of his surroundings. It sure makes him more vulnerable, but at least he’s not completely cooked at the end of the day. It also makes the walker lighter, which greatly increases its capacity to be transported to remote places.
219011.name: Dust Tactics: KV-47K (TSH) Light Gatling Walker – "Aleksei"

219012.name: Rimrunner
219012.description:
From back of the box
Beyond the farthest reaches of the galaxy, only the RIMRUNNER can protect the Insectoid colonies from the wrath of the deadly Arachnoids...


From cassette inlay
On the very edge of known Space, far from the systems of Man, the Insectoid race trave lbetween the stars, colonising uninhabited and long dead planets, despite constant attack from the hostile Arachnoids.

To protect their colonies the Insectoids use force shields designed to repel any large metallic objects - such as Arachnoid stormtroopers.

To maintain these protective bubbles at full power the force shield generators use vast quantities of energy and need regular recharging.

To meet this need an elite group of Insectoid warriors was created. Using reptilian mounts, known as Runners, bred for speed and endurance, the warriors patrol the colony perimeter, recharging the generators and destroying any hostile lifeforms or Arachnoid probes that have penetrated the shield.

Thus was born the legend of the RIMRUNNER.

Gameplay
You must maintain the force shield generators for the alotted time period. You will then be reassigned to a new colony.
Each colony is equipped with four space Runners which will be sent out as they are needed.
Any generators that require recharging will flash red on the locater. You are not able to recharge a generator while riding, only while on foot.

219013.name: Foices & Feitiços
219013.description:
User summary:

Foices & Feitiços is a Brazilian fantasy RPG influenced by Epées et Sorcellerie and other OSR titles. After a successful crowdfunding campaign, the whole book is freely available.
Translated from the crowdfunding page: "This book includes simple rules, inspired by classic RPG, allowing an old school gaming experience. Its main sources of inspiration are Chainmail, classic D&D and the French retroclone Epées et Sorcellerie."

219014.name: O Bruxo
219014.description:
User summary:

O Bruxo is a translation of Dungeon World Playbook The Witch, by Melissa Fisher and David Guyll. In this playbook you'll find everything about witches: predict the future, curse your enemies, bre potions and create amulets. You'll also find new equipment, like the athame and the pentacle, twenty magical items, and designer notes.

219015.name: O Teriantropo
219015.description:
User summary:

O Teriantropo is a translation of Dungeon World Playbook The Therianthrope, by Melissa Fisher and David Guyll. In this playbook you won't create werewolves only: with a clever system, you'll create everything you want, based on a list of chosen traits (higher damage, unusual size, natural armor and more). And, when leveling up, you'll be able to upgrade your abilities, becoming stronger, harder, and with a better sense of how to control your change.

219016.name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Dwarf Giants
219016.description:
A Dwarven expansion team with an out-of-the-box team value of 1,000,000 gold pieces. Ideal for playing against either Orcs or Humans in the base game.

Contains:
- 6 Blockers
- 2 Runners
- 2 Blitzers
- 2 Troll Slayers
- 2 team token/coins
- 2 unique blood bowl balls
- 1 team stats and assembly leaflet

219017.name: Snodgits
219017.description:
From cassette inlay
Very strange things have been happening at MYSTERY MANSION, home of Lord and Lady Snodger and their children. A turkey, a teddy bear and a rubber duck are amonst the items just seem to have dissapeared into thin air. The residents of MYSTERY MANSION try to put all the blame on the Snodgits, those cute mischievous little creatures who always seem to be up to something. Who has stolen the ice-cream from the fridge? Who spilled ink on the new carpet? The Snodgits!
Of cause the world's most famous detectives such as Inspector Clousteau, Padlock Holmes and Miss Marbles to name but a few all dismiss this excuse as nonsense and have gathered at MYSTERY MANSION to solve the mysteries. Within this web of intrigue and deceit you play the part of Benton the butler, a bungling amateur sleuth who is out to prove that he can solve the case before any of his famous competitors. However life seldom runs smoothly for Benton and he must try to discover clues and track down suspects in between hos day-to-day duties of looking after the tiresom Lord and Lady Snodger and their bossy children.
So it's eye peeled, nose to the ground, ears to the wall, leave no stone unturned and "Benton!", "Yes, m'lord, coming m'lord..."

219018.description:
For years the Soviet army didn't care much for losses. The enemy was at the gate and had to be pushed back at all cost. If things could be easily salvaged or repaired, fine. But any more than that was just left to rot on the battlefield. This whole philosophy changed with the first vehicles derived from VK technology: even destroyed these were still very valuable. And even if nothing could be taken from the wreckage, it had to be properly destroyed so nothing would fall into enemy hands. This kind of job is much more seriously done outside of the battlefield.

Hence the creation of a new generation of KV47 with specialized task and equipment. With these, heavy SSU regiments could now take care of their precious vehicles directly during combat. And some of these models proved quite efficient to blow things up as well. The guys piloting these things are among the best mechanics on the planet. They already knew how to make pretty cheap but effective repairs with what they had at hand. But they know how to pilot a walker too.
219018.name: Dust Tactics: KV-47G (TSH) Light Assault Walker – "Mikhail"

219019.name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Grak and Crumbleberry Star Players
219019.description: A Forge World event or Warhammer World exclusive Star Player ogre/halfling combo team, with a unique special move: Kick Team Mate.

219020.name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Hall of Fame Card Pack
219020.description:
A set of additional Special Move cards that expands the tactical options provided by those included in the core game.

A ton of weird, wonderful and bizarre events can and will happen on and off the pitch during games of Blood Bowl, and they’re represented brilliantly by the Hall of Fame cards. Building on the cards included in the boxed game is this pack of 26 cards – split into two decks, the 10-card Magical Memorabilia and 16-card Heroic Feats decks – which bring out the anarchy of this Sport of Champions in fine style. Roll a dice at the beginning of your game to see how many each player can wield; a well-placed card can swing the tide in your favor. (from publisher's website)

219021.description: One of the most common variant of tropical KV47 in use, with its huge RPG, Nina has a very interesting weapon system when facing armored targets. Its piercing shells are very efficient at piercing anything solid covered in steel.
219021.name: Dust Tactics: KV-47D (TSH) Light Anti-Tank Walker – "Nina"

219022.description: The most common variant of tropical KV47 in use, with its dual Howitzers Natasha has a very interesting weapon system when facing elite infantry. Its explosive shells are very efficient against any cover behind which enemy soldiers could hide.
219022.name: Dust Tactics: KV-47B (TSH) Light Gun Walker – "Natasha"

219023.name: Slug
219023.description:
From cassette inlay
Picture the scene. It's Friday night, 11pm. Slug and his sweetheart are settling down in front of the gogglebox to watch the Friday Nite Horror Movie, 'Emperor Hades Meets The Yak Faces Melboids From East London Part 37 (Revisited) when from out of nowhere, a huge mechanical hand reaches down and plucks your beloved from before your every eyes.

Bewilderment quickly turns into destermination as you vow, whatever the cost, to save her.

You discover that she has been taken to a strange land where monstrous creathres roam. (No not Glasgow silly!) These creatures include Snails, Turtles, Snakes, Blobs on legs, and Sheep On Springs (Hiya Jeff!).

Your task is to collect the hearts that will guarantee your girlfriend's release. The number you need to complete each screen variates with the level you are on.

You must also be on the lookout for bombs. These count down from 9 to 0 before exploding, but you can defuse them simple by running into them.

You may think that all of this is too much for a lowly slug to handle, but you are armed with T.N.T.S. (Tri-Nitro-Toluene Smile!!) which destroy the creatures on contact.

So there you have it, your quest awaits. And remember, even if it seems you have found your beloved, all is not what it seems!!!

219024.name: Rik the Roadie
219024.description:
From cassette inlay
You are Rik, roadie to the world famous pop group, ALTERNATIVE ROCK. In order for Alternative ROck to stay popular, you, as their roadie, must get all their equipment to the gig, take it into the hall, and set up the sound levels before the gig starts

219025.name: 4 Most Fun
219025.description:
User Summary
Collection of four games with a good amount of humor

219027.name: Rally Driver
219027.description:
User Summary
Rally game made to be a simulation rather than an arcade game. You will be driving on various road conditions.

219028.name: 4 Most Sport
219028.description:
User Summary
A collection of four sports games for Commodore 64 and ZX Spectrum

219029.name: NEIL Android
219029.description:
From cassette inlay
In the year 2199, the Spaceship 'Epic' was caught in a plasma storm and forced off course through a space warp into unknown space. Due to damage sustained during the storm, the 'Epic' has been forced down to an apparently uninhabited planted for urgent repairs.

Whilst on-planet, the ship, unknown by the crew, became infected with an alien life form (ALF).

Repairs made, the ship set off on its journey home to Altontron. It was then they became aware of the ALF. Investigations of the ALF by the medical centre produced the following data.

1) The ALF was a virus type of creature with an incubation period of 12 days.
2) After 12 days. it metamorphosed into pools of slime with the ability to grow and move.
3) After a short period, it then became into a slime walking monster.
4) The final transformation was into a large walking slime throwing monster, some of which appear to have the power to turn invisible.

Several crew members have been killed on contact with the ALF. The captain of the Epic gave the order to abandon ship and the crew teleported to a nearby planetoid to await rescue. The last crew member to leave, activated the ships into clean system whose Servo droids would hunt and destroy only ALF's on the ship. On hitting an ALF, they self destruct, leaving their energy rolls behind.

Also activated was a mayday message:
TSS - EPIC TO UFP COMMAND SHIP OVERRUN WITH ALF'S
SEND N.E.I.L. DROIDS
KILL ALL LIFEFORAAAAARRRHHH!!!

Take the part of N.E.I.L., the half human, half cyborg, mercenary who can go where no human can go.

Arriving at the location of the TSS Epic, you have teleported aboard to clear the ship of ALF's in order for the crew to return and continue their voyage.

219030.description:
The new game adventure of the Miki the Moth.
Straight from the Filobiblonia, the lend of books and games lovers. SPRINTO - is the favorite board game of bookworms, Grace and aunt Zgryzelda. "The day without Sprinto play with a cup of rose tea, is a lost day" - according to the Miki the Moth.
Let's try to play in the really loony board game, invite your freinds and family. As soon as possible move pawns on yours route to the end. Do you think, it's easy? No way!
You can lose all your pawns and give them back to the beginning or... with frozen pawns idly watch how the other wins!
219030.name: Sprinto

219031.name: Nosferatu the Vampyre
219031.description:
From cassette inlay
Nightfall. The deadly enchantment begins.
Will you live to see the dawn?

Fight a desperate battle to save your soul from the
vampyre's bloodlust. Your enemy's power is subtle
and mysterious, his strength never-ending. There is
only one way to bring Nosferatu's reign to an end.
There are three parts to your struggle to overcome the
Vampyre:

DRACULA'S CASTLE

You are Jonathan Harker, an innocent employee of
the estate agent Renfield. Count Dracula wishes to
buy a house in your home town, Wismar. You have
been sent to his castle to complete the sale, only to
discover the Count's true identity - he is a Vampyre!

Now you must act fast to protect yourself and the
inhabitants of Wismar from his power. If Nosferatu
moves into the house he could soon take control of
the whole town and turn the innocent inhabitants
into vampyres!

You left the deeds to the house on the dining room
table, but they have disappeared. You must find them
and escape as soon as you can. Nosferatu is most
dangerous at night when the castle doors are locked.
You cannot escape until the light of day, when the
Vampyre lies low. Meanwhile you may have to
contend with vampyre beasts, plagued rats, and
hallucinations created by Nosferatu for your
confusion.

You can find weapons and objects to aid your survival,
but fighting the evil beasts will sap your energy.

219032.name: 4 Most Horror
videogamecompilation: The Astonishing Adventures of Mr. Weems and the She-Vampires
219032.description:
User Summary
Four horror games one one tape

219033.name: Fast Approaching Twilight
219033.description:
From publisher blurb:

The heroes race to help preserve a planet’s biological legacy in the face of onrushing doom. But is there time to preserve the world's most astonishing legacy?

Fast Approaching Twilight is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

219034.name: Sherwood: The Legend of Robin Hood (5E)
219034.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Sherwood Forest, a place of mystery and excitement. Band together to oppose the forces of the Sheriff and Prince John in England during the Third Crusade. Create your characters to do whats best for England and King Richard by protecting his interests at home.

This setting book allows you to play in the Medieval England of the period of the Third Crusades. There are classes designed specifically for that period. The book is designed to not only emulate the historical period, but also the mythical one as well. Play in any level you would like from historical to mythical, emulating various novels, stories and tv shows about Robin Hood.

This setting can be played in either historic or mythical mode. Historic is more realistic, leaving out magic, but in mythical mode, magic has been added to the setting allowing you to play in the fantastic. In addition to this we have a special type of Action Points called Swashbuckling Points. What these do is allow your character to do the impossible, from swinging on a rope chandelier to climbing up the wall using only a knife. In a style that emulates the early fantastical stories of the genre.

219035.name: Sealing Fate
219035.description:
From publisher blurb:

For a level 20 party!

At the dawn of creation, a war raged, fought on both sides by the fabled empyreans. Such was the war the gods were forced to intervene, scarring the world and forging a creature of unimaginable destruction from the worldblood that came from the wound. This weapon rose to end the empyreans' war and their reign. Before a new age of mortal races would begin, the gods sealed their awful creation away in the World Scar so it would never rise again.

But now the seal is weakening, and the beast threatens to annihilate all life on the world once more. If the god-like empyreans could not stand against it, who could?

Sealing Fate includes PLAYER SAFE MAPS - maps you can show your players for each encounter area that does not reveal important details like the locations of traps, treasure, or hostile creatures.

219036.name: Forged in Magic: REFORGED
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
219036.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unlock the Treasures of the Ages…

Legends speak of heroes wielding magical weapons and enchanted relics, battling great evils and righting wrongs throughout the world. Whether created by dwarven master smiths, mage artificers or built by inhuman hands, you’ll find them all here, within this tome.

…And Forge your Legend!

Forged in Magic: REFORGED presents over 400+ magic items for your 5E campaign – from enchanted weapons, armors, rings and shields to mystical potions, magical staffs and a myriad of wondrous items.

You’ll also find a new rules, such as Other Worldly Patrons for Warlocks, new weapons, armors, spells and a Rune Magic system that gives versatility to magic items without unbalancing your game.

rpg: Bravest Warriors: This Way or That
219037.name: The Great Core Caper
219037.description:
From publisher blurb:

Four teenage travelers traverse the universe saving those in need with the power of emotion...though not always in the way you’d expect...in fact...never! Now, in the style of the classic "Choose Your Own Adventure" books, you get to decide the fate of the Bravest Warriors in the first ever Bravest Warriors: This Way or That book!

The planet Goober-Delta will lose orbit if its stolen planetary core is not returned. Where is that core? In the most secure vault in the Galaxy— beneath SID BEEMER-BOOF’S Fun Planet, the biggest amusement park in the known universe.

The Bravest Warriors must recruit a daring team including: Plum, Catbug, President Memory Donk, Professor Brain Dog 7, and the Emotion Lord. Each team member must play their part in order to pull off the most outrageous heist of all time! And on EVERY page, YOU decide what happens next!

219038.name: The Sage of Cormanthor
219038.description:
From the introduction:

The grain has rotted in the town of Elmwood, which means people might starve, businesses and banks might fail, and endanger the town’s already-precarious existence. Brave adventurers are needed to travel through the wild forest to seek the advice of the Sage of Cormanthor.

A four-hour adventure for 5th - 10th level characters.

219039.name: At the Mountains of Madness
219039.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Air New Zealand Flight 901 (TE-901) was a scheduled Air New Zealand Antarctic sightseeing flight that operated between 1977 and 1979. The flight left Auckland Airport in the morning and spent a few hours flying over the Antarctic continent, before returning to Auckland in the evening via Christchurch. On 28 November 1979, the fourteenth flight of TE-901, a McDonnell Douglas DC-10-30 registered ZK-NZP, flew into Mount Erebus on Ross Island, Antarctica, killing all 237 passengers and 20 crew on board. The accident is commonly known as the Mount Erebus disaster. The initial investigation concluded the accident was caused by pilot error but what was the true nature of this air crash. And what of the now albatross-torn corpses that litter the side of Mt. Erebus...

219040.name: Fantasized Adventures Character Sheets
219040.description:
Publisher's blurb:

All the forms you need to keep track of your character and their mount.

User summary:

Intended for print-and-play use.

219041.name: Fantasized Adventures Introduction and Glossary
219041.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An introduction to Fantasized Adventures. This game gives you the player the control over how your adventurer develops. [There are] sixty-nine occupations to choose from. As your character develops, you will get a unique one-of-a-kind player character.

219042.name: Fantasized Adventures Occupations
219042.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Starting Occupations - 69 different types of starting adventurers. Remember you the player, not the rules, will control how they develop. Each character will be unique, no two will ever be just alike.

219043.name: Fantasized Adventures Adventurer Generation
219043.description:
Publisher's blurb:

How to generate your adventurer character. You the player will guide this development.

219044.name: Fantasized Adventures Races of Ba'Kara
219044.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The [seventeen] races of Ba'Kara are presented here. How tall are you? What do you weigh? Who are your parents? What did they do for a living? What is your hair/eye color? All that and more can be found here.

219045.name: Fantasized Adventures Incantations Volume 1
219045.description:
Publisher's blurb:

[Over one hundred] pages of cantrips and prayers for all clerical types.

219046.name: Fantasized Adventures Incantations Volume 2
219046.description:
Publisher's blurb:

[Over one hundred] pages of spells for all kinds of users.

219047.name: Fantasized Adventures Incantations Volume 3
219047.description:
Publisher's blurb:

[Twenty-two] pages of new prayers and spells for all kinds of users.

219048.name: Fantasized Adventures Worldmaster's Guide
219048.description:
Publisher's blurb:

All the information you need to be a worldmaster and run a campaign with Fantasized Adventures.

219049.name: Fantasized Adventures Animals, Creatures, and Monsters
219049.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A list of all the creatures your adventurers could meet.

User summary:

A game bestiary.

219050.name: Fantasized Adventures Deities and Patrons
219050.description:
Publisher's blurb:

All the Deities of Ba'Kara and their Patrons (Angels).

219051.name: Fantasized Adventures Equipment and Supplies
219051.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Equipment and Supplies for your adventurer. What does a long sword cost? What does it weigh? Ready made Adventurer pack? That and more are listed here with costs.

219052.name: Town of Cambe
219052.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A town typical the Ducal Lands of Fantasized Adventures. Suitable for use with any fantasy role playing campaign.

219053.name: Town of Carrack
219053.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A town typical the Ducal Lands of Fantasized Adventures. Suitable for use with any fantasy role playing campaign.

219054.description:
Description from the publisher:

Things are definitely getting weird in Undimensioned and Unseen, the fourth Mythos Pack in The Dunwich Legacy cycle for Arkham Horror: The Card Game…

By the time your pursuit of two missing professors leads you to the scenario from Undimensioned and Unseen, you'll have traveled far from the familiar comforts of Arkham, and you'll have witnessed things you know no one would ever believe. You'll find yourself neck-deep in furtive cultists and their sacrifices, inundated with information about "Ancient Ones" and unholy rituals. And you'll suddenly find yourself forced to destroy terrifying, monstrous creatures that are literally impervious to everything in your arsenal…

A mystery within a mystery, Undimensioned and Unseen may bring you another step closer to your ultimate goal, but you must first track down whatever knowledge or power may allow you to defeat a number of otherwise invulnerable Abominations. And it demands that you complete your investigation quickly—possibly by making use of the Mythos Pack’s new player cards—lest you should no longer be the hunter, but the hunted!
219054.name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Undimensioned and Unseen
boardgamefamily: Arkham Horror: The Card Game LCG

219055.name: Village of Selmoth
219055.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A village typical the Ducal Lands of Fantasized Adventures. Suitable for use with any fantasy role playing campaign.

219056.name: Players' Guide
219056.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the Players' Guide (PG) for 'Dark Obelisk 1: Berinncorte, and as such, it's meant to accompany the adventure itself.

Your gaming group will need a copy of the Adventure Book (Pathfinder version or 5E) to play this adventure.

In addition, for the complete Dark Obelisk 1: Berinncorte experience, we recommend the accompanying Dramatis Personae & Bestiary.

219058.name: Dusk
219058.description:
(publisher blurb)

DUSK is a rules-light, post-apocalyptic roleplaying game and setting in which the characters are the survivors of some cataclysmic event. It has been so long since the end of the world that nobody can even remember how or why it happened.

Some say it was a massive thermonuclear world war, while others believe it was some form of epidemic which spread uncontrollably - in all likelihood, it was probably a combination of lots of different factors that led to the eventual downfall of civilization as we know it, not that any of that matters now.

All the inhabitants of DUSK know is that the wastelands are a harsh, unforgiving place, where if you aren’t careful, the environment or another survivor will almost certainly mean the end for you.

This book contains everything you need to play, including all the rules for character creation, game mastering as well as a full campaign setting and bestiary.

219059.name: Trouble at Troublewater
219059.description:
From the introduction:

Warning: this adventure contains some adult elements, and is not recommended for players under 18 years old.

There are two parts in this little adventure: first, “The Arrival”, introduces the PCs into the village, and they get a task to clear a rat-infested cellar.

Second, “Honor Among Thieves”, presents a situation where they have several choices of what to do. This second part can be resolved in many ways, with or without combat. I have run the second part of the adventure, in different game worlds, for four times so far. What’s interesting is that every group that has played the scenario has found a different solution and tactics.

User summary:

Intended for brand new characters.

219060.name: Hostages in the Wizard Academy
219060.description:
From the introduction:

Someone has taken over the famous wizard academy! His wererat lackey has called from the walls the officers of city and demands king’s ransom for all the wizards!

There is a secret tunnel to kitchen of the academy. People of the town promise big amount of gold for heroes if they get rid of the mysterious conquerors.

219061.name: Black Fingers of Everlight
219061.description:
where slumdogs save the day and help a mighty champion to atone

From the introduction:

In hopeless slums of metropolitan Sothis, the capital of desert country Osirion, a cult of Norgorber starts operating in a disguise of the sun goddess Sarenrae. Unbeknown to its subjects, the Mercy House of Reputable Dawnflower sends beggars and other unfortunate people to their doom, to be sold as slaves or to be used as test subjects for new poisons. Outside, the Mercy keeps up a facade of the Healing Goddess, doing minor healing work and distributing fresh drinking water. Word of the Mercy spreads fast in the slums, and their activities become widely accepted.

219062.name: Tales from Naerie: Hallowed Be Her Name
219062.description:
An adventure for Pathfinder, set in the World of Greyhawk

From the introduction:

Working in a city guard is usually somewhat straightforward and even a simple brute can become good in it. However, sometimes even the simplest of jobs can go badly wrong...

User summary:

For 2nd level characters.

219063.name: Children of the Night: Demons
219063.description:
From the introduction:

Demons are different. They are purely, relentlessly evil; they have no sympathetic qualities and are completely unable to ever truly understand the higher virtues of mortals, like true love or self-sacrifice. They are incapable of redemption.

User summary:

Includes several "mini adventures".

219064.name: The Fall of Fairhaven
219064.description:
From the introduction:

A wounded messenger falls to the earth, and once saved from his pursuers informs the PCs that they may well be the town of Fairhaven’s best hope against the swelling armies of the regional warlord, Ymial.

User summary:

For 4th - 5th level characters. Designed as a drop-in adventure for any campaign setting. Especially designed for use with the Reaper Bones Vampire miniatures.

219065.name: A Hole in Magic
219065.description:
From the introduction:

Kora is a halfling leader whose people disappeared in an odd incident: 50 days ago, after the halflings had left Leafgrove, unknown enemies attacked them. Kora and two other halflings managed to flee by river but saw nothing. After 30 days of looking for the rest, they turned out to be in the antimagic area, enslaved by evil squid-people. Kora and the two have tried to rescue them but have not succeeded, so she decided to hire more help.

User summary:

For 5th - 6th level characters.

219066.name: Slaves of Time
219066.description:
From the introduction:

At exactly midnight a cataclysmic earthquake shakes the village, collapsing buildings and injuring a few people. Nobody is killed but everyone is alarmed, a crowd quickly gathers in the street. A loud grumbling roar is heard ten minutes afterwards...

User summary:

For 6th level characters.

219067.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A 36" by 36" high quality printed vinyl mat, perfect for your tanks to engage in combat in Tanks!

This mat has roads, farm buildings, and corn fields. Additional terrain elements and rules for playing with these features can be found on the GF9 website.
219067.name: Tanks: Corn Fields Game Mat

219068.name: Indiana
219068.description:
User Summary

Indiana is a platform game written by W. Schönegge for Commodore 64 in 1985. The game is a platform game where each level is on one screen only. On each screen there is platforms, belts, stairs, keys, enemies etc. The aim is to control the hero "Indie", a boy with a cap, so he stay away from the enemies, and also get all the keys before the air (timer) runs out. All the levels have names, like: Woodoo Man, Thelephone Land, Jump Man etc. Some levels refere to classic video games, like the Pac Man Revenge-level where Indie has to stay way from a Pac Man and two ghosts.

219069.name: Rising Sun, Tumbling Bear: A Solitaire Game of the Russo-Japanese War (1904-1905).
219069.description:
BACKGROUND: RISING SUN, TUMBLING BEAR is semi-historical simulation of the Russo-Japanese War (1904-1905) at the dawn of the 20th Century. The Game begins shortly after the Japanese surprise naval attack on the Russian warships docked in Port Arthur. The Russians are now building up their forces and gathering their fleets to kick the Japanese out of Manchuria and Korea. The Japanese must capture a number of key Russian controlled settlements before Russia is able to effectively mobilize an overwhelming force into the region or the United States President, Theodore Roosevelt, signs the Peace Treaty of Portsmouth.

OBJECTIVE: As the Commander of the Japanese Naval and Land Forces, you must gather your land and naval forces to capture a number of Key Russian Controlled Settlements before the Russian Baltic Fleet reaches Port Arthur or President Theodore Roosevelt signs the Portsmouth Peace Accord. The Japanese must control all 7 of the Key Russian Settlements in order to win. If the Baltic Fleet reaches Vladivostok, they win.

RISING SUN, TUMBLING BEAR features many colorful Unit and Ship Counters and fast and furious Combat systems for both land and naval combat.

219070.description: A kickstarter-exclusive expansion to The World of SMOG: Rise of Moloch, consisting of six additional Gentlemen - Suzanne Taylor, Colonel Steel, John Brown, Sir Daniel Home, Master Fox and Parvin Khan - each with their own dashboard and card.
219070.name: The World of SMOG: Rise of Moloch – Gentlemen Of Her Majesty's Service

219071.name: Qadira: Jewel of the East
219071.description:
(publisher blurb)

Nestled amid the shining deserts, rugged mountains, and mysterious jungles of the Inner Sea region's easternmost reaches is Qadira, a land rife with intrigue and adventure. Be it the clash of powerful merchants in the heart of a sprawling metropolis or the sinister machinations of fell spirits from the depths of the trackless desert, Qadira is a land where any hero can rise to power and achieve untold wealth - provided you know the right person and don't step on the wrong toes along your way!

This Pathfinder Campaign Setting sourcebook features comprehensive information about the history of the mighty nation of Qadira, its people, their customs, and their faiths, as well as offers a first look at the many elements of the Padishah Empire of Kelesh, including new societies, new faiths, and new organizations from that ancient region, plus a full map of the nation of Qadira that covers both its civilized regions and its wilderness.

219072.name: Candle Cove Caves
219072.description:
From publisher blurb:

Estimated time to complete - 5 to 6hrs

Red Wing Dragon is, on the face of it, a quaint harbourside pub. An ideal spot for a quick drink and a break from the perils of the road. But Red Wing stands on the shore of Candle Cove, a place of strange legends, hidden treasure and the long lost lair of the red dragon Jacaranda. Will the player group drink up and be on their way? Or will the old stories tempt them to investigate the so-called Beast of Candle Cove and the caves where the creature supposedly dwells.

219073.name: The Theosopher Stone
219073.description:
From publisher blurb:

Estimated time to complete - 5 to 6hrs

The Theosophers lived in an age long passed. They worshipped the essence of the life-giving sun whose nurturing spirit they called the Quintessence. Their idyllic ideologies were opposed by a cult of dark brethren whose members prostrated themselves before a mysterious deity known as Quino, the lunatic eye. Quino whose cyclops glow illuminated the night and the souls of those who worshipped him with the secrets of madness.

The player group know little of the history of these ancients and their violent struggles. But they have a map, marked with a cross... and they have knowledge of a treasure trove abandoned and forgotten. Can they find the lost temple of the Theosophers and the wealth of a vanished people, or are some secrets best left undisturbed?

219074.name: Champions of Fallen Hill
219074.description:
From publisher blurb:

Estimated time to complete - 6hrs

A book reveals itself to be more than a simple relic of lost times and ancient legend. Within the book is a living magic - the essence of a long forgotten religion - and when this essence is unlocked the player group find themselves thrown into a place of no escape, where the ghoulish servants of an ancient evil roam in darkness and the spirits of a vanished cult languish in their despair. Can the player group solve the mystery of Zohar and find the mysterious being who calls herself Lurian Stede? Only by returning the spirit of the book to its rightful owner can they unliock the tomb of a long forgotten civilization, free the chained spirits of a beleagured people and truly become champions of Fallen Hill.

219075.name: The River Runs Red
219075.description:
From publisher blurb:

Estimated time to complete - 6hrs

In the marshlands of Hollowing Heath the river Drenchmeer mingles with a stream flowing from clay caves in the hills. The stream carries silt in its current and turns Drenchmeer a vivid red, giving the river the colour and consistency of arterial blood. This river of blood then enters that place known as The Bleeding Craw, a subterranean realm inhabited by evil creatures and used for evil purpose. Local women and children are vanishing, stolen by the horrors that live in the caves. Whatever fate awaits them at Drenchmeer's end cannot be known, not without climbing into a boat and venturing boldly into the shadowy depths of the Craw, there where the waters of the river run red.

219076.name: The Ritual of Harrow Mogg
219076.description:
From publisher blurb:

Estimated time to complete - 6hrs

Somewhere within the old mines of Harrow Mogg lies the subterranean temple of Quino. Here a band of lunatic priests once sacrificed the living in a macabre ritual designed to return the Moon God Quino to life. The temple has long been buried in a succession of cave-ins, the mine lost to memory and folklore. But recently, wailing banshee cries have been rising from the deep and locals fear something still lurks in the shadowy tunnels of the mine. Worse than this, rumours abound that the time of Quino is fast returning. Harrow Mogg, with its deadly seams of raw, murderous chaos, still harbours a restless malice and those unhallowed gods once worshipped there still long to return and revisit their wickedness upon the world.

219077.name: Threads of the Orb Weaver
219077.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can a recent earthquake in the Eerie Forest and a long-lost artifact of the Drow be connected somehow? A young scholar of magic and religion just came back from an expedition to Spiderhaunt Manor with a terrifying tale of his narrow escape from spiderlike, murderous humanoids and an ominous shadow lurking among the ruins of the dilapidated building. The scholar is now looking for an explanation in the ancient drawing that initially drew him to his adventure...unbeknown that the shadow followed him.

The events of Threads of the Orb Weaver occur at the Ruins of Spiderhaunt Manor. In the Eerie Forest, the ruins lie at the end of a path branching off from the Road of the Two Fangs. The path runs through an area of wooded rough terrain, along a ridge furrowed with dry crevices. Looming over one of these cracks in the rock, the abandoned remains of what once was the sequestered house of a mad cleric-scientist named Araknos were recently flattened by an earthquake. GMs are encouraged to place the manor in any forest convenient for their campaign. This adventure is designed for four 7th-level characters in the Fifth Edition of the world’s oldest roleplaying game.

219078.name: Earth Unleashed (d20)
219078.description:
From publisher blurb:

A woman who’s wearing hide armor and carries a long staff, stands in the center of the square. She has long brown hair, bright blue eyes, and the tan of someone who spends most of her time outside. She speaks with a loud voice: “Earth and rocks rained down on Wodfeld! The earth trembled! Mother Nature gave us a sign; a warning! She wants us to leave, leave the forest so she can heal it! Twice her warnings came. Who knows what happens the next time? Will Mother Nature warn us again or will Wodfeld be destroyed by her boundless power? Do not wait to find out! Leave while you still can!”

Earth Unleashed is an adventure intended for a party of four 7th-level adventurers. Player Characters (PCs) that complete the adventure should reach 8th level at the end. The adventure can easily be adjusted to suit weaker or stronger parties.
The adventure takes place in the village Wodfeld, situated in the woods. The name Wodfeld could easily be replaced by the name of an existing place in your campaign world, or by a name that fits your campaign world better. The woods in which it lies is not given a name, but it could be any large forest in your campaign world..

219079.name: The House Under the Hill
219079.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure into a land cloaked of mystery. Discover the old Fourwell’s history and beware the mysterious shrines which stay untouched from ages, hidden in the outskirts of the town. Meet the Fourwell’s inhabitants and, if you dare, enter the dungeon of the House Under the Hill, a ghostly place said to be haunted. Some one hundred buildings make up Fourwell. Forty-five are residences, typically small houses of wood, sod, or mud with only one floor. Narrow dirt streets crisscross the town, some covered with white gravel carted down from the hills. The one exception is the Tradeway, the wide flagstone road built by the Ancient Empire. Running north and south, it passes directly through the center of town. Fourwell has no protective walls or stockades, though Earl Invorath hopes to have some built in the near future.

What happens when a family of noble halflings is turned to horrid undead and their labyrinthine house becomes a dungeon? In the Dungeon Under the Hill adventure, the PCs will face vicious vermin, undead monstrosities, exploding mushrooms, a hysterical ghost, and more. In the end, the halflings’ ancient treasure beckons—if the party can survive to claim it.

In this module you will find:

An overview of the town of Fourwell and its surrounding lands, with detailed locations and maps.
A small dungeon crawl adventure suitable for four 2nd-level characters.
Three new prestige classes
Six new monsters.

219080.name: The King is Dead: Dhampir
219080.description:
From publisher blurb:

In an 18th century that never was, the island nation of Malleus writhes under the thumb of an aristocracy of vampires. A coalition of secret societies fights from the shadows to drag theses oppressors burning into the light, but the alliance is young and in dire need of a weapon that can turn the tide against the vampires and their forces.

Word comes to a cabal of heroes that Lady Clarimonde yearns for freedom from the tyranny of her debauched and cruel father, the Baron Drachenholm. Thankfully for her, she possesses the means to pay for her freedom: the Sanguinem Maledicta, a cure for the curse of vampirism!

The heroes must dare the deadly labyrinth of Mallean high society to discretely win the lady her freedom – but can they trust Lady Clarimonde herself? She is, after all, no human gentlewoman but rather the child of mortal and undead – a DHAMPIR!

New Hindrances!
New Edges!
New Equipment!
A modular adventure that can be resolved in one session or expanded into a mini-campaign!

219081.name: The Sundered World
219081.description:
From publisher blurb:

Chronicles of Darkness: Dark Eras reveals the world throughout its long and storied past.

Through sixteen eras, you’ll learn the secret history of the world, from the flame-lit tales of the Neolithic to the drug-fueled rebellion of the 1970s. Delve into the past, and learn that the Chronicles of Darkness began long before the modern nights.

Dark Eras: The Sundered World (Werewolf: the Forsaken and Mage: the Awakening)

"Mankind are so much the same, in all times and places, that history informs us of nothing new or strange in this particular. Its chief use is only to discover the constant and universal principles of human nature."

— David Hume

At the birth of civilization, in the shadow of the Fall, the Awakened stand as champions and protectors of the agricultural villages spread across the Balkans. In a world without a Gauntlet, where Shadow and flesh mingle, the steady taming of the world by humanity conflicts with the half-spirit children of Father Wolf.

This is a single chapter from the larger work, Chronicles of Darkness: Dark Eras.

219082.name: The Glass Peak
219082.description:
The Glass Peak is a party game that draws from inclusive ideas that the authors appreciated in games. The main idea is simple: roll a die, pick up a card, perform the task. First player to reach the last square on the board wins. The Volcano Cup and your own friend's shenanigans will make this a night to remember!

While the game is a party game and does encourage folks to indulge it prioritizes having a good time over anything else.

219083.name: Ruins of Empire
219083.description:
From publisher blurb:

During this quintessential era of the Mummy in the mind of Westerners, the Arisen maneuver through the intrigues of two great, falling empires: the British and the Ottoman. As mortals catch glimpses of their glorious past, Mummies hurtle towards the Great War, a conflict on a scale unseen in recorded history.

This is a single chapter from the larger work, Chronicles of Darkness: Dark Eras.

219084.name: Bushido: Kitsune & Fox form
219084.description:
The Kitsune has broken from the ranks of her people by allying herself with the Temple's cause. Her mobility on the battlefield greatly improves the Temple's ability to meet their objectives.

Blister contains one Kitsune miniature, one Fox form miniature, two 30mm bases and two full colour profile cards.

219085.name: Embers of Mirrim
219085.description:
To save their world from an alien threat, two proud races must set aside their differences and come together… literally.

An ancient power forges together two distinctly different creatures into one versatile hero charged with restoring peace and balance to the world. This newly minted savior has the grace and power of its respective races, as well as the ability to split itself into light and dark ember. Each ember is controlled independently using right and left analog sticks, creating an intuitive and endlessly satisfying way to platform through stunning fantastical landscapes.

Source: The Game Website.

219086.name: Rockalypse Accelerated
219086.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to post-apocalyptic musical conflict!

The world has ended, and only music can save what's left. Grab your instruments, form your band, and get ready to fight demons, road gangs, and megacorps using the only real weapon: ROCK!

This is the trimmed-down version for Fate Accelerated, and contains all the basic rules for Accelerated play.

219087.name: Bushido: Aiko & Gorilla
219087.description:
The Temple of Ro-Kan gain some real punching power, the mighty fists of a Gorilla. Fiercely protective of Aiko, the Gorilla is a fearsome opponent at the best of times, when he is imbued by Aiko’s blessing he becomes almost invincible.

Blister contains two miniatures, one 30mm base, one 40mm base and two full colour profile cards.

219088.name: Lair of the Green Dragon
219088.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep in the ancient forest dwells the Green Dragon!

Need a quick map for an encounter?

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depiciting the forest cave lair of a Green Dragon. Set in a cave deep in ancient woodland, the Green Dragon makes its nest, where it sleeps on a pile of gold.

219089.name: Lair of the Blue Dragon
219089.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dug into a dry mountain cave, overlooking an oasis - the Blue Dragon watches for prey.

Need a quick map for an encounter?

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depiciting the forest cave lair of a Green Dragon. Set in a cave deep in ancient woodland, the Green Dragon makes its nest, where it sleeps on a pile of gold.

219090.name: Lair of the Black Dragon
219090.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep in the deadly swamps and marshes of the wilderness, the Black Dragon makes its lair!

Need a quick map for an encounter?

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depiciting the forest cave lair of a Green Dragon. Set in a cave deep in ancient woodland, the Green Dragon makes its nest, where it sleeps on a pile of gold.

219091.name: Bushido: Shisa
219091.description:
The guardians of the temples, these silent sentinels have stood for eons outside many a shrine or holy place. Now with the realised threat of another wave they have been reanimated from their long slumber. Always fighting in pairs, the links between the two run right to the very core of their being. In this time of strife, the return of the Shisa is a timely relief.
Blister contains two miniatures, two 30mm bases and full colour

219092.name: Jaws of the Jhambizaur
219092.description:
From publisher blurb:

The heroes are caught between a halfling merchant and a town of Cherufe, all under attack by an ancient evil and its horde of undead dinosaurs.

Designed for a party of PCs of 7th-8th level, for use with the Skybourne campaign setting.

219093.name: Bushido: Riku
219093.description: A favourite of the temple elders and new initiates alike, Riku personifies what it means to be a Monk. His mastery over water allows him to achieve awe inspiring feats on the battlefield, creating walls of water out of the very air to hinder his opponents.

219094.name: Deep Space: Operation Copernicus
219094.description:
User Summary

Deep Space: Operation Copernicus is a space simulator by Sir-Tech.

219095.name: Witanlore: Dreamtime
219095.description:
Guided by your spirit totem animal, assume the role of a young ursine brave whose fate has not yet been determined and embark on an astral journey into the dream world where the shadows of an ancient conflict are on the rise and destiny awaits.

Source: The Developer Website.

219096.name: The Depth of Banack Dûm
219096.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hidden in the depth of the Mountain of Fate, lies the ancient dwarfhold of Banack Dum. Rumours claim it holds an artifact of ancient evil, others speak of treasures beyond imagination. Will the players face the perils of this sinkhole of evil, or will they flee in terror from the undead abominations that once were dwarves?

From the introduction:

Grugan the Beholder Mage has heard about the nexus related treasure to be found in Banack Dûm and has sent one of his lieutenants to Necropolis to recover it. Grash is eager to proof his worth to his master and has hired some extra help in the form of the two loveable scoundrels Jean and Jaques.

219097.name: Quest for the Staff of the Nexus
219097.description:
From the introduction:

While travelling in the Nexus, the [player characters] encounter a cherub-like creature that is lost and promises them to tell them a secret, if they help it return to its own world.

User summary:

Note the Staff of the Nexus is not recovered in this scenario.

219098.name: The Battle for Amorina
219098.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Caught between the armies of light and dark, the PCs must find a way to recover the artifact they have come for before they become involved in an epic battle, likely to tear the very Nexus asunder.

From the introduction:

Prince Lendir has sent his son Alamir and some of his best soldiers to attack Grugan. While numerically inferior to the hordes of the beholder, they are elite warriors and highly mobile.

219099.name: Mage Wars Arena: Verschollene Zauber
219099.description: Mage Wars Arena: Verschollene Zauber is a collection of cards for Mage Wars Arena that were previously available only as promotional items.

219100.name: UBOOT: The Board Game
219100.description:
Description from the publisher:

UBOOT: The Board Game is a fully cooperative, real-time tabletop game of WW2 submarine warfare. It allows 1 to 4 players to assume the roles of the Captain, the First Officer, the Navigator, and the Chief Engineer on board of a type VIIC U-boat. The game is enhanced by a companion app, allowing for an unprecedented level of realism, as well as a challenging enemy A.I. which will push your skills to the limit. The action unfolds both on the strategic and the tactical scale, always demanding teamwork, efficient crew management, and quick situation assessment.

Each of the four roles entails unique responsibilities, encouraging the players to develop an efficient communication scheme and use genuine navy terminology. The Captain oversees the completion of mission objectives, supervises action point costs, and is responsible for the crew's morale. The First Officer operates the companion app, manages the flow of information, and takes care of the crew's health. The Navigator steers the submarine by setting its course and depth, but also updates all the essential information on the strategic, and the tactical map. Last, but not least, is the Chief Engineer, who is responsible for the engines, repairs, as well as other mechanical implements on board of the U-boat (such as the ballast tanks, weapon systems, etc.). At the same time, each of the four officers commands his own group of crew members by issuing orders within a worker placement system.

The idea behind the companion app is to deliver a real-time, realistic gameplay experience. To that end, the app features the most essential instruments of the u-boat (such as the periscope, the hydrophone, and the Enigma, among others). Rest assured, however, that the vast majority of gameplay traditionally takes place on the game board, with the instruments revealing otherwise hidden information, and the app requiring only certain data (such as the U-boat's course, speed, etc.) in order to generate an adequate A.I. response of the enemy force. It is also responsible for all the ambient sound effects, thus immersing the players even deeper into the claustrophobic interiors of the type VII C. But fear not! With open & play being a design priority, you will be launching torpedoes in no time, thanks to streamlined rules, video tutorials, and variable difficulty levels for each player.

From quick skirmishes, through full combat missions, to an all-out campaign, UBOOT: TBG will let you conduct submarine operations in all major naval theatres of the 2nd World War. Success of these missions hinges on the completion of various tasks delegated to the crew by the Oberkommando der Kriegsmarine (German Navy HQ), which include patrol duty, ambushing convoys, laying mines in enemy waters, and many more! Each mission will require the players to adopt various strategies and playstyles in order to successfully complete it, and the companion app will generate a detailed report at the end of each game session (evaluating player efforts, and possibly awarding decorations, promotions, etc.). That is, if the U-boat makes it back home...

The stage is set and the crew is awaiting your orders. Do you have what it takes to command the Kriegsmarine's finest? Hunt or be hunted, as you brave the stormy seas of the greatest conflict in history!

219101.name: Pavlov's House
219101.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Pavlov’s House, you take control of the valiant defenders of a Soviet strongpoint in Stalingrad as they hold out against constant German attacks for almost two months. You also control the key leaders throughout the Soviet 62nd Army that made the defense of Pavlov’s House possible.

Object of the Game
The goal of Pavlov’s House is to last until the 7th Company, 3rd Battalion, 42nd Guards Rifle Regiment of the 13th Guards Division is tasked with storming a key German strongpoint during the Battle of Stalingrad. In the game, this is depicted by playing through a deck of cards representing elements of the German 6th Army.

Pavlov’s House was a fortified apartment building used as a strongpoint by the Soviet 62nd Army during the pivotal Battle of Stalingrad in WW2. Soviet defenders - primarily from the 7th Company, 3rd Battalion, 42nd Guards Rifle Regiment of the 13th Guards Division - held out for almost two months from a constant German assault. The building’s name was drawn from Yakov Pavlov, a sergeant who led the initial storm group assault that resulted in the capture of the building from the Germans. The story of Pavlov’s House was a key piece of Soviet propaganda and was used as a symbol of the incredible resistance of Soviet forces during the Battle of Stalingrad.

boardgamecompilation: Mystic Vale: Vale of the Wild
219102.description:
Mystic Vale: Das Tal der Magie & Das Tal der Wildnis consists of two expansions in one box.

In Das Tal der Magie, the druids have mysterious new spells at their disposal, but their special powers can quickly destroy them. In Das Tal der Wildnis, the druid players meet mysterious leaders who can help them fight the curse on the land.
219102.name: Mystic Vale: Das Tal der Magie & Das Tal der Wildnis

219103.name: Battleships
219103.description:
User Summary

Battleships (or Battle Ships) was a computer version of the classic board game Battleship.

219104.name: 51st State: Cities
219104.description:
Three different "city" tiles, which produce and accumulate resources (these are not removed during clean up): either location cards, workers or ammunition. Cities are considered shared grounds, multiple players can make a deal with them, in which case, they get in each production phase the given resources. One player can also raze a city, in which case s(he) receives all accumulated resources and the city tile is removed from the game.

Was initially part of the 2016 released pre-order promos for 51st State Master Set, but released separately in the webshop later on. Rules do not come in printed form, but have to be looked up on the Portal website.

219105.name: 51st State Master Set: Texas and Hegemony Factions
219105.description:
2 new factions for the base game. Texas gives an extra worker in production and converts all three resources on a ratio of 1:1 to contact tokens. (But you are allowed to choose one of these three actions a second time per round.) Hegemony gives an extra wild contact token in production and converts grey and blue resources on a ratio of 1:1, red resources 1:2. (As usual, each only once per round.)

Was initially part of the 2016 released 51st State: Master Set pre-order promos, but released separately in the webshop later on.

219107.name: Road Rage
219107.description:
From the introduction:

For decades a small group of adventurers known as the “Circle of Five” risked their lives in search of riches and fame. As time passed however, age slowly crept into their bones until failing bodies forced them to retire to safer and quieter pursuits.

User summary:

For 2nd - 3rd level characters. Distributed as the DOC scenario file and three JPG map files.

219108.name: 51st State: Master Set – Promo Set 1
219108.description:
5 new location cards for 51st State Master Set, labled "Promo Set 1" in the bottom right corner.

"Wrecked Airplane" differs only in title and artwork from "Wrecked Tank" of the base set. The other cards provide new and unique actions or features, without introducing particularly new mechanisms.

219109.name: The City of Scorpions
219109.description:
From the introduction:

Somewhere in the ruined City of Scorpions, the Golden Scorpion awaits. It is an ancient artifact of fell power. Only desert winds now inhabit the once great city. Mercenaries and cultists have crossed the Great Desert to recover the artifact. Claiming it from the forsaken ruin should be easy...

User summary:

This scenario is distributed as a ZIP archive containing:


8-page PDF Scenario
Ten 2-page PDF pre-generated characters
Two PNG map files

219110.name: The Rat's Meow
219110.description:
From the introduction:

The Forbidden Feline is a two storey inn located along a travel route far from major cities or towns and is used as a way station for travelers along the road. The inn itself has stood for years, and in that time it has catered to traveler and adventurer alike. Once known for its good hospitality and mouthwatering food, the inn has recently changed ownership, and the menu along with it.

User summary:

For 3rd - 4th level characters.

219111.name: A Shortcut to Fortune
219111.description:
From the introduction:

What is the shortest way to fortune? A small reduction in the vast riches of a castle lord is surely something that ought to go unnoticed.

User summary:

For 5th - 6th level characters (pre-generated characters are included).

219113.name: Putrefaction 2: Void Walker
219113.description:
User Summary

Putrefaction 2: Void Walker is fast-paced, arcade FPS.

219114.name: Dungeons are Real
219114.description:
From the introduction:

[An] adventure for 4 characters of 1st experience level, pre-rolled characters are included.
...
You awake after sudden collapse of the corridor behind you. Dust is settling in the flickering light of the flashlights. You hear the coughing of your friends. The room is 30 feet wide and of same length, there is lot of rubble on the floor. Dark corridor 10 feet wide opens in the northern wall. Air tastes funny, somewhat metallic like copper pennies in your mouth.

219115.name: Gunslingers of the Goblin Canyon
219115.description:
Weird West Fantasy Roleplaying

From the introduction:

"Hey stranger. We don’t need any of you suspicious adventurers here!"

After drinking his whiskey the stranger turned slowly and threw his poncho on his shoulder revealing a shiny chainmail and two black revolver grips. "Mithralshirt and revolvers of chaos! He is the Duke of Death" shouted someone while the loudmouth wet himself.

219116.name: Halls of the Gods
219116.description:
From the introduction:

The party has long hunted the Wizard Manacheron. Now the race to reach the Halls of the Gods has started and when the adventure begins, the party finds that they have lost: Manacheron has reached the Hall first and circumvented the defenses of the holy place. But the mighty doors are open and the party must venture in to stop Manacheron from reaching the fabled prize within: the sacred Ambrosia that makes gods out of men. The party must chase the wizard into this strange hall and face the moral tests the gods place before those trying to reach godhood.

User summary:

Includes 5th - 6th level pre-generated characters.

219117.name: The Circlet of Life
219117.description:
From the introduction:

When springtime comes, it is the time for great druidic circle, the Blackwood Circle to accept new members to their society. Young members must pass the test of initiation and there has been rumours circling among candidates only strongest and smartest will pass. Alas, as in nature, only fittest will survive and there cannot be any compassion for the weak. Such is the way of the wild.

User summary:

For 4th - 5th level characters.

219118.name: The Pythagorean Triage
219118.description:
From the introduction:

The Pythagorean monastic school lies forgotten in an unknown valley. At its peak it was a place of mathematical research, learning and peaceful life. The Pythagoreans created a powerful artifact that could disperse a living being into it’s components and reassemble it in superior form. A horrible accident with the artifact destroyed the cult and now the school is in ruins and few remember the Pythagoreans or their school.

User summary:

For 1st - 3rd level characters.

219119.name: Together We Shall Triumph
rpg: Silver Age Sentinels: The Ultimate d20 Superhero Role-Playing Game
219119.description:
From the introduction:

A high skyscraper, in the banking district in Metro City. Now a noticeably shorter skyscraper than only a few hours earlier. On the brand new windy rooftop, which was previously a large meeting room, four masked superheroes stand, quietly, humbled. Milady, here to capture Dr. Omniscient. Almandine and Aventurine, aka The Twins, here after Blue Sumac and Mr. Illusion. True Justice, whose presence was more of a coincidence, trying to lend a hand. Before, they have all done their own thing, on their own turf. For the first time, they have been forced to fight side by side, and it showed. This has been their very first defeat, and it is indeed a bitter one. Midnight is just upon the city.

User summary:

For 13th - 14th level characters.

219120.name: Basket of Deplorables: The Board Game
219120.description:
This is a light-hearted, humor-filled, liberal-leaning game about the state of politics from 2016 to 2020. The good guys (player pieces) are Bernie Sanders, Elizabeth Warren, Barack Obama, and Hillary Clinton. They're vying to take on Trump in 2020 and filling their Basket of Deplorables along the way. The Deplorables in this game are not meant to be an insult to Trump supporters, rather they are ghoulish caricatures of people in the Trump inner circle, i.e. Steve Bannon, Rudy Giuliani, Vladimir Putin, etc.

The players navigate the campaign trail and participate in debates, compete in primaries/caucuses, navigate scandals, seek endorsements, confer with pollsters, decide whether to run as an independent, etc. Deplorables can be drained from The Swamp and placed in each player's Basket.

219121.name: The Flesh Fortress
219121.description:
From the introduction:

The Flesh Fortress is a living tunnel complex, which lies in the world of Inshabiv. It is a forward base of the demonic incursion and is probably going to be the next site for a major breeding pool. It is a place of unrivalled evil and is run by a depraved demonic being, called the "Surgeon".

The fortress is designed to challenge 4 players of level 10.

219122.name: National Economy
219122.description:
Is population a power or a burden?

if the economy is doing well the population will increase, as the population increase, does it necessary mean that the productivity will also increase? In most worker placement games like Agricola, Stone Age that seems to be the case.

This game plays like a typical worker placement game. At the first round each player has 2 workers and they take turn placing their workers one by one onto the basic tiles. The basic tiles consisted of quarry(get a card and take first player),mining(get a card), construction(build a building), Education(increase a worker). At the end of each round you'd have to pay your worker salaries. If you don't have enough money to pay for the workers this round, you'd have to sell some of your private properties and it'd become public to cover the cost.

Here is the most interesting aspect about this game, unlike most other worker placement games, as long as you place workers in the farming/gathering tile the resource for feeding your people is unlimited, they can create enough food for themselves. In this game, the cash flow is limited even if you place the worker in the market tile you can only receive money up to the amount that is available in the pool. The only way to increase the money in the pool is when players cannot pay for their worker and sell their property to bring cash flow into the game, otherwise, there is no way to add more money. At the end of the game, the sum total of the selling prices of all the assets is the victory point.

in this game, If you want to increase population, you can increase it as you like, but unlike other games, population will not score at all except for the effects of some buildings. On the contrary, if the workers cannot produce they will become a huge burden and consume the economy, making accumulation of wealth absolutely impossible.

Essentially, this players have to learn to balance between development of population and the economy. Too few people can not maximize profits. However, if there are too many people they will eat up the profit. Initially, increased workers to increase productivity seems to be very attractive, but when the workers begin to be a burden in the latter half of the game. there is no way to reduce the workers. There is no family planning nor natural disasters, major famine, massacre and cultural revolution in this game. Once the population have increased and if the economic development does not catch up, you will quickly understand what it means to be debt.

219123.name: Fortress of Iron Heart
219123.description:
From the introduction:

This small fortress was originally a monastery for warrior-monks of the Forgefather. After the demonic invasion, it was turned into a guard post ready to launch counterattacks against demons coming through the gate. It is currently home to several clerics and warrior monks, all ready to lay down their lives to defend their home world.

User summary:

For high-level characters.

219124.name: Sargusa
219124.description:
From the introduction:

A bit off the ship route between Vivine and the colonies near the ancient star port of the high elves lies a vast field of sea weeds that hides wicked cliffs and other obstacles just below the surface. Those who are unfortunate enough to find this place are usually stranded here for the rest of their short and miserable lives.

User summary:

A sandbox adventure for hmid-level characters.

219125.name: Assaut sur la Citadelle du Corbeau
219125.description:
Une courte aventure pour quatre à six personnages joueurs
de niveau 2 à 3

From the introduction:

L'aventure commence lorsque les personnages arrivent dans le village de Kleine. Les PJs peuvent s'y rendre afin de récupérer après avoir terminé une mission précédente, ou ils peuvent simplement être de passage dans la région, ils peuvent aussi avoir entendu de vagues rumeurs au sujet de problémes dans le secteur.

User summary:

A fan-made, abridged, French-language translation, and system conversion of Assault on Raven's Ruin.

219126.name: L'Année du Défi du Prêtre
219126.description:
Une courte aventure pour trois à six personnages joueurs de
niveau 3 à 5

From the introduction:

Ce scénario prend place dans les étendues sableuses de la région des plateaux, à l'extérieur de Tyr, une des cités du monde de campagne de Dark Sun. Vous pouvez facilement l'adapter à toute autre zone de désert de sable, comme il en existe beaucoup sur Athas.

User summary:

A fan-made, French-language translation of "The Year of Priest's Defiance", originally published in Dungeon (Issue 35 - May 1992).

219127.name: Fort Ruksar
219127.description:
Une aventure pour 4 joueurs de niveau 4 à 6

From the introduction:

L'aventure intitulée Fort Ruksar commence alors que les personnages sont embauchés pour une banale mission d'escorte de caravane. Cette caravane marchande doit en effet se rendre vers le nord, dans les montagnes pourpres, où les marchands de la cité d'Antius comptent réaliser de juteux bénéfices en vendant du matériel et des biens de premiére nécessité aux nains de la citadelle assiégée de Kâzgun Ruksar. De nombreux périls attendront les personnages en cours de route, et ne seront que le moindre de leurs soucis car une fois sur place les choses empireront encore...

219128.name: La Serre de Gordorand
219128.description:
Une aventure pour 4-5 joueurs de niveau 1

From the introduction:

Les PJs entrent dans cette aventure an suivant une carte qui les méne à 'La Serre'. Ils pourraient l'avoir découverte dans un trésor lors d'une précédente mission, ou Snooky en aurait laissé une copie dans leur campement alors qu'ils étaient endormis. Dans les deux cas, la carte conduit le groupe jusque l'entrée de 'La Serre' et mentionne la présence d'un trésor caché, mais ne donne pas d'informations quant aux dangers à affronter...

219129.name: Naufrage au Centre de la Terre
219129.description:
Une aventure pour 4-5 joueurs de niveau 1

From the introduction:

Les PJs entrent dans cette aventure an suivant une carte qui les méne à 'La Serre'. Ils pourraient l'avoir découverte dans un trésor lors d'une précédente mission, ou Snooky en aurait laissé une copie dans leur campement alors qu'ils étaient endormis. Dans les deux cas, la carte conduit le groupe jusque l'entrée de 'La Serre' et mentionne la présence d'un trésor caché, mais ne donne pas d'informations quant aux dangers à affronter...

User summary:

A fan-made system conversion of an adventure originally appearing in Casus Belli (Special Issue 12 - Jul 1994).

219130.name: La Quête de l'Epée d'Argent
219130.description:
Une courte aventure pour quatre à six personnages joueurs de niveau 2 à 3

From the introduction:

Dans cette aventure, un groupe d'aventuriers débutants doit venir en aide au petit village de Torlynn. Ce village est mystérieusement tombé sous le joug d'une malédiction, une malédiction qui maintient la région dans un hiver perpétuel. Le burgomaster de Torlynn a découvert que la créature responsable se cache dans des ruines prés de Torlynn, mais il est bien incapable de s'en occuper lui même. Tous ceux qu'il a envoyés la bas auparavant ne sont jamais revenus.

User summary:

A fan-made, abridged, French-language translation, and system conversion of Quest for the Silver Sword.

219131.name: L'Effroi de Dymrak
219131.description:
Une courte aventure pour quatre à sept personnages joueurs de niveau 1 à 3

From the introduction:

L'idée de base de cette aventure est très simple. Les personnages sont des aventuriers novices avides de se prouver à eux même leurs compétences. Ils acceptent donc une mission donnée par un seigneur des bois, qui consiste à rassembler des informations , et la prime qui va avec, sur un chef de guerre gobelin qui apporte réguliérement la mort et la destruction sur les humains et les elfes.

User summary:

A fan-made, abridged, French-language translation, and system conversion of DDA4: The Dymrak Dread.

219132.name: L'Oeil de Traldar
219132.description:
Une aventure pour 4 à 6 personnages de niveau 2 ou 3

From the introduction:

Les personnages joueurs entament un voyage le long d'une route à l'ouest du Grand Duché de Karameikos où ils font la rencontre d'un guerrier poursuivi par des assassins et qui prennent les Pjs pour ces amis. Le résultat est des plus prévisible et les Pjs devront bientôt combattre pour leur vie. Le guerrier les embauchera comme gardes du corps et après un court voyage arriveront dans la ville de Luln où ils seront de nouveau victimes d'une embuscade. Après plusieurs escarmouches, les personnages s'échapperont et se lanceront dans une quête qui les menera vers le Fort du Désastre, la capitale de la Baronnie de L'Aigle Noir.

User summary:

A fan-made, abridged, French-language translation, and system conversion of DDA3: Eye of Traldar.

219133.name: Shadows of Malice: Promo 2016 Card Set
219133.description: A set of ten playable cards which can be incorporated into their respective decks. There are six new treasure cards (Black Tesseract, Blue Tesseract, Colorless Tesseract, Green Tesseract, Red Tesseract, Yellow Tesseract), four fate cards (Crumble to Dust - instant, Curse of Umbral - lasting, Essence Shift - invoked, Mirrorlight - invoked), rules reference card and also a title card.

219134.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Anonymous Survivor Promo
219134.description:
"Rocking a Belt of Gender Swap around his chest, he is ready to die in Kingdom Death, as a woman!"

Contents:

+ 1 Anonymous Survivor Miniature

+1 Anonymous Survivor Small Booklet

+ Story Events (est 1-2)

+1 Unique Base Insert

+ 1 Anonymous Philosophy

+1 Secret Fighting Art

+ 3 Gear Cards

There was once a fan who adored a creation so much that they showed appreciation to its creator whenever they could. One day, the creator, in a fit of excitement-induced madness, surprised the fan by including them in their creation.

The lucky fan whose character the Anonymous Survivor's design is based on will be assisting with the design for this "micro expansion" promo set.

219135.description:
The ultimate survivior, Goth Amy always narrowly escapes death.

She endured the great fall, scrambling in mid-air over plummeting, screaming survivors to land on top of the less fortunate broken bodies below.

She escaped the Dark Seamstress, stealing a blade ond chopping off its grasping hand. Amy found several stubbed bracelet trophies wrapped around its stump.

Even as she awoke falling to her doom, Goth Amy felt an inkling that she belongs. Casting aside fear and compassion, she relished a place where the last threads of her humanity could be cast aside with glee.

This chrossover expansion contains:
1 Goth Amy Miniature
1 Goth Amy Small Booklet
Story Events (est 1-2)
Unique Base Insert
Psychopath Philosophy
1 Secret Fighting Art
3 Gear Cards

Amy is classified as a "Wanderer" which is a new compaign-related system introduced in the Advanced KDM rulebook.
219135.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Goth Amy, the unreveling Crossover
